reviews.review_title: Saw this yesterday, a great movie!
reviews.content: Sure, have your opinion, but my opinion: it was a great movie! Sure, this might do bad in sales in November (which is the Blu-ray and digital release date) my dad thought it was alright, I thought it was a great movie! I barely was even scared, I was only scared of the 2 previews, Overlord and The Nun, But anyways, this movie was awesome! I'm looking forward to the release date on Blu-ray!

reviews.review_title: Unsure as to why this is receiving such hate:
reviews.content: I consider myself to have fairly discerning taste, so I'm disappointed to see such panning of a fairly decent horror film. It pays excellent homage to the creepypasta lore, is well shot, edited, acted, and manages to be "creepy" at its (unfortunately) PG13 rating. Don't fall for the reverse Emperor's New Clothes Syndrome: If you're interested in seeing the film, then I suggest you give it a try despite the abhorrent reviews.

This is the best Movie of all time, no doubt. Many people complaint about it's lack of characther, plot, terribly slow pacing, bad CGI, scenes that were in the trailer and cut from the film. But it's all a metaphor, it's part of the plan, you just don't understand. It all represents Slenderman's lack of face... What more could you expect from Martin Scorsese as a director and Christopher Nolan making the script. This is a master piece. "The Bye Bye Man for a New Generation" lol

Slender Man: The screenplay was a bit thin, actually appalling. The story behind it all was ok, Slender Man appearances linked to the disappearance of thousands of children, how this affected four girls in a small town in Massachusetts, strange events, but this was not translated to the screen effectively.The four young actors, Joey King, Julia Goldani Telles, Jazz Sinclair and Annalise Basso provide good performances but are hampered by the clunky script. The "scary scenes "mostly don't work also due to bad editing, a girl being pulled through a window by tree branches should at least scare a little but here it falls flat. A new take on Slender Man is required. I'll give it 4/10 due to the acting.

reviews.review_title: Better than the bye bye man
reviews.content: I thought the movie was good but not great. I like horror movies based on urban legends and wasn't familiar with slendernan, i thought it was just some kind of video game. I watched a few you tube videos on it and they seemed way different then this movie was but as a feature film of this genre I expected it to be more frightening and gory or something and don't understand why horror movies nowadays all have to be PG and are afraid to go really dark. It had good atmosphere and story was captivating enough but pace was slow and the scares were too tame and there were too many unanswered questions and plot holes. I still give it a 6 out of 10 because it was still a fun summer thriller and the acting was good.

I realize it's hard to come up with an original horror flick these days, but the story was practically given to them and they had no depth to it it was horrible . The filming was terrible there was no backstory there was no chance of survival he looked like the Babadook . It looks like they were handed this story and wanted to make a quick buck but I recommend nobody watches this it's a disappointment and whoever made this was very lazy what a shame .
Way better then expected. I didn't think I would be even the littlest bit scared but when Katie went missing it made me jump a little!!

This is a cute horror, perfect for your pre-teens Halloween sleepover. It's silly and fun, and spooky for the younger kids. It's a kind of wholesome horror haha! Would I recommend it to someone who's a horror fan? No. Would I enjoy spooking the youngsters with it? Yes :D.

WTF is wrong with ppl rating this movie so low. It's intense, unsettling, original & even unpleasant at times. Nothing is ever good for anyone. For me, the visual effects like rapid shapeshifting of faces was real scary. It's definitely well made.

reviews.review_title: I really enjoyed it would give it a 9 but they cut bits at the cinema
reviews.content: Great story line. Good acting from all the cast. Quite a few jumps I'm hoping for more sinister bits when the uncut version comes out. Don't understand why it has such a poor score. It was slow starting but that grew the suspense and the slender man was distorted and eerie

This horror movie made me want to sleep. It was boring and bland. I thought about the ring which is a good horror movie, but this movie is not even good with the jumpscares. I do not know what to compare it with, bye bye man is even a better version. The actors were not bad, but not good either. I feel lied to, the trailer was misleading. Just read the creepypasta and play the game, but do not watch the movie. I want my time, money and my vision of scary slenderman back.

reviews.review_title: Pathetic, but with decent cinematography...so thats good.
reviews.content: Honestly, what do we expect at this point. I don't think I have seen a horror film from a studio like Sony being anything other than a simple run- of- the- mill cash grab. Don't get me wrong, there was potential here. However this potential was squashed even it the Pre production phase. The script was mediocre or cringe inducing depending on either the character, or the scene. The acting for the most part was good, considering what they had to play with. But everything else about the project was predictable and outright trashy. There is nothing new or note worthy here. I felt nothing, for the characters or the story...if that said nothing I don't know what does. The best element of this film was the cinematography. The look of this film did 60% of the work. I felt genuinely unhinged, and it was the use and movement of the camera. Other than that the film had not a lot holding it up.
If Tom and Jerry was made to be a horror movie, it would make a better one than this! Horrible...Yahia Aqel
Very funny 99% scary if watching take cookies but not a 3 year old.

reviews.review_title: Makes CHUD look like The Godfather...
reviews.content: With all the prior shorts, movies, shows, and other resources (many of them good) on the internet, you'd think the film makers would have a wonderful palette of fresh and scary ideas to pull from. They did not. It was absolutely terrible. The plot was completely unoriginal (i.e. high school students conduct a seance), the "figureless" and "mysterious" slender man was continuously portrayed as a very distinct and flamboyant hipster, all the characters were victims...I'm just gonna stop. Don't see it. Write your congressman about the tragedy that is Slender Man.

Slenderman !!!!!!! 2018 cinematic ReleaseA very dissapointing film to watch. After years of waiting thinking that this film will be a new horror success we get a script that is boring and very dull, the writing of this movie was not done well. You do get your jump scares here and there. 
There are dark and scary scenes which are good, however the whole concept and story was disappointing. Lots of things were missing in this film. The cast was good The story was a failure.A 4/10 did not enjoy it

reviews.review_title: About all anyone could really expect from the Slenderman concept and nowhere near worthy of a 3.1 avg. rating.
reviews.content: 5.7/10 Honestly people are being way too harsh to this film calling it the 'worst horror they'd ever seen", and just being completely extreme and vague in their "criticism" without actual legitimate explanations why they hated it. While it definitely isn't a good film overall, it's about the best portrayal you could expect from an internet horror concept which is essentially a very creepy tall faceless figure that takes children and is seen in old pictures that have been clearly photoshopped. The concept is creepy but really has no complexity or depth. This film at least delivers that same ominously bizarre atmosphere with sparing shots of Slenderman with the simple plotting and overall themes. You cant really expect a plot that goes anywhere with that simple subject matter. The film does drag on in between the creepy scenes with the annoying actresses brooding on in their personal terrors. Another huge problem is that Slenderman shows up maybe a total 2 min of the entire film combined, and the scares are very cliche and standard when he's sparingly featured. There is one sequence in the library that is done properly and has a considerable amount of decent scare ambition. The sound design and effects were firing on all cylinders throughout the film and created some very good sonic tension at times. There was also a considerably solid amount of solid camerawork throughout. Before you know it the film is over and the finale is ok at best but very abrupt. This film is the epitome of middle of the road cliche horror with some decent ambition at times, and is in no way deserving of such an embarrassing low rating.

reviews.review_title: The Death of the Horror Genre
reviews.content: We almost got out of it, that bottomless pick of garbage. But this film ended our chances, it breaks my heart. But I think the horror genre is dead, and that's why this is the worst horror film ever made. The acting is horrible, the story is abysmal, its hilarious to watch this horrible accident unfold in front of your eyes.

reviews.review_title: One of the better teen horrors with "realistic" teens
reviews.content:
First off I do not understand the users giving this a 1, unless they truly have never watched any of the tens of thousands micro budget-horrifying acting-no script-horrendous camera work and directing films out there. And it is getting monotonous seeing people write "worst movie ever" repeatedly. So my 10 may be inflated to offset these inexperienced film viewers ( I'd have given this a solid 7, maybe 8).
Back to my review... First thing that struck me was this movie actually utilized actors that looked and behaved like real teenagers. Unlike many teen based films where they appear in their 30s and act like immature 20 something year olds. While their are so many variations of the Slender Man legend, including the factual murder case that occured in Wisvonsin in 2014, this film did effectively capture a few of those story lines. The use of shadows, visuals just barely seen and the music were also all very effective. The additional hallucenogenic visuals and that of Slender Man himself were also pretty good, sometimes the CGI was a but too obvious. Overall this movie was able to create an atmospheric, supernatural, myth based teen horror without gratuitous violence or nudity often found in movies attempting to attract a teen fan base.

reviews.review_title: I damn near pooed my pants (definitely peed)
reviews.content: This was my first scary movie ive ever seen and I'm 19, Through out the hole movie I couldn't control bowels, Kept me on the edge of my seat the entire movie I would recommend this movies to anyone of my homies

Slender Man is a poor teen horror movie with a troubled production. It had post production editing where scenes from the movie trailer were absent from the final product.Four bored teenage girls in a small town in Massachusetts summon the internet meme of the Slender Man. They want to prove that he does not exist.Soon people start to go missing. There is a shadowy thin figure lurking.The movie is a combination of Candy Ma and The Ring. Unfortunately the film is inept and dull.There are a couple of creepy scenes but you might better off seeing the films that inspired it.

I'm sorry but if you thought this was a legitimate horror movie, you do not know horror. This movie is what we like to call a huge dumpster fire. It's not scary, the plot sucks, and the acting is terrible. It's not even one of those movies that's "so bad it's good". It's just bad. All bad.

reviews.review_title: Nowhere near as bad as people say
reviews.content: Let me say, I am an avid horror fan, and ill admit I have a soft spot for these teen horror films. This one had more to offer than say the original Ouija from a few years ago, but not as much as truth or dare from this year. One thing I will point out as a negative is that the acting and dialogue was a bit off in some points. However, I thought the cinematography (especially in the woods) made up for that. I liked the characters in the movie, and thought they were given enough characteristics that made them more well rounded than your average horror movie. Overall, I liked it alot more than I didn't. This movie has been hated way more than it should have.

reviews.review_title: Actually Pretty Good, But Could Be Better
reviews.content: I just got back from seeing Slender Man, and honestly it was pretty good. Good acting, immense amounts of suspense, and Slender Man had a great costume. The story moved along decently with the characters. However, no movie is perfect, and this movie was surely missing or lacking certain traits. For one, the backstories of the characters weren't that explained. Other than the character Katie, who has an alcoholic father as the movie explained, no other character backstories were revealed or told. This might cause viewers to not get as attached or have as many feelings to/for the characters, which is the whole point of the movie. Furthermore, they could have done better with the effects. This is because about half of the special effects were noticeably effects. Don't get me wrong, some of them were good, but some were just only ok. In one scene (SPOILERS AHEAD), the main character Hallie has a dream/illusion that she is pregnant, and tentacles start to poke through her stomach. This scene isn't too well edited and is noticeably CGI. Another scene is where Hallie's friend Wren gets grabbed by tree branches (Slender Man's tentacles) and gets pulled out of a window. The tree branches did not have many textures to it, causing it to blatantly appear as CGI animation. Finally, my last reason for how Sony could've done better, is give Slender Man a backstory. Many people walking in to the auditorium may not know who this demon/entity is. Therefore, because Slender Man was never given a backstory, since he was created in a photoshop contest, Sony should have given one to him so movie viewers could better understand what material they are working with.Don't get me wrong, I thought this movie was pretty great for what it is, but there were some things they could have done better.

It's by no means great, but it's not trash what I sort of expected.. The set up, atmosphere and many of the scares are actually pretty good! The eerie nature and arguably somewhat "Lovecraftian" aspect of the antagonist is portrayed well and while it's not a deep psychological horror, it is not a jumpscare marathon either, at least it doesn't rely purely on those what so many modern horror movies do. It has some genuine sense of dread and tension which is sadly quite rare. I liked it!

reviews.review_title: Great movie ... keeps you feeling uneasy throughout
reviews.content: Please disregard any negative ratings. I almost missed this movie because I was believing the negative ratings. No it is not the Conjouring, Sinister or the Sixth Sense but it is a great watch. We were sitting as deeply into our seats as we could cringing over what was coming next. Truly creepy fun scary movie night.

reviews.review_title: Slender Man better than I thought it was going to be
reviews.content: I know a lot of people didn't like the movie However I find thats cause other people got too wrapped up in the Slender Man memes fortunately I did not or they're just going along with whatever everyone else says about the movie... I admit somethings in that movie could have been done better such as camera moving around too much as well as some of the acting could have been better... however in my oppinion there were a lot of things in that film I enjoyed then again my idea of a horror/psychological thriller id different to most for instance I really enjoyed that it wasn't overdone with blood and gore like most horrors do to me that doesn't make a good movie.. The other thing I enjoyed was from start to finish it had a creepy tone which made it hard to know when the monster was going to appear... the false jump scares I found actually worked for most of the film the only I didn't like with the false jump scares was the library scene where they way overdid it to the point that when monster appeared and did something it wasn't scary they used the scares up with all the jump scares... In my oppinion it's not a bad movie I found the story was interesting I liked the use of the terrain and as a psychological thriller which is what this movie is in my oppinion It does that side of the job well... the creepy music kept me on the edge of my seat.. I felt there really was a mystery to the movie... I say go see it and make up your own mind

reviews.review_title: Everything i wanted in a slenderman movie
reviews.content: Can't seem to understand what all the hate is about,it was pretty good and to be honest better than the conjuring 2
This movie is a waking nightmare. It reminds me of nightmares I had as a child. Rarely am I scared at movies though this one actually freaked me out.

reviews.review_title: Let me guess, everyone is gonna hate on it
reviews.content: Take it for what it is. You are watching a movie based off of a scary-fun character out of a game. Is it innovative? No. But it's not the "worst movie ever" like everyone loves to say about horror flicks nowadays. Go into it ready for some jump scares.. that's literally the game!Now, with that being said, the most notable negatives are character development and the the frequency of Slender Man. When I got out of the theater I couldn't even remember the characters names. The only one I could remember was Wren who was the worst and best character in the film simulatenously. Also, they made slenderman out to be summoned and whatnot, like The Ring, which in my opinion was a lost opportunity. I feel having Slender Man just exist out there in the world and prey on unsuspecting victims would be more intriguing. Because of this lack of origin, it sort of had me going, "so wait.. where did he even come from then?"Some of the acting was straight up cringeworthy, and some of the jump scares were completely unnecessary. The beauty of Slender Man is your ability to hear nothing but your footsteps on the leaves. The dead silence is what's terrifying. If any movie needed more silence, it would be this movie. Also, if any movie needed unexpected Slender Man placements, It would be this movie. Everytime he shows up, you know it's coming, and this totally defeats the purpose of this character!! Not knowing when or where he's going to appear is the beauty of the game to begin with!All that to say, I had some fun with it.. there are some notably uncomfortable moments that'll stick with me for a long to come, and open-minded viewers will probably agree to this. Just go in without your movie critic hat on. No one goes a day without that thing anymore.

Sure, it's a metaphor-a fact that was only really clear at the very end of the movie, but the story itself, wasn't always clear. And it certainly wasn't scary-and I scare EASILY! Sorry, given the information surrounding this internet myth, this movie was terribly disappointing.

If I could rate this a zero, I would. I was hoping that this film would at least be "so bad it's good" but it literally has nothing going for it. Bad acting, shocking script, no scares. Stay away from this trash. It's not entertaining on any level.

reviews.review_title: If I could go lower than one star, I would.
reviews.content: I really hate being mean spirited toward movies; especially those with a predominantly young cast, such as this. Acting is obviously an incredibly difficult profession and I would hate for this movie to ruin the careers of several young stars whom may become amazing actresses. So please, don't judge these young women by the horrendous, travesty of a script given to them. Yes, they were horrible in this movie, but they deserve a real shot with REAL WRITERS! With that being said..... this is without any doubt in my mind, the absolute worst movie that I have ever paid to watch. I'm not going justify the efforts that the production team put into this by trying to point out what went wrong, as they obviously don't care whether they ever make another movie.

I recently signed up for AMC A-List, meaning I get three complimentary movies a week and other benefits for $20 per month. The problem here is that I should've been paid to waste ninety minutes of my youth on this... movie? It's not really a movie, just like an uncooked frozen pizza is not really a meal. It's not so bad it's good. It's so bad it's scary, and not in the good way.A movie based on one of the Internet's most popular and frightening creepypastas should've yielded a decent film. But without a solid flow in the storyline, and WITH plenty of cliches, bland acting, and poor CGI, this is a heap of trash.How do you make Slender Man go away? Show him this movie!

reviews.review_title: What a pile of foul smelling garbage
reviews.content: I really have nothing to say about this film. It's that bland. The difference between it and TV static is that I don't have any hopes from static. Imagine some guys doing scary video bits on TikTok, like five or six of them, then thinking about how to turn them into a full feature movie. So they take a bunch of teenage looking girls, write a nonsensical script and have them run around like headless chickens. At random intervals they add the TikTok videos. Film done!

Not just to pile on on a low-rated movie, this one's biggest and worst problem is how insufferably boring it is.
With regards to the plot, it feels as if it was written very slowly over a very long period of time, by someone who did not bother to read what they had already written so as to actually keep up with their own ideas.
Things happen and are inexplicably dropped minutes later. One of the main protagonist girls goes missing and a token attempt to find her is made by her friends and the townsfolk. Her father has a rather extreme incident of harassing her friends about where she is. Then inexplicably she's never mentioned by anyone ever again except for the protagonists and only with regards to Slender Man.
An attempt is made to contact Slender Man and "give" him something that they each love. This is never even mentioned by any of them for almost a full half hour afterward.
The amount of fixation with the "celebrity" of Slender Man seems to be overwhelming everything else about the film. We are constantly told about how cunning and dangerous Slender Man is, and how he spreads all throughout the internet with his mythos, but we never see anything like this in the film. Anything involving SLender Man's actions in the film are incoherent and have to be explained after the fact in order for us to realize what is even happening, otherwise it all comes across as a completely random ghostly haunting from the ghost of something that might not even be sentient.
It's only very close to the end that the movie seems to remember that it had a plot once, and scrambles to catch up.
All of the above is enough to crater a movie, but it could've still been a watchable and even fun experience. Unfortunately, the movie is insufferably boring on top of all of it.

WARNING: *SPOILERS*One day I just decided to have fun by watching a terrible horror film so I saw Slender Man which turned out to be even worse than I thought.Slender Man follows a group of teenage girls that are fascinated by the lore of Slender Man and decide to summon him, leading to one of them going missing.For a movie about the Slender Man, I really didn't expect much but this has got to be one of the worst and lamest horror films that I've ever seen. Every single horror movie trope/cliché you can think of is in Slender Man and manages to execute them worse than a lot of horror films. There is pretty much no story or interesting characters to follow and instead we have a bunch of idiotic girls that are incredibly bland and make decisions that are very stupid. The only time they decide to group together and discuss or explore the Slender Man is at night. Is it not possible to do this inside or at daytime? In one scene a girl says "Take me" to Slender Man and as he gets closer she decides to scream and run away which makes no sense. The girls also perform a ritual where they have to close their eyes until they hear three church bell sounds and despite knowing this one of them opens their eyes too early leading to her getting attacked by Slender Man which I don't understand. If you're scared of Slender Man then surely you would follow the instructions of the mythology clearly to make sure you're safe.It seemed the film was solely interested in scaring the audience and it completely fails in that department also. There is a heavy reliance on jumpscares which were handled so poorly and some of the effects used were downright laughable. In one scene, a girl and a guy she loves start to kiss but then she begins to hallucinate where the guy makes a laughably bad demon face. The look of Slender Man itself was terrible. It's like the crew making the film didn't even bother a single bit. It's also strange how the film was made recently when the craze for Slender Man ended years ago.All in all, Slender Man is absolutely atrocious. All the performances were awful, the scares were cheaply executed and the story was SOOOO BORING! At least now I can say I watched Slender Man all the way through as if it were some achievement.

After tragic events actually happened because of this character, this is just just sick. So glad it wasn't shown in our area in Milwaukee , especially since a girl almost died because of this garbage.

I dont understand why people don't like this movie..it was not only scary but chilling. It added so many horror elements and put them together. This movie is truely something to experince. If you liked films like IT you will love this one. The charcaters were a little basic and the acting wasn't amazing but besides that everything was great. It delivered well. Watch it and by the way don't let your desison for a movie rely on reviews...some people will love movies others hate so expernice it for yourself!!

Slender Man The biggest problem with Internet urban legends is that the supernatural entities are always so judgy and mean-spirited.Luckily, the meme monster in this horror movie doesn't have very much to say on any topic.When their friend (Annalise Basso) disappears, three teens (Joey King, Jaz Sinclair, Julia Goldani Telles) contact the fabled Slender Man, a featureless figure who haunts the web, for help in finding her. But during their meeting the girls make eye-contact with the gaunt giant and are cursed with madness. The only way to stop him now is to give him want he desires.Inspired by the real-life legend that has claimed some real victims, this fictional account ignores reality opting for a more Bloody Mary vibe. Unfortunately, the scares are cheap, the acting amateurish and the overall execution is ham-fisted.Besides, just like every scam on the Internet, Slender Man is really a Russian hacker. Red Lightvidiotreviews.blogspot.ca

I went into this movie with no expectatations and had a great time! It's intense, scary, and does exactly what it's supposed to do... if you want a creepy movie to watch on your freetime, this is it. For my full, spoiler free review, please vist PopGamer1202 on YouTube :)

reviews.review_title: Slender Man should've taken me instead.
reviews.content: Five years too late I'm afraid, although to be quite frank the year of release does not matter. It's still a terrible film regardless. Have Hollywood seriously run out of ideas that they are now resorting to popular viral memes? 'The Bye Bye Man' meets 'The Ring' with a sprinkle of every other generic horror film from the past ten years. Was so close to walking out, honestly. A small group of friends watch a video that will "summon Slender Man", which consequently allows the titular mythological being to haunt them and possibly "take them to a secret world". Aside from the dreary cinematography and a decent performance from King, there is nothing to make me recommend this. Nothing! For a creature that's supposed to be well hidden, he seems to be flipping damn everywhere. Does Slender Man ever catch a break? Is this his full time job? Stalking children and taking them? I wonder what we could compare that to...(hint: a well-dressed pedophile)! Sorry not sorry. It's just another case of stupid characters doing insufferably stupid things. "Don't watch the video", "Ok I won't"...guess what? They watched it. "Don't take your blindfold off", "Ok I won't"...guess what? They did. The constant prowling in the woods in the middle of the night in total solitude was relentlessly dumb. Of course he is going to take you, you're all practically offering yourselves to him! Want me to make a sign for you? "We luv Slender Man. Take us! xoxox". Christ! The reliance of jump scares is fine, I expected it. But when they aren't even frightening, it just infuriates me. Enough with the loud pointless noises of someone walking! The cheap visual effects and horrifically terrible ending was the icing on the cake. I was done. No more. I'm out. Slender Man, I offer myself to you. Take me or, better yet, take your inept film and merge it into a tree.

reviews.review_title: It's Just As Bad As Everyone Says
reviews.content:
Pros:
1. The film is competently shot. It's nothing special but it gets the job done.
2. The grey, black and blue colour palette cements an empty and oppressive atmosphere.
3. There are a few genuinely creepy moments that send shivers down your spine.
4. The sound-mixing is fantastic and it does the heavy-lifting in regards to creating the tension and suspense.Cons:
1. The dialogue is often very clunky which makes the character interactions feel forced.
2. The score is massively overused and overbearing.
3. For some strange, and unexplored, reason, Mr. Jensen (Kevin Chapman) suspects and attacks Hallie (Julia Goldani Telles) for kidnapping Katie (Annalise Basso).
4. There are a plethora of idiotic character decisions which are clearly just inserted for forced horror and drama moments.
5. Most of the jump-scares are obnoxious and they fail to land.
6. The character and plot development are pretty much nonexistent, which makes it extremely difficult for you to care for any of the characters, or for what's going on.
7. The editing in the horror scenes is over-the-top and ridiculously stupid.
8. The CGI looks absolutely awful.
9. The acting is stale and obviously forced at times.

If you're in search of a film that'll scare you like crazy or really give you the heevy-jeevies this is not the movie you should see. The film lacked a lot of sense among the 4 main characters and even some support characters were completely left from the film. It is also a little late to fall on the band wagon for the Slender Man gimmick which was at it's peak around 2013-2014 with a video game that really grew to popularity.There were a lot of cool things they could've done with Slender man. However, it seems like the creativity of this film was lacking immensely as it was extremely predictable beyond all belief. This seems like a film that could've been made by college students but it being made by a studio is quite laughable. The special effects in the film were also laughable too. Especially this one support character named Tom, where his face stretches about and his head quickly jerks about like you may see in any other horror film. I went into this expecting it to be nothing special and that's what I got. If you're interested in a fun and interesting take on Slender Man as a character there is a Youtube series known as Marble Hornets which portrays a much scarier and thrilling experience for free.

reviews.review_title: It's not that bad: it has some scary parts
reviews.content: This movie is definitely watchable. Oscar worthy? Definitely not but worth a watch. There is always something inherently scary about something based on true events that revolves around urban legends. The people who have it negative reviews? I bet they wouldn't dare try to conjure Slender Man so in essence, the movie did its job.

reviews.review_title: What an Incredibly Underrated film, I truly don't understand the large amount of hate!
reviews.content:
Provocative, engaging, and for the most part intelligent- Slender Man may fall short of a full conclusion, but makes up for it in its earlier content and direction. The film has its flaws, there is no doubt about that. The acting from some of the characters, namely Jaz Sinclair (and quite a few supporting actors), are quite obvious and corny. However, that isn't to say the film has terrible acting as a whole. Both Joey King and Julia Goldani Telles give their performances all they can throughout the film, and I would never think for a second they were bad in those roles. I thought they fit the film perfectly, both in acting, and in tone, and I felt they made the right casing choices for what the film needed. Annalise Basso also gives my favorite performance in the film, as short as it is, as her character feels incredibly grounded and focused every time she is on screen. The formula is a bit typical for this type of film, and can seem a bit predictable and/or tedious to watch. However, for the most part, the film is pretty interesting to watch. It's interesting to delve into the minds of these characters and see what the future has hold for them, and it's quite impressive what these actresses have in store for these roles. My biggest problem with the film is the ending, as it seems remarkably abrupt, and almost as if they didn't have time to edit it with any sort of real conclusion. It basically gives you all you need to keep going, but it still feels more like a glimpse of what the ending actually was going to be, than any sort of true conclusion. That all being said, I did enjoy the tone of the film very much, and found it to be incredibly atmospheric and quite nice to look at. The cinematography is very well done, and I surprisingly enjoyed the look ad interpretation of Slender Man throughout the film. In the end, Slender Man is not a great film by any means, but it certainly is an underappreciated gem in the horror world, and I urge those who haven't seen it to go in with an open mind if they ever do decide to watch it.
My Rating: 7.5/10

A from-the-top-down disaster commits the cardinal sin of horror - it's excruciatingly boring; it's a poorly constructed script chock full of characters I couldn't care less about; choices made on & off camera are inanely hollow.

reviews.review_title: Teenage models being hunted by PS3 graphics.
reviews.content:
Before I unleash my true hate for this movie, I will mention what works in it, giving credit where credit is due. The movie was in focus, for around 30 seconds the dialogue wasn't bad and there were around 2 seconds of scary imagery.
Now with a few points, I will mention the things that make it one of the worst horror movies of the 21st century.
1. The story makes no sense. Scenes just sort of happen and end. This is probably due to the fact that the studio had to cut out a major piece of this movie. This movie isn't The Magnificent Ambersons, a bit of gore wouldn't save it, though I hope the original cut was more cohesive.
2. No rules. 'It Follows' is a great horror movie, which establishes the rules of our antagonist throughout the movie. Here slender-man does all sorts of things, so you can only sit and observe sloppily put together scenes of things happening.
3. Jump scares. While they didn't startle me, when I looked around, people were constantly jumping due to the loud sound effects. It would be alright if these jump scares were earned, but putting a loud noise because a character walks by is the laziest garbage.
4. Boring. It's not bad enough to be 'so bad it's funny'. I only laughed 2 times and chuckled 4. Not enough laughs to spend money, gas and time for the sake of laughing at the weird decisions of the filmmaker.
I genuinely hope that movies that don't rely on cliches and cheap tricks like Hereditary will pop up every once in a while even if audiences won't give them millions of dollars.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I have ever paid to see
reviews.content: This movie was simply awful. I have retyped this review 5 times to find the right way to drive my point across. The best way I can put it is that I honestly thought half way through the movie that I was watching a fan-made joke reel of terrible acting and the worst CGI since the second Scorpion King. The cast and crew have destroyed my only-recently-regained-faith in cinema. Because of this movie, I don't know if I will ever go to the theater again. It is seriously that bad.

Cinematography and lighting is awful. Shots too close and hard to make out what exactly is going on the screen. Loose storytelling with sloppy pacing. Characters forgettable but not necessarily unlikeable. Interesting moments here and there but doesn't do anything with them. Headache inducing shots and cinematography.

reviews.review_title: Opportunity to scary the teens failed
reviews.content: I don't think anyone was scared of this film not even the teenagers it was aimed at. It's mostly confused plot with poor screen play. A total disregard for the slender man does't help this film at all. The dialogue bewteen characters is poor with the ending being really very poor. I'm not sure any one would like this move much, not even slender man.

As soon as I saw this was rated PG-13 I knew it wouldn't be all it could have. That being said, it wasn't a bad movie. There were some parts that were childish horror, but it had a good plot and played that out most of the time.

The stage curtains open ...The Slender Man walks among us. We just can't see him, until we really want to.Taking a chapter out of "The Ring", four teenage girls decide to summon the Slender Man by calling up an online video and following the directions they read before it plays. They watch ... they close their eyes ... and on the 3rd bell tone, they open them again - never to be the same. It was all done on a whim, none of them really knowing what they were doing, or really even caring. It was just something to do when you're bored and watching POV porn together on a laptop. As one of the girls says when watching said porn, "Some things you just can't un-see." I'm sure they all wished they could un-see the Slender Man video.One by one, they are all taken victim to the Slender Man in different ways after various sightings and attempts of appeasing him. Until it comes down to the last of the four girls - who is willing to do whatever it takes to protect her younger sister, now involved despite her attempts to keep her away from it all.The acting was something to be desired. The script and dialogue run-of-the-mill and generic. Basically the same teenage dialogue that is in pretty much every horror film of this caliber. The same story line - discovering weird drawings, online videos, mysterious chat sessions, etc ... nothing new or surprising here. They all even knew each other's laptop passwords too apparently, as they had no problem accessing them.The strength of this movie is in its visuals. The Slender Man "sightings" were fun. The cinematography was actually pretty good with excellent camera and CG work. They didn't overdose you on the Slender Man, keeping him a haunting mystery until the movie's final scenes. And even then, it wasn't overdone. The movie's sound was also very well done, keeping an ominous and dark overtone throughout.This wasn't really that bad overall. Not exactly good either though. I wouldn't recommend it, but I would say it's worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: Why this is so underrated? Was it really that bad? - I don't think so
reviews.content:
Same here, I enjoyed this movie! The only thing which was slightly bothersome was the lighting of the movie, it was pitch black. But other than that it was OK! And it had a PLOT! Acting: well again, not that bad. Sorry you can be too picky in this genre and all in all this was a decent entry.
Ps: people who complains that they did not get it what was this film about, READ and learn more about this dark internet meme :)
