At least we had a good time, but I am rating it 1/10 because of the misleading title as "horror".
The effects were scary and the acting was scary,but....yeah it was awful.

reviews.review_title: What the hell is everyone's problem?
reviews.content: Directed by Sylvain White (whom I'm in no way familiar with), Slender Man is a 2018 horror film based on the internet meme of the same name. It (supposedly) Stars Joey King, along with Annalise Basso, Julia Goldani Telles, and Jazz Sinclair as a group of four teenage friends. During a school trip, one of them, Katie (Basso) disappears miraculously. This leads the other three friends to try and investigate. But all hell breaks loose, as they soon fall into the same fate, one by one.Ever since it's theatrical release, this film has been railroaded by critics, especially the mass majority. Because of this, I was reluctant to go and see it, specifically with my mom; as instead, we went and saw Christopher Robin, and we both enjoyed it very much. With that said, I (finally) managed to pull it up online, and finally watched it. Is it is bad as it's been made out to be? No, actually, it's not. I'm sorry to say that actually found this movie very unnerving.Many people (mostly on YouTube) act like it fails on every level, which (at least, in my opinion) is in no way the case. It's well shot, has great tension, and the acting (for the most part) isn't half bad; I actually felt bad for these four girls and what was happening to them. And despite having top billing, Joey King isn't the real star of the film; she's not even in it all that much. The true star of the film is Julie G. Telles as Hallie. While not great, she gives quite a decent performance.I'm not entirely sure how this movie could've turned out better, specifically for social media. Many have complained that it came out too late, while others complained that it's PG-13 and not R-rated; yeah, sounds a lot like 20 % of the criticism on Venom. I partially agree with this as there was clearly a scene in the trailer that would've warranted it an R-rating. However, I can assure everyone that no horror movie is required to have an R-rating; implying that it's going to have blood and gore.Lastly, many have said that they found the whole thing unintentionally hilarious. Last time I checked, Ouija 2 (also pg13) had some unintentionally funny bits. Yet, that film had been praised by many.Overall, this is a film that does not deserve all the hate that it's gotten. Maybe if it had a different title, or if the premise didn't involve a "dated" creepypasta meme, it would've gotten a better reputation. I can't be sure if it gains said reputation in the future, but it is possible.

My best friend and I walked into the theater last night excited and taking the horrible reviews with a grain of salt. It took me about 10 minutes into the movie to remember that I was actually watching a horror movie and it was only because one of the main characters mentioned Slender Man. After the initial "introduction sequence" we hoped the horror would escalate into something truly memorable, and that's what we got.
Its just not what we hoped for.The characters in the movie are very, very bland. We have Katie, Hallie, Wren, and Chloe, a group of teenage girls who end up summoning Slender Man by watching a video in which they're instructed to close their eyes after hearing the bells toll, which allows him to enter their realm. After Katie goes missing, the friends seem worried about their friend, but eventually they seem very nonchalant about the entire thing and Hallie enters her own world of denial: there is no way Slender Man is real and Katie probably just ran away. There is no true horror in the entire film, even the intended "jumpscares" weren't enough to jolt anyone out of their seat. One by one the girls either disappear or their minds get taken over by Slender Man and they become very ill. 
The only really MEMORABLE part in this entire movie was very unexpected. We find Hallie visiting her crush (Tom) at his house where they start making out on his sofa. His face eventually morphs into Slender Man, leaving Hallie screaming and fighting against him. I HAVE NEVER LAUGHED SO HARD IN MY LIFE!! It was so UNINTENTIONALLY FUNNY!! Our stomachs were hurting so bad and we almost couldn't breathe!! We saw a scene very similar to this in Truth or Dare, but this was far worse than anything we have ever seen. This scene in particular made me add another star to my overall rating.
Skipping ahead to the ending, we are HUGE fans of movies that leave a rather open ending, but not at all how this movie was done. We find out that Hallie's little sister (Lizzie) went to Wren and wanted to learn how to summon Slender Man, much to Hallie's horror. (This is after Hallie's sister is admitted into the hospital for panic attacks and hallucinations) After viewing the video evidence, we see that Wren is standing outside of her window, about to jump to her demise until Hallie pulls her back in and a tearful Wren tells Hallie that there is no way to stop him; he wants all of the girls and there is nothing they can do to stop him. Wren is eventually taken by Slender Man and Hallie ends up sacrificing herself so he would leave her little sister alone, and the movie ultimately ends. 
It was a very, very displeasing ending to any movie, ever. We are left with very little closure; what happened AFTER Wren and Hallie disappeared? What ACTUALLY happened to Lizzie after her sister disappeared and how did she recover? It was very hard to see who the main character really was. We were rooting for Wren, but once Hallie was the only one left, we realized that the LEAST likeable character in the entire movie was the protagonist the entire time and it was eventually turned into a story about how Hallie sacrificed herself to protect Lizzie. The plot didn't have any clear direction, as if they just rushed to make this movie and get it out to the public, despite so many flaws and horrible effects to truly make this one of (if not THE) the worst movie of the year. A movie that could have been so promising didn't even stand a chance.

All the hate surrounding it kind of got me curious, along with the creepypasta backstory. Since I had time to kill, and a cinema nearby. I decided I would check it out. While you could say it's past its used by date, a good 5 years or so, when this titular being was the talk of the net. And the stigma of a true-to-life attempted murder in the name of the slender man means unwanted negative attention. Still the story could be effective if in the right hands, but 'Slender Man' mostly drops the ball with something rather superficial, and quickly produced with the feeling of wanting to forget and move on.I found it simply mediocre... dreary, yet glossed up horror with plenty of blank stares... well, outside a nervy Joey King performance. There are terrible elements sure (e.g the dialogues and pacing), but i didn't hate myself for seeing it. Some slick atmospheric visuals (in spite of all the dark shadowy cinematography), effective sound design (snapping branches & trees rustling in the wind) and a chopped up feel to the narrative's structure (despite not purposely doing it thanks to studio interference in the editing room) kind of gave off a disorienting dreamscape logic blurring time and space of random scene transitions and incomplete character arcs that "for me" kinda worked. It had a "feel in the blanks'' structure with a lot of foreshadowing. A real mess of sorts and little in the way of Slender Man frights, but those few moments, especially involving King showed promise. It actually had me thinking of Wes Craven's 'My Soul to Take', especially the dreamlike air playing around with the character's gradual loss of reality, and the encroaching fear that sees them caught up in a nightmare of no escape. Once he comes calling, there's no going back.I would be interested in seeing the full uncut version though. Would it make it any better, I don't know (...plot coherence probably), but I have a feeling the tone would be different especially those cut scenes which were in the first trailer.
Very good,but with very little scary moments, not that bad as grade says, i recommend the movie

The only scary thing about this movie is the amount of people who were psyched to see it. The jump scares wouldn't even fool a 5 year old and if you want to watch a horror movie then this is definitely not it. The movie is supposed to be a horror but it's more like a comedy. Abysmal performance bringing shame to one of the best horror video games money can buyOverall it had the potential to be a perfect movie but it falls short of the line.

I have watched a great horror movie. Unfortunately "Slender Man" was not it. Not even close. Aimless, listless, and useless. Not that the idea of the Slender Man as a frightening character is a bad one; it's just extremely poorly executed with this production. Frankly, internet posts on the myth are more frightening than this movie. Do you get the idea that I do not like this movie? Well, you are wrong: I HATE this movie.

Slender Man (2018) is a tragedy. This film is a failure to launch. The film has some great scenes of tension, but they are bogged down by boring and generic characters, clunky dialogue, over-the-top effects, and lame plot execution. The only things that save this movie from being utter garbage are the cool visuals and the decent suspense that occurs when Slenderman is on screen. The scenes with Slenderman would be better if the soundtrack was any bit memorable. The final nail in the coffin is the ending. I won't spoil it, but it is highly dissatisfying. All in all, this film has a good Slenderman, but that's the only thing it has going for it.
It is so bad that it makes even the worst horror movie look like a masterpiece

I didn't even finish watching it, and the only reason why I didn't stop sooner was because there was still some popcorn left for me to eat. The image is extremely dark. It's not scary, it's not tense, it's not interesting, it's not fun. It is boring and annoying. I guess the movie might be ok if you're a blind person, not being able to see anything for about 90 minutes wouldn't be a big deal for you.

reviews.review_title: Amazing!!! Easily one of the best movies ever made!
reviews.content: First off all of the comments about how this movie are bad are just being mean. This movie was full of heart and had lots of work put into it to present the audience with the best representation of slender man known to man. Regarding the movie, the beginning starts slow and offers some of the best storytelling I have ever had the privilege of witnessing. After a good intro filled with laughs and a reprenstation of high schoolers that very accurately tells of how I had spent high school it goes into the actual movie and how slenderman slowly inserts himself into the minds of curious kids who think that the supernatural and it's influences are just games. Through a series of intense sequences of dialog and quick scenes of suspense the directors make use of the greatest influence of literary influence also known as pathos to get the viewers to not even want to blink so they won't miss anything. Many people dislike this movie but I believe that is just the mob mentality holding the them from wanting to physically express their love for this masterpiece. I could go on and on about all the things that make this movie a future legend but I am going to stop myself at just saying that this movie is a must see and I strongly reccomend anyone who wants to go to the movies and see something that will keep them on the edge of their seat while delivering easily the best movie that has ever been made.

Sony screwed up. Again!The movie is filled with clichés and is pretty boring. Heck, Slenderman Himself has more emotion than the girls which makes no sense since slendy has no face. Atleast this is better than the dreadful emoji movie.
Yeah, very atmospheric, well created and overall very creepy. Surprised it has been slated

reviews.review_title: A poor adaption of a great Creepypasta
reviews.content: So much potential for that scary/creepy character that is Slenderman! There's a saying that say : Less is better. In that case, the director stuffed the movie with a poor scenario, poor acting, poor dialect and poor special effect in a movie that could have been great if they would only focus on keeping a tension with only subtle but effective apparition of the Slenderman just like the photo in which he appears. The original Blair's witch project movie, the Paranormal Activity movies, Sinister are a few examples of simple scare but how effective. We need another shoot at that Creepypasta!

Dumbest movie made!! Stop making movies where teenage girls give in to show they are weak and stupid, common sense please!!!
Today's film writers are NOT impressive whatsoever!!

The people that made this movie must have just brainstormed all the possible ways to make a terrible movie and then combined all the ideas together to produce this piece of garbage film. Would rather tug my meat with a cheese grater then rewatch this nonsense excuse for a movie

Apart from a few impressively creepy images on the internet, I was unfamiliar with the idea and concept of 'the Slender Man'. To quote Wikipedia, 'The Slender Man (also known as Slenderman) is a fictional supernatural character that originated as a creepypasta Internet meme created by Something Awful forums user Eric Knudsen (also known as "Victor Surge") in 2009. He is depicted as a thin, unnaturally tall humanoid with a featureless head and face and wearing a black suit.' I'm still not sure I'm any the wiser!This then, is the film based around the character. And sadly, despite the efforts of a young cast saddled with irritating dialogue centred around writer David Birke's idea of teen dilemmas (affairs of the heart, usually), this is a fairly half-hearted affair. It owes some of its ideas to the central concept of 'The Ring (1999)' and employs much use of mobile phones to communicate events. The title character looks good, but is really just another 'bogeyman' whose function it is to traumatise flirting adolescents and administer death by CGI. With such a potentially creepy central character, I'm not sure this is the best use of his talents.My favourite character is Wren. Actress Joey Taylor transcends the triteness of some of her dialogue and emerges as not only the most likeable lass of the bunch, but someone you actually do not wish to see fall victim of the machinations of the Slender Man. Director Sylvain White cloaks most scenes in an effective, sinister cold shadow and the ambient score by Ramin Djawadi and Brandon Campbell does its best to sustain the atmosphere. Ultimately however, 'Slender Man' is disappointingly dull.

reviews.review_title: Don't see it!! Waste of your money
reviews.content: Waste of your money! I wouldn't even consider it an ok horror film!! It's pretty bad!

There was a lot of good work put into this movie. The casting, in my opinion, was awesome. I really felt that these five girls were believably cool and believably New England. I appreciated the move away from typical bland horror movie casting. I also believed that these girls would hang out with each other; again, it was believeable to me that these girls were in the same social circle. I super appeciated that the filmmakers shot in Massachusetts as opposed to LA. LA's great and all, but South Pasadena does not New England make. The location for this film was beautiful and absolutely necessary. These two aspects really worked for me, it is necessary for good horror to pay attention to realistic details - the movie is scarier as a result, and the experience feels authentic.There were some major story problems. I'll explain without spoilers. There was some slight allusion to the actual news story surrounding slender man, but I did think filmmakers could be more daring in this way. Amityville, Psycho, Texas Chainsaw ... there is a long list of films that have loosly based their stories around real events, and I think this film could have come closer to the actual horrific newsstory. There were nods, perhaps, but it seemed too reserved, which made me feel I was watching a movie made by a bunch of 'fraidy cats, which made me feel safe and protected from controversy, which is the opposite of what making a movie about slender man should have been. Also, there was no need to invent the summoning. Again, here, the original story of slender man, and the news stories surrounding it, were far scarier.Also, and I've said this recently about Dark Web, why are horror movies constantly pulling their punches?? Horror movies have gotten so much better in their production values, etc., but they rarely pay off all that suspense, that waiting for something horrific and grisly to happen, with anything horrific and grisly! You don't have to fill the movie with gore or anything, but give me at least one gruesome death that pays off my sitting and waiting for it the entire time, as you do in a horror movie. Not everything has to be Saw or Funny Games, but I mean, if you look around, some horror filmmakers have taken things pretty far, it doesn't make sense not to explore this, even for one scene. And, was something cut from what I saw in the trailor? Tsk, tsk. This alone brought my rating down from 6 to 5 stars. Looked like stuff was cut for a better rating or something, a note from marketing or distribution or whomever is calling the shots now. We need filmmakers, especially if they are going to make horror, to really make horror, and who can stand up to people who keep trying to tone down their films. If you want to see dollar signs, if you want to please the masses, please go make a Marvel movie and stay away from horror. And studio people, this was never going to be a blockbuster, this was always going to be for a niche audience, so make the movie that audience wants to see! Look at what you've done! Look at the ratings here on IMDB! And your audience wants to blame the actors or something, because that's who they see, but no, the acting was terrific, it was, if I could guess, the studio who screwed this up by watering it all down, and the filmmakers who screwed it up by letting them.

Slender man is a cinematic timeless neo-classical masterpiece of the horror movie genre. The genre of horror movies has long been notorious for bad films, with cheesy acting, characters and plot lines. Many of these so bad it's good films are b movies with low budgets. Slenderman creates a true and flawless recreation of this genre. The actors playing the main group of girls in this movie performed perfectly, managing to create humor through lines clearly written by writers out of touch with teenage social life while remaining completely serious. The writers of the film alone deserve a huge amount of credit for making the film the masterpiece that it was. The dialogue replicating the type of unintentional humor scenes in movies like the Room while not trying too hard to be humorous as to disrupt the movie. The dialogue between the characters illustrated just how out of touch the writers were with teenagers and high school social life, creating hilarious and absurd scenes such as the scene where the characters exclude Hallie's little sister from hanging out with them despite the fact that she's practically the same age and they really have no social standing in the first place to warrant this. This scene truly encapsulated the cheesy and artificial chemistry we see between teenagers in typically low budget movies, but to see this on such a high budget was great to see.At the base layer of the composition of this film is a nostalgic replication of the classic horror movie plots, that pays homage to the genre of cheesy monster movies. The movie mostly revolves around a girl getting kidnapped and her friends seeking to find her, without consulting adults who are largely absent in the film. Rather than consulting the police or attempting an exorcism, the movie's characters ignore most obvious options and constantly take matters into their own hands which is truly reminiscent of the cheesy horror movie genre in general.Truly a feat of this film is its ability to keep the audience engaged. The downfall of most cheesy horror movies is that they are a slog to get through. However slenderman keeps the viewer interested through it's downright absurdity at failed attempts to create a villain. This is another strong point of the movie. Slenderman is such a classic urban legend, and has become the boogie man of the post 9/11 generation, who have grown up in a culture that creates a fear of strangers among youth. It is this constant worry that something bad will happen that allowed the myth of slenderman to be such a terrifying character in he first place, not to mention his relation to technology and the metaphor of slenderman being manifested in technology. The representation of slenderman in this movie misses the mark completely, creating a monster that is not scary at all and arguably likeable. Slenderman does not have a defined character, and is more of just a guy kills people. That's it. It is almost like the influences he has in terms of nightmares and otherwise are completely separate from his character. This really allows for the actors and plot elements to shine as the star of the show, being the most entertaining things about the movie.I believe that the Slender Man film was originally much more developed, as the trailers vastly differ from the movie itself. The trailers show an entirely different plot that seems less rushed and much more planned out. This is possibly the reason for the scenes changing so abruptly, to the point where the viewer is confused. This is one of the things that makes the film so comedic, because a "scary" scene ends up becoming downright hilarious. The trailer also shows the girl who goes missing in the film, Katie, come out of the woods covered in blood, something that downright never made it into the final cut of the movie. I believe that the directors decided that the movie would have a better role as a comedic film. This was a great decision as it sets Slender Man apart from your run of the mill horror film that gives the movie with such a generic modern horror villain a certain spirit that is not commonly found in big budget horror productions. Overall slenderman is a hilarious film that is fun for the whole family. It's poor writing and bad acting clash with its high budget and big Hollywood production style, creating a type of movie rarely seen in the big budget Hollywood scene. It truly is a victory for the genre of comically bad movies, that fits in with its contemporaries like the room. If you want to make your kid not afraid of Slenderman, show them this film.-Rolf

reviews.review_title: An Unfortunate Mess that could've been something.
reviews.content: The worst thing about how utterly bad this film is, is how wonderful the cinematography (in spite of the horrible CGI and horrid script) and the Soundtrack were. They had so much potential to be utilized with slender man, but made so many horrible choices with the liberties taken on the Lore. The acting borders from, "ok" to "shamefully bad", and the script was just horrendous. It's so all over the place, and the potholes grow larger every minute.The film also suffers from trying to stay tame in order to keep the rating safe for kids to be able to attend. It goes so far down the safety hole that it's almost more PG than PG-13. There's no gore, sex, or nudity. The only thing I can think of to maybe justify Pg-13 over PG is that one kid says, "fuck" once. (They say "frick" other times... seriously) it's just way too timid, and it borders on being flat out boring.The often beautiful shots (when they're not raped by hideously cheap CGI) and fantastic soundtrack are all that kept me from passing out into a boredom induced coma. They repeatedly try for the cliche jump scares, but you see them a mile off. It just fails on so many levels, and it's frustrating because at the root of it all, they really could've made something brilliant if they hadn't succumbed to being lazy, safe, and cliche. I'd say a generous 4 out of 10 and only for the cinematography and score which really are wasted on a turd of a film. The rest is just a sloppy mess.

reviews.review_title: A 15 rated movie aimed at 12 year olds
reviews.content: This is what happens when a major studio tries to go horror. Very weak script, in fact I'm sure I could have written a more interesting story. The story line lacks any imagination and really could have explored the actual slenderman murder case which might have been a better story rather than this high school bore fest. Very little suspense and zero horror,couldn't wait for it to end. Don't waste your money or your time.

reviews.review_title: it is not scary and has a cheap CGI effects
reviews.content: It is not really scary and my face was totally chill throughout the theater. The scary part is just a mere face shaking and some random pop out scene. I did not feel the intensity and felt very disappointed.

reviews.review_title: scariest movie i ever see, epic and rad
reviews.content: Wow i got scared very good movie and i almost farded my pant lol its rly scary but i dont know who slenderman is? pretty epic and rad tho

Well ok then. I'm always curious when I see dead low rated films such as this, because I like wondering if it's being harshly criticised or not.First 45 minutes or so of this film I was genuinely sold, plot was making sense. You had this mysterious creature following them etc it had the makings of a good horror. But oh my word does this plot fall apart.1: the "mysterious" slender man isn't mysterious anymore as he appears on screen every 5 minutes or so. Completely gives the mystery away.
2: nothing made sense. This slender man just invented his "powers" the longer it went on and absolutely nothing was explained at all. It was all just stupid.
3: ending was an absolute joke. It summed up the entire 2nd half of the film. Absolute waste of time, a good ending could have saved this from being a low rating (4 I gave is generous), but no. I don't want to use spoilers, but it's the most pointless ending to a film I've seen. NOTHING GETS ANSWERED. I'm actually sat here fully triggered at the ending!
4: it wasn't scary. The very few jump scares that were used you knew were coming so it had no effect.It could have been good. That's what annoys me more, because it really did start well. But my god that 2nd 45 minutes is absolutely awful. I don't recommend tbh

And slowI don't really have anymore to say but I can't leave a three word review.So instead of a review I'll just say the HBO documentaryabout the girls who went crazy in real life and are now in mental institutions so much more chilling and compelling story.
I went into this movie with no expectations after hearing a lot of negative reviews. But it wasn't to bad, obviously not the best and more could of been done

OK first off, no it's not a great movie. But, it's definitely not as bad as the average rating indicates. Take it for what it is: an average teen horror movie. It's a PG-13 people. It's a rating to include the teenies, so you should know that it will be (generally) less scary/creepy/intense than a higher rating.Secondly, it can be tricky to try and make a full length feature film based on a myth and slender man short horror videos. Sometimes it works (Lights Out for example) and other times it doesn't. For me, Slender Man is right there on the fence between working and not working. It's a decent attempt in my opinion and while it does tend to drag at times, it didn't really get too boring for me, especially not as far as for me to turn it off. Dunno about this whole "too dark" thing either as I managed to see everything with no problems.The tension, scares and overall creep factor is pretty minimal in honesty, but they generally weren't TOO bad. I think if the film makers kept the full on detail views of Slender Man to a minimum it might have been a bit more creepy. The glimpses of him and clever 'blending in' tricks employed could have made for a bit more of a creepy atmosphere. The parts where this happened had more intensity for me rather than the full on 'up close & personal' shots although some of those shots were pretty decent enough. Javier Botet was pretty good as Slender Man and while it wasn't his creepiest role (Insidious holds that title I think as the Red Faced Demon) he still does a convincing portrayal as Slender Man.Like I said, this isn't a great movie but if you're struggling for something to watch then you could definitely do much worse than this.

reviews.review_title: Everyone is so hypercritical, it's ridiculous
reviews.content:
This movie has less jump scares and more of a creepy and ominous atmosphere. This movie was pretty good for a flick filled with a sub-par script, but remember, teenage girls sound cringey anyway... so chill. 
Take this movie with a grain of salt. It's good for what it is. It's job is to portray a creepy figure that taps into the psyche of susceptible prey and torments them. This movie explores exactly that. 
There's nothing outstanding about this film. Although, the sound design and visuals are pretty well done. This definitely isn't the worst horror movie I've seen. It's not poorly made and it wasn't super laughable either. If you have some free time, go see this for sure.
I'm usually when it comes to horror movies but I can't say this movie is good. It under-delivers on many fronts. The acting was fine but the story is odd and same with the ending.

The movie had terrible editing and terrible acting. The monster was shown way too early and way too often; I sense the people involved in this movie had no prior experience with making horror movies. Worst of all, it wasn't scary. I get scared of everything and anything, including my own shadow. If this movie can't terrify me, then it fails as a horror flick.

As they say on "Southpark" WE DIDN'T LISTEN! Every critic and reviewers said it was bad, but I thought it can't be THAT bad. It was worse. Extremely boring, the old trope of "dream scares", over acting teens that have clueless parents (who never listens to their kids despite each one getting knocked off one by one).
Then we have the "Final Girl" that screams and rambles through the last scenes.
Don't waste your time with this one.

Straightforward and uninspired story using the more used and abused creepypasta.Bad direction, bad acting, nothing is of any particular interest. Even the best shots of the movie are unoriginal and copied from other films.I hoped it was a movie so bad it could turn funny... Nope, it's just pure boredom on film.Avoid it, it's not worth your time.

Well can I add to the many many reviews on here? Not a great deal about the film as it's pretty much already been Said but what I can add is that I found this little horror entertaining. I never knew about the myth that is 'slender man' but you don't need to.Many are slating it saying it's not scary enough or not like the stories they have read but go look yourself. I never look at a film through others eyes nor compare to a book or another film. I take each film on an even slate.This film has a creepy kind of eerie presence about it and it leaves the viewers own mind to do the wandering. It has a few jump scares and a pretty good story.Great Film, reasonable acting not too long

Can I give minus stars, like minus 13?A few not so smart chicks conjure up Mr. Slender Man by watching a video online. One chick vanishes early on in the movie and the others go insane. From there on, it's really bad C-grade cinematography, D-grade predictable story and E-grade, if there is such a thing, headless chooks running around, screaming because they have F-grade (meaning fail) hallucinations and nightmares.What can I say, one of the chicks sacrifices herself to Slender Man to save her sister. The sacrificed chick then turns into a tree. End of story.Oh, by the way, typical Americans, they leave their front and back doors unlocked despite having the highest rate of home invasions in civilized western society; and apart from one family, no none's parents are ever home. They must all be doing nightshift over there.Bravo, well done Netflix for sucking me into this pointless and non-scary movie.

reviews.review_title: an interesting movie that's worth seeing
reviews.content:
I compare this movie as an unfinished painting.
This definitely ISN'T the worst horror movie I've seen... In many scenes, the movie can set the fear, special effects are good. 
It's not a masterpiece, it's not a bad movie either.The evil character Slender Man is a good character for a horror movie, but in this situation creators of this movie have made some mistakes.... gives me the impression of a movie made in a hurry, could be much better!
Sometimes in the film the story has no logic, it is hard to follow the narrative thread... in some points you do not know when it's reality or when it's dreaming.
There are some questions that have not found the answer (about some characters in the movie)
Those who wrote the story of the film are guilty for the very low rating.
But it does not deserve less than 5. However, sometimes people exaggerate with a very low rating.
I was very hesitant to even watch this because the reviews are so bad. Honestly I dont know why.. it was a great movie.

I'd heard that this scary movie received many negative reviews, and I became interested to see why, so I watched it after it was broadcast on TV, directed by Sylvain White (I'll Always Know What You Last Summer, The Losers). Basically, in a small town in Massachusetts, high school friends Hallie Knudsen (Julia Goldani Telles), Wren (Joey King), Chloe (Razzie nominated Jaz Sinclair), and Katie (Annalise Basso) are fascinated by the internet phenomenon of the Slender Man (Javier Botet). Many online images which apparently contain a thin, unnaturally tall humanoid with a featureless head and face, wearing a black suit. They four friends find a video online to see how one can summon this mysterious monster. The girls close their eyes as they wait to hear the tolling of bells. A week later, the girls are on a class field trip at a cemetery, Katie is spooked by something in the trees, and disappears without trace. The three girls find out Katie had been involved in the occult and wanted the Slender Man to take her. In an attempt to bring Katie back, the three friends decide to make contact with the Slender Man in exchange for something else. Wren has researched the mythology of the Slender Man, including victims that have apparently been taken, and those that the monster has left behind. She warns Hallie and Chloe not to open their eyes when trying to make contact with the monster for fear of death or madness. Chloe panics, opens her eyes, and comes face to face with the Slender Man. Sometime later, the monster enters Chloe's house and drives her insane. Wren suffers from frightening visions. She searches for a solution while Hallie unsuccessfully tries to move on. Soon, Hallie's younger sister Lizzie (Taylor Richardson) suffers a major panic attack and is taken to hospital and sedated. Hallie finds out that Lizzie has tried to help Wren in an attempt to contact the Slender Man again. Hallie confronts Wren about Lizzie. Wren tells Hallie that the Slender Man only wants them before she is taken by the monster herself. Hallie, realising that the only way to save Lizzie is to give herself to the Slender Man, sacrifices herself for her sister. Lizzie recovers and reflects on the situation that resulted in the death of her sister and her friends. Also starring Alex Fitzalan as Tom, Jessica Blank as Hallie's Mother, Michael Reilly Burke as Hallie's Dad, Kevin Chapman as Mr. Jensen, and Miguel Nascimento as Kyle. King and her co-stars try to keep you interested with their petrified screams and cries of fear, and there are some gross-out eye-catching images during nightmare sequences and obviously the title monster appearing. The problem is it is let down by many repetitive moments, predictable bogeyman style material we've seen so many times before, terrible attempts at jump scares, it is just a flimsy and boring slog, a near pointless supernatural horror. Adequate!

I liked it actually. This brings alot back in 2009 when the creepypasta of Slenderman. And the fact that Slenderman manipulates the mind of the people who summon him is actually to me a genius idea and it really follows the plot throughout the whole movie. For me, There really isn't alot alot to complain about and it really brings a lot of suspense, horror, and thriller, and mystery which actually makes it more entertaining. Although it could have used a little more of Slenderman's wrath, It really describes his character which leads to a genius ending and a very good lesson. I recommend it to Creepypasta fans and people who are really into a lot of this genre. I personally enjoyed it. The suspense is my favorite part about this film.

reviews.review_title: Absolute trash, but has a few comedic moments.
reviews.content: What a horrible movie, there's no real lead character in it, you never relate to any of the characters at all, and some of the characters just disappear halfway into the movie. Nothing gets explained and nothing is scary. But this movie gets 2 stars instead of one, because the decisions the girls make are hilarious and people's faces tweaking out is so funny. Basically everything that was supposed to be a jumpscare was pure comedy. This is probably the worst horror movie I have ever seen though.

reviews.review_title: The Scariest Film Since Toy Story
reviews.content: Good Things:The movie has nice direction and good cinematography. I like the way the movie looks.Some of the acting is decent.Bad Things:Even though the direction is pretty good (despite the movie relying heavily on jumpscares like a lot of modern horror movies) it falls flat on the script and just everything else. The characters are bland as hell, without any real character traits that will make me connect with them in any way.The story is very slow paced and kind of a drag, a lot of scenes in the trailer were cut out of the movie to make it marketable to teenagers, who probably ended up hating it anyway.The scares are pretty awful, the majority of them are jumpscares (aka just a loud sound being added to scare the audience a bit) and the ones that aren't are hilarious, I found myself laughing at every ridiculous attempt to try and scare the audience.Overall, pretty bad, 4/10

Maybe mildly scary if you're 13 years old or something.I understand the low stars, such a waste to do this to a true modern icon of foreboding terror.Please someone remake and give the legend his due.

While I never viewed any of the trailers and didn't set any expectations, this still managed to be just as bad as others thought. One might say that this would've been more liked, if it was released 6 years years ago, and I would agree with it.
The whole mythology is actually intresting, but not enough to fuel this drag of a movie filled with cheap jumpscares...

I found this film to be a really entertaining cinematic experience. The sound effects were visceral, and the 'in your face' (literally) camera style made it easy to connect with the actor's perceptions. We were taken on a gripping systematic journey with the teens as their carefree life descended into a hellish nightmare in the demonic hands of Slender man. As a modern metaphor, he is compared to a computer virus that infiltrates his victim's mind. I felt that the young actors did a great job. There were a few good jump scares (for those who need that!) and a sustained sense of terror. The dream-like scenes involving slender man were scary enough. He is such an impressive villain in that any interaction with him ultimately proves fatal. Like all good horror movies, good guys don't win!This movie has been heavily criticised, but it's always good to approach movies with an open mind and look for the positives.

I've seen my fair share of bad movies over the years, but seriously this movie is it's own genre of bad. I know it was made based on an internet meme, but I can't find a real plot, or any reason to be invested in it. The movie was actually difficult to watch all the way through, not because it was scary, but because the story was so very bad.

IT WHO? This is the best movie of our generation! It is psychological thriller! It scarred me for life and it made me pregnant with Slender's babies! I saw him in my bathtub after I saw the movie! The character's were very diverse! The plot was beautiful and the camera angles were artwork! Slender took my classmates today and he face timed me and showed me them turning into trees. Also, I want to name our slender baby Courtney.

First of all, if you're expecting a good horror movie (like there are a lot nowadays), stop expecting. Here's why:The film makes use of a small cast mainly consisting out of teenage characters. Here's why 70% of the movie consists out of high school- peer pressure, teenage romance, girls bitchfighting and family problems. Fun for some people maybe but for a horror maybe not so suitable. 
So its all about the small teen cast consisting out of 4 girls who are played by women I didn't even knew before. None of the acting is really worth mentioning but the actress playing the girl Wren does a decent job in my opinion.Then on to the horror part of the movie. It's all about our man Slenderman ofcourse. The ones who've played the game will know how he looks like and I can tell you: he looks exactly the same. Even the quality is the same. Its actually a very bad quality CGI/effect that runs through this movie. A highschooler could've done the same job. After the movie i noticed an actor was hired to play slenderman but this seems rather useless due to what's mentioned above. The jumpscares in the movie are rather cheap, nothing you haven't seen before. Even sometimes a bit funny due to the crappiness of the effects. Storyline has some big holes and character development is a mess, you're left with a lot of questions afterwards.I'll suggest everyone who's not a fan of Slenderman but just curious about him to play one of the games that are released about this character, you'll get the same as the movie but even better.

I've seen a fair bit of horror movies over the years. This was among the more creepy ones. It creates great atmosphere, and builds anxiety every time the characters are in the dark.I don't know why it is getting so much hate in the reviews and has such a low rating. It was certainly not deserved. I had never read the story, watched the trailer or known the back story, so there's that. All I had seen were a couple still images, which definitely evoked some intrigue.At the end of the day, judging it on its own merits, I enjoyed it. I would have given it 8/10 but it got a bit cheesy at the end. It made me want to yell out "stranger things". Not that Stranger Things is cheesy. You'll see what I mean.

Lots of trees, fog, shadowy figure, crooked gate scenes fill this movie. Scariest part, weren't none! Even the prosthetically altered moderately slender man looked halloweenish. DVD cover looked scary though.

reviews.review_title: It's as faceless as it's monster. The Slender Man is a giant bore with no plot, no characters, little narrative and one of the worst scripts for a horror film
reviews.content: Okay, I guess its time to talk about urban legends on the Internet. Though I have my fair share of videos and channels I'll watch on YouTube, I'm not one to read fully into local stories about people claiming they saw things like clowns and monsters in the woods. Probably one that took the web by storm was Slender Man. I know the suit wearing, faceless thing has a backstory on websites, but the furthest knowledge I have comes from a video game that I played a while back. While I wasn't scared of this like a lot of survival games, it did give a spooky atmosphere and a lot of people did play it. And yes, I do know about the tragic stabbing that happened by two teenage girls who believed in Slender Man and wanted to impress him.Now while he was big, that was almost four or five years ago. Like a lot of video games, anything revolving around the internet tends to have s short popularity window. This is why we have gotten very few movies based off of Internet memes. On the one hand, it's hard to see why a Slender Man movie got made, but I do see the potential. In the New England area, we have four teenage friends; Wren (played by Joey king), Hallie (played by Julia Goldani Telles), Chloe (played by Jaz Sinclair) and Katie (played by Annalise Basso). They act like how a lot of high-schoolers, just trying to get through class, hoping to get the popular guy and trying to have fun. When they hear a group of boys admitting they were going to try and summon the "Slender Man", the girls decide to do the same. They go to a webpage and watch a hypnotic video that seems to invoke something. A few days later on a class trip, Katie goes missing and both Wren and Hallie figure it has to do with Slender Man. They spend a good chunk of the movie attempting to look into it's history and how it might be responsible for a lot of other missing children. The further they dive into the mystery, the more their lives start to become affected by occasional dreams and sights of the Slender Man. More people go mossing and they see more abstract images even if their the only ones that can see them. Can they figure out where their friends are?Where do I begin with Slender Man? I can start by saying that the concept of watching a forbidden video has already been done with in The Ring. The idea of doing it on the Web isn't a bad idea, but I can a hundred percent guarantee that nothing new is added here. For a movie that took four years to make, it steals from other horror movies like The Ring, I Know What You Did Last Summer, The Grudge, and The Craft. The cinematography is even shot like one of those films from the late 1990's. The worst thing about it is The Slender Man is dull and boring. The characters have no personality, there's little narrative plot, no focus, and it keeps witching points of narrative at complete random. It might focus on Joey King as a main character, before switching to another girl while throwing her out. It's like the movie couldn't decide if the movie should be a group story or something more personal. The Slender Man feel like random notes from a horror film fanatic who went insane. I swear, this was a tough movie to get through. I can't imagine even the most hardcore fans of Slender Man even liking this.I'll give this two slender men out of ten. It's a bad sign when I went to see this with a bunch of teenagers who were silent for the majority with no laughs, no screams, or even that much interest. This is one legend that will not last.

When I heard the film crew's words about it and their psyche after working on the film, I thought the film was so terrifying that it affected the psyche of the actors. It turned out that the whole thing is a lie.How the hero of the movie went to slender man, saying Take me and run away is pure cringe.

I don't know what I was expecting when I went see the movie. Somehow I was positive, I like the subject and I thought that after all the Marble Hornets and whatever else was there - a proper cinematic take with solid budget would produce a decent result.Well... Is that the curse of video game movies? I suppose that's the closest explanation. They can't for the life of them stick to the core material. None of them. Of course, it might not have been better to have one and a half hour of white noise and weeping angels, but then again they could've taken some notes from Marble Hornets. Mixing that and the core game material, adding some coherence, pacing and relevant plot...Instead they just went for the lowest common denominator. Four teenage girls do something predictably stupid in an attempt to show that girls are apparently no different from boys when it comes to being stupid. Well, goal achieved. Then somebody goes missing and the rest start to dig around for exposition. Which, of course, provokes numerous repetitive, predictable and, frankly, yawn-boring Paranormal Activity moments, all of which include and suggest that Slender Man is impervious to anything, doesn't have any particular moral center and that the girls are just screwed. That much becomes apparent almost one third into the movie. Yet they will still do this and that, one stupid thing here, another there, an ear-cringe fest at the house or the library... At least "It" was artistic, this thing is just basic demon hallucination with lots of... well, not even noise. Because I wouldn't mind white noise, but they had to make Slender Man into a Leshy, or, rather, Spirit of the Woods from Witcher - and that felt absolutely out of place. Sure, we've seen sight-based monsters before, though not on the big screen, so maybe literally replicating the game wouldn't be smart, but Slender Man is a psychological horror. It's the embodiment of paranoia, of being watched, followed. It's like a proper "It Follows", which is also quite a terrible movie, but still far better represents the subject.The problem of this movie is that if you changed the CGI\the dummy from Slender Man to ANYTHING else - the movie would barely change. Babadook, It, It Follows, Paranormal Activity, Insidious - you change the monster for any of these and the movie could very well go exactly the same. You don't have to change a single line of the plot. Maybe if this was a 90-ies movie - it could resound better, but nowadays you just feel that you've "seen" that before. And what you hoped to see - isn't there.I always like when characters try to take themselves seriously, or fight back. Clear Rivers in Final Destination 2 locking herself in the asylum, for example. It means that the writers want to explore, to tackle the subject, to toy with the viewer. Of course, when it becomes a monster slasher, like "It" - it kind of loses the mark, but if they have so much exposition, if they have introduced even the characters' friends, who, somehow, are involved - then why not work with it. Or, at least, make the conclusion properly tragic and realistic, like in Krampus.But no, no no no. Again, they went with all the easiest solutions. It's almost like they were forced to write\make this movie, and, obviously, people have to work. The question is - why is it always wrong people working in the wrong places... The only reason I give this thing 2 stars is because it's about Slender Man. Though I'd personally recommend this film as a stoner film. It might be enjoyable to be watched intoxicated, simply laughing at every stupid scene.

reviews.review_title: It was bad on so many levels
reviews.content: You know it's a bad movie when you laugh at the supposedly scary parts of the movie. Slender Man was a waste of time and money. It's your average low budget horror movie. characters were forgetable, the writing was garbage, and the movie leaves some things hazy like what happened to the boyfriend? What happened to the sister? But the ending is what makes me dislike this movie the most. So slenderman trasports the main character into the forest in which he chases her by stretching out his legs to look like a spider. Then he merges her with a tree. I mean seriously? I have to admit it's worse than the bye bye man.

reviews.review_title: It really wasn't that bad but wasn't to scary at the same time
reviews.content: When I heard that there is going to be a slenderman movie,I was excited to see it since i play some of the games and also heard that it will release in August which is good though. When I saw the movie when it release,I kinda feel that the characters DO kinda fit for the movie and also Slender Man does appear in movie but it's the tentacle version.The main theme of the movie is that 3 friends must find their friend who disappeared while on a school field trip.During finding their friend,Chloe,they go back to the sematary,where Chloe disappeared,to find her to see if she's alive.Things get worse when while getting her friend back,another friend,Chloe,goes missing but was later found by her friends.When Chloe goes back to her home,she later sees that someone was in her home and then was captured by slenderman by hand and acted strange to her friends.After the disappearance of the second friend, two friends,Wren and Hallie,must find a way to stop slenderman from kidnapping them and get their friends back but it never works when Hallie goes on the date and sees strange things from her boyfriends who acts possessed when it was just all in her head. When Hallie gets home,she sees her sister being possessed-like and was taken to the hospital.Now this is where the things get strange but creepy when Wren was at the library and light bulbs starts flashing on and then off and thats where you slenderman in a close up position of his blank white face and his hands and that's where she gets out of the library in fear. Back at home with Hallie,she sees that Wren took her Hallies sister into the woods,where they get to summon slenderman and Hallie goes to Wrens house and Wrens tells her that slender man wants them,which means the girls who are the main characters.The ending though was that all the main characters died or disappeared and was never seen again.Here's how the ending was: After Wren was captured by slenderman, Hallie goes into the woods to find Wren and that's where Hallie was captured by slenderman and the cameras skips to Hallies sister in a hospital bed,like shown in the first trailer,zoomed into the picture of four of the main characters who died,then into the school where they went with students in it and the movies ends with a, "All characters died" ending.But overall,the movie was ok and not that bad and not that scary if play the slenderman games,and 5 years late probably but its okay cause there were a lot of people in the auditorium.So if you are going to watch this movie,you'll have to watch it straight in order to get the movies plot.
One of the worst "horror" film i've ever seen in my life!!! 0/10 terrifying needless stupid film! 1.30 hour of no sense. Please my friend don't waste your time!

reviews.review_title: I don't get all the hate
reviews.content:
In the year 2018 horror movies have gone way downhill and are still selling at the box office. I saw this movie and thought "wow, so many tropes they DIDN'T do"
It was a good movie. Not the best, and will probably be forgotten a decade down the road, but theirs so many things they did NOT do that I can say this is a movie worth watching.
They did not:
Start the movie off with a gory shock death.
Rely on jumpscares
Have bad actors
Throw slenderman on screen too much
Have slenderman talk
Come up with some stupid lore about slenderman about why he existsPoint is that even though the movie isn't oscar worthy, it definitely elevated the horror genre to what standard the bare minimum should be, and yet other crap horror movies out there get more stars. Where is the justice?

Because he will bore you to death.i can only recall the name of one of the characters in this movie and thats because she was the first to go missing, i cannot remember any other girls names. If you like the ocassional jump scare, dont care about story, like the cgi in films such as sharknado, then this film might be for you

Can this even be called a movie? I'm wondering if some of this trash can be reviewed before it hits theaters and online streaming. Please avoid seeing this movie. Don't waste time with the trailer either!

I hate you.. not good, bad story, everything so bad.
I hate you again all

reviews.review_title: Terrible characters, boring plot, and no suspense at all.
reviews.content: Slender Man (2 out of 5 stars).Slender Man had potential in actually being a creepy scary film. A tall, faceless, and long arms mysterious being does sound creepy when it is lurking in the forests, stalking people. The film fails to even being a scary movie. It has everything that fails in its cliché of horror movies. Stupid teens, boring direction that lacks scares and consistent scenes. Lets not forget the plot does feel more like a rip off from The Ring movies.The characters are all bad and lacking in characteristics that you would root for. These teens made the stupid decision to watch a video of a slender man on a website. From there, Slender man is stalking these teens one by one. Luring them into the forest or traumatizing them to the part they go insane. Teens make the stupid decision and it is difficult to even care for them. Also, if it is a plot hole or something. But where are all there parents. They go walking around their homes on a school night, yelling and screaming cause something is coming inside their homes. And no adult supervision is found. Until, one of the kids ends up in a hospital and the parents finally show up out of nowhere. The direction is lacking comprehensive with its storytelling. Characters go missing when one of the girls is trying to reach her boyfriend. You really do not hear back about what happened to him.The acting is dull. Joey King, Julia Goldani Telles, Jaz Sinclair, and Annalise Basso were all tedious with their performance. The script also was lacking in characteristics with their characters. Which made it hard for you to even care for them.The plot was similar to The Ring. Except, they are being stalked by a mysterious tall, skinny, faceless man. It does have some creepy moments. But it fails with its cliché horror storytelling. And the climax and third act gets lazy with its storytelling. That is not even sure how to end the film. With one character going insane in the hospital and decides to face the slender man herself.Overall, Slender Man is a bad film. It lacks scares and suspense. Characters make stupid decisions. Acting is boring. The direction is lazy and the script lacks in fleshing out their characters. Only good thing is Slender Man is kind of creepy.

reviews.review_title: zero rating if I could choose
reviews.content:
From the start of the movie we all expected they would disappear or get haunted by the slender man.
good job you really worked hard for making this movie director. there isn't any idea just hunting the victims from the start to the end.

I saw "Slender Man", starring Joey King-Wish Upon, White House Down; Julia Goldani Telles-The Affair_tv, Bunheads_tv; Jaz Sinclair-When the Bough Breaks, Paper Towns and Annalise Basso-Ouija:Origin of Evil, Captain Fantastic.
This is an unscary, dumb attempt at a horror movie. It's based on an internet urban legend that was created by Eric Knudsen,going by the pen name of Victor Surge-I guess that even he didn't want his real name associated with this piece of crap. The legend concerns a tall humanoid figure that is seen in photographs, usually unnoticed by everyone else in the photo, and he is also seen near children. He supposedly kidnaps the children and they are never seen again. Joey, Julia, Jaz and Annalise are high school kids that hear about the Slender Man from kids at school and decide it would be a good idea to try and conjure him up-you know high school kids are always doing dumb things when they get bored. One by one, the girls start disappearing and guess who is usually seen, right before they do a vanishing act? Yep, old Slender Man. It might have been better if they would have expanded more about what happens to the kidnapped children, once they are taken-does Liam Neeson come looking for them?-and why does he kidnap them in the first place. There are a lot of the false jumps, loud noises and people waking up from a dream scenarios that are used a lot in these cheap horror films. It's usually a sign that they are trying to cover up the poor writing.
It's rated "PG-13" for disturbing images, terror, language and sexual references and has a running time of 1 hour & 33 minutes.
I wouldn't buy this on DVD. I wouldn't rent it either. If you really want to see this movie, I would wait until it comes to cable.

reviews.review_title: Loud noises aren't scary - just annoying!
reviews.content:
Slender Man (aka Cliche - the movie) is not only incredibly lacking in any scares, but also fails in telling an even close to interesting story that apparently can't even get its own lore straight. Add to that a bunch of cardboard cutouts trying to pass off as characters (that the movie itself doesn't even seem to care that much about), special effects that outright made me laugh out loud, jump scares you can set a timer to, and you've got a horror movie that fails on practically every single level.
Did I mention it even has the dream within a dream scare? Well, of course it does, because this movie hasn't got anything you haven't seen before done many times better.
The only reason I didn't fall asleep was because the movie insisted on using sound effects so obnoxiously loud I was constantly fearing it would permanently impair my hearing.
It is a testament to a movie's lack of self confidence in being able to create a creepy atmosphere when it has to do it with loud noises and quick cuts to what I suppose was meant to be "unsettling" stuff, which just ends up coming across as laughable and unfortunately rather pathetic.
This movie is sadly not so bad it's good - it's just plain bad!

reviews.review_title: Fake user reviews...dont listen. Bad movie. (Spoilers)
reviews.content:
You will notice there are a bunch of IMDB users giving this either a 9 or a 10 but also notice all of these overly positive reveiws seem to be one after the other. Clearly its one or two people woth multiple accounts.The movie was well acted and well shot....but the actual story was horrible. Plot holes left and right on top of inconsistancies involving "the slenderman rules" , making it a frustrating film to watch. The characters are also extremely unlikeable.SPOILER TERRITORY
I'm not sure if this was done on purpose as a new spin on the horror genre but...the two most likeable characters die the earliest, leaving you with two extremely unlikeable characters. At the end when Slenderman gets them both one after the other I just kind of shrugged.The movie isn't unbearable..but it's not good either. If you really must watch it make sure you dont make anyone watch it with you because that is just selfish.

The trailer is 1000x better than the movie, and not in the usual "used the scariest scenes to draw viewers in". Basically nothing in the trailer made it into the movie. They edited any intriguing or scary scene right out of the movie (due to fear of backlash from the real life trial). I'm not sure how the unedited version would have turned out but either way this movie was gonna offend the real life people. At least make it worthwhile if you're gonna offend them either way! Also - there could have been many ways to do a slender man story without paralleling the real life events... if they were that worried about offending the real life people they could have taken one of those avenues... instead we're left with half of a movie using the blandest scenes they had. Honestly save your time and watch the 2 min trailer instead of the 1h30m movie.
I saw this movie for free and I still wanted my money back, it's like they aren't taking horror movies seriously anymore.
