Okay how do i put this. 
I feel like i am mentally raped by this disaster of a movie!
From the poor cringy acting to the bad animations. The jumpscares were way too predictable and the close ups of slenderman just took the scare away from the "scary" movie. If you like really bad movies, this one is for you

A horror movie only needs to accomplish to very simple but very important things. It needs to be atmospheric and it needs to be scary.Slender Man is definitely an atmospheric movie. Right from the start, you see the abandoned shopping mall of a sleepy town in the middle of nowhere. Most scenes take place at night, often in dark buildings or in a forest. The progressive confusion, nervosity and terror of the four main characters is also fascinating to watch.However, the movie isn't scary despite the appropriate atmosphere. The supernatural entity that gave the movie its title is quite unoriginal. It doesn't speak, it doesn't have any unforeseeable powers and it doesn't even have a face which is quite revealing. The weak attempts at jump scares are clumsy and predictable. I would go as far to say that Slender Man is one of the least scariest horror movies I have ever watched and I have come across hundreds.This would make for an average and quite lukewarm film but there are three minor elements that justify my slightly more positive evaluation. First of all, it's interesting that the movie focuses on four teenage girls instead of just boys or a mixed group which is a little bit different from the usual stereotypes. It's also great that the casting directors and writers didn't try to focus on artificial diversity, including one lesbian girl, one transgender girl, one physically disabled girl and one schizophrenic girl with borderline personality disorder. The four main characters might not have perfect chemistry but their friendship is at least believable. They are refreshingly normal.Secondly, the young actresses did a solid job. They aren't extraordinary by any means but they made the best they could with an at times shallow and unimaginative script. I really liked Joey King's acting as slightly sinister, nervous and hyperactive teenager who is a little bit different than the other three characters. I happened to find her just memorable and unique enough to not be exaggerated or even annoying. Thirdly and lastly, I liked how the movie ended. In the beginning, I found the resolution somewhat confusing and short but the more I think about it, the more I find it quite original and even courageous to end a film the way it did here. It's definitely not your standard Hollywood happy ending and this fact alone needs some praise.In the end, Slender Man is neither an ordinary nor an extraordinary horror film. It has just enough positive elements to be slightly above average or even good. I have seen far worse horror movies recently like Devil's Due or The Quiet Ones. The negative reviews of this film are often exaggerated. Horror movie fans should at least appreciate this film. Teenagers might even like it a little bit more because they could identify with the main characters.
Disappointing movie, please don't waste your time seeing this movie.

I have already read the comments
But I thought it would be good
But do not waste your time
Very boring
The sequence of events is not good

reviews.review_title: Can we pretend this didn't happen?
reviews.content: Wow, is all I can say, and trust me that's not a good wow, I am a massive fan of Slender Man, from the games to the Marble Hornets series, I loved everything, and I waited so long for a movie and when I found out this was coming I was still so excited, actually excited is an understatement (yes I know it was 6 years too late but who cares) when I finally watched it, the credits rolled, I sat there just thinking like.... honestly what did I watch, a few jump scares, average acting, cheesy dialogue, and can I tell you what disappointed me the most was THEY DIDN'T EVEN GET SLENDER RIGHT (he looked amazing that I won't deny) first of all, slender doesn't walk he teleports!!!! I mean did you even study slender??? and also you don't summon slender man he's just out there that's what it's always been about it, it started off great and then you kind of just sit there like wow did someone pull the budget out of this, did they run out of money? The effects just get terrible and I was actually wishing slender would just kill everyone, I hated this movie, please don't waste your time on this play the games instead they are so much better!!

Ive never cared nor wanted to write a review for a movie, but slenderman was unimaginably gross to watch. it set up so many plots yet didnt follow through with any of them, like what happened to all the girls? everything contradicted everything else it was so bad to watch and the actors did an awful job. ive never hated a movie this much other than the last jedi. the part that triggered me most was that hallie said take me then proceeded to run. poorly made i have no clue how anyone involved got a job in the movie industry.

reviews.review_title: I usually never write a review but....
reviews.content: This was honestly the worst movie I've been seen. The characters, the story, the ending, and slender man himself were all garbage. I usually don't fall asleep on purpose in movies but this one was just bad.

The actors were good, the school setting is a bit overused but I still liked it, Slender man looked good, however the story could have been so much more and sometimes the way the girls act is a bit cringy. 
Overall I enjoyed it and I hope it does well. It is merely okay. Could have been worse, but it also could have been a lot better.

reviews.review_title: Urban myth is not such a myth
reviews.content: Slender Man is a highly competent production. Great young actors, good story and script, lots of spooky locations well-chosen and some pretty convincing special effects. Good scares abound. The movie certainly deserves a better score than the 3.2. I suspect what's holding it back is that, despite the good story, it is nevertheless a story we have seen before, and the overriding arc of the story follows a familiar pattern. Teenagers visit an urban myth site, get sucked in, then get picked off one by one. Regardless, it is a scare ride, and certainly has added some panache to a popular horror theme.

reviews.review_title: Not nearly as bad as people say...
reviews.content: I have no idea why people are hating on this movie so much. It turned out to be better than I was actually expecting. It set a good atmosphere and the cinematography was pretty good. The story kept close to the lore of the Slender Man and it didn't cop out for a happy ending. People are way too cynical about horror movies thinking that there has to be blood and gore and a large shock value, like that's all horror movies are supposed to be about. I've even seen people completely denying the movie can be good without even seeing it, probably just because it was based off a popular creepy pasta, like that instantly makes it bad. Of course it's not the best film, but it definitely isn't bad as for as movies, especially horror movies, go.

reviews.review_title: Believe the bad reviews because it's THAT BAD
reviews.content: I wish I would've believed the bad reviews. It wants to be a grown up scary movie & it's not. They could show this at a slumber party for 6 yo's & they'd get bored. It's juvenile, boring & extremely stupid. If you have to see it, wait until it comes out on a movie channel. Please. It's beyond idiotic.

Decent watch at best, probably won't watch again, and can't really recommend.I'm a big fan of Joey King, but she wasn't really in a positive to save the movie.The production value is obviously there, the effects are even good, and there are several intense moments that should set the atmosphere, but I just couldn't bring myself to care.The writing has to be to blame. It's 4-5 shallow, empty characters with just enough flavor to tell them apart, and I just can't care about them.The movie focuses on the subtly of it all, the growing madness that Slender Man instills in his victims without properly building the tension or showing the characters slowly losing it, which would have given good actors the ability to save it. Instead they use a lot of "it happened offscreen" or sudden cuts to show a lose of time, and we get a character suddenly looking confused instead of taking the audience on a journey with the character.Maybe it's not the writing, and maybe the editor just didn't know what they were doing? "What are all these long dramatic series in here? This is so boring! *cut* Eh, they'll get the point."With all the options out there, I just don't think this is worth your time. I could tell you to just watch the 3rd act, and you'd probably get as much out of this movie as you're going to get from the beginning.

Okay, let's get one thing out of the way: this will never be a well-regarded horror film, like The Exorcist or Paranormal Activity. It probably won't even be remembered as a campy fun horror film, like The Blob or every slasher movie ever. That said, the film did have its high points. The story was good, the creature and visual effects were fantastic, the and I oddly enough found myself entertained for the full ninety minutes. The setup for each shot once the scares started was effectively done, particularly in the forest chase scene halfway through where we can only see what they see during a rescue attempt of their missing friend, so credit to the director and cinematographer for that. Where the story falls apart, thougn, is the actual script itself, which fills the situations with so many familiar characters from the Hollywood Background Machine. Worse, it becomes so concerned with scaring you that it starts to forget its own rules (more on that later). In the end, the best thing I can say about Slender Man is that the end may have given us an excellent preview of the end battle in It: Chapter Two, and that while it was entertaining, you'd probably be better off making sure there's nothing else you want to see first.*SPOILERS SPOILERS SPOI?ERS*So by the time the end sequence rolls around, the last two girls have figured out that the sacrifice they tried to make to get their missing friend back earlier should have been a blood sacrifice. Stuff happens, they both die, and the little sister of one of the girls (who had been tricked into 'helping') is the only survivor.....and missing friend is still missing for some reason. I guess Slendy liked her so much he decided to make her his new live-in housewife?

Literally THE worst 'horror' experience I've had across every medium. The acting is terrible, the 'scares' are hardly scary, and the characters are so unrelatable and easy to dislike that I spent most of the movie rooting for their deaths. The script is so poorly written and the story is unbelievably cliche and dull. The ending was quite depressing, which wasn't a problem for me as I usually enjoy that sort of thing, but it was terribly done and incredibly unsatisfying. The formula for every jumpscare is the exact same so you always know when one is coming, which takes the fun out of it, not to mention a majority of them are just fakeouts to supposedly get you prepped for the 'REAL' scares, which are stupidly tame. There are no truly unexpected scares. The titular antagonist is only on screen for about a minute throughout the duration of the entire film, and his portrayal isn't even that frightening. Every scary scene has way too much buildup and not enough bang, although it does get slightly creepier within the last 10-15 minutes, but even then it isn't worth suffering through the rest of the film. I scare quite easily, but even watching it on a huge screen in a dark theater I wasn't scared in the slightest. Honestly, I could not stop laughing at how stupid the characters and their choices were and and how unscary the movie really was. I had read plenty of bad reviews and even from trailers I could tell this would be terrible, but it far exceeded my expectations. An outstanding experience if you like to roll your eyes and laugh at bad movies, but if you're looking for something genuinely scary and interesting, this ain't it chief.

reviews.review_title: Oh my God, they killed the myth of Slender Man with a film
reviews.content: What started off as an internet urban legend has finally been committed to the silver screen, unfortunately it's been packaged up in a way that, according to reviews, isn't to everybody's liking. From my point of view, I have to agree with the reviews I've seen too - which is a pity as this could have been a great horror film.In short, a group of school friends attempt to disprove the existence of Slender Man, by beckoning him. When one of the friends goes missing, it becomes apparent that they were wrong in disbelief.The story has been told before, albeit with different characters bringing the scares. The way the plot unfolds, has also been done before, in some instances in the other stories I'm thinking about in that last sentence. The film actually felt like a 'lift and shift' from about 50 other movies I could name. Despite having an occasionally dumb script, the cast seem to do their best - thankfully they have to scream a few times and that detracts from the script. This film may actually go on to become the reason why the internet urban legend is killed and forgotten - pity. The 3 out of 10 I'm giving this is kind.

reviews.review_title: The 1 star rating was made for this film
reviews.content: I never though a film would be so bad it would require a one star rating like most films (even awful ones) have some saving graces but this one really makes it tricky to find any. The only thing I can really think of is that the actors tried there best with the terrible script they had to work with and that's the only thing that earns it a point to be honest. I wasn't expecting this to reinvent the genre but damn watching paint dry would actually be more entertaining.

Boring
Bored
Boredom
Poo
Poop
PoopyIs that enough characters for a review?

What an utter pile of trite this film was. At best, the acting was passable. There weren't any actors that I would say are phenomenal, but they were average. As for the visual effects, I will say that they were decent as well. As for the whole idea behind the Slender Man itself, I have no issues with because for there is little to no official backstory behind this internet boogeyman, so the film not really going into an explanation of what he is or where he came from is a nonissue.What is an issue is characters. All of the characters in the film hardly have personalities aside from the cliché tropes that horror films use. Because of this, the film fails to keep you invested with the characters making their inevitable confrontation with the titular man in black lacking. This is one of the issues that several horror films share: these characters are not people. They are only there as disposable cannon fodder to be killed. As such, it's hard to care about the characters when they are in grave danger because you have no reason to.The film uses the same tired horror tropes that most average horror films employ such as using loud noises or jumpscares. Ultimately, they do nothing to mix it up or add a new spin on it. The Slender Man itself even looks bad given how it is poorly CGI-rendered. It could give one memories of 2017's The Bye Bye Man because it looks like the developers of the film took a snap of Slender Man from that 2012 game and poorly implemented it into the movie. 
Unsurprisingly, Slender Man is another bad film brought to you by Sony Pictures that is around four or five years too late. At the very least, the film is a riot to laugh at.
I wasn't expecting much and i was still disappointed with this film. I mean come on its based off a popular urban legend its gonna be terrible.
An unfinished movie not worth seeing. A good idea poorly executed, Could of made a good found footage movie In the hands with more talented filmmakers.

reviews.review_title: A just rating for a film like this
reviews.content: This film is bad. It has a few solid moments sprinkled in here and there, but overall just lacks. The acting isn't horrendous, Botet did amazing considering what he had to work with, and the film has one or two decent jump scares. Apart from that, I wish they would have doven in more to the actual mythos and maybe some of the original mideas like the games or short stories to make it scarier and more appealing. One watch of this film is plenty.

I'm expecting this to be rubbish. I quite fancied it when I first heard about it and saw a few stills, but reports are not good. We're in small suburban 'get me out of this town' America... again. These things are always set in exactly the same place aren't they. This one see's us join a group of 4 high school girls. They're bored. At a sleepover the subject of Slender Man comes up. An internet lore about a tall bloke with long arms that takes children to another place. The film's source is a muddy story, born via the internet in the early naughties. A narrative comprising different directions and ideas from a multitude of creators, no one really taking ownership. A creature designed by committee. This fundamentally is the problem with Slender Man now brought to the cinema screen. The girls watch a video on how to summon him, it's predictably spooky graphic nonsense. Some chiming bells, pagan symbols etc. Nothing happens... or does it. Wren (Joey King) is having nightmares and Katie (Annalise Basso) is oddly drawn to creaking trees in graveyards. Then Katie goes missing. It's all fairly standard stuff, largely at night, where figures are hidden in the shadows. Forests with tall trees and flashlights. Eerie music and nocturnal wildlife. Teenage occult dabblings. There's too much instant belief in the myth from the three remaining girls for this to have any bite, but I guess you have to except the tropes and hope for the best. It's biggest problem is it's reliance on jump scares, not to mention lack of substance. It's a nice simple short story at best, that even at 90 minutes feels like it's struggling to hold any interest. I'm fine with a silly suspense thriller. I don't need gore, amazing FX, not this has those, but I need a solid story and a plot that's engaging. This essentially is a bit of dull preamble, followed by a flatline hour of the three girls being stalked by Slender Man whilst they try to retrieve Katie from his clutches. One by one they're picked off, there's no ebb and flow it's just a slow creep or plod toward the end. I'll admit I do like the Slender Man design, he's a simple and elegant monster, but aesthetics alone cannot carry a film. The reports were right.
This movie is bland, not scary and just plain bad. Dont bother. Some of the scenes are so pitch black you cannot even see whats happening. Maybe thats a good thing cause its that bad.

reviews.review_title: It's Not THAT bad, but still bad.
reviews.content: Simply put; The first half is boring as all Hell and the second half is pretty cool. I was about 13ish when Slender became the short lived household name. Being a lover of horror at the time, I ate it up. I am the demographic for this movie ~ It's just below average. The first half barely had any substance to it, the second was trippy, scary and attention grabbing.If you didn't grow up with Slender, skip it. If you're curious, the second half is worth it.

reviews.review_title: Creepy story but effects could be better
reviews.content: First of all, I'm not very familiar with the Slender Man lore and have no experience whatsoever on anyhing creepypasta - I hardly even know what that is. So I just watched the movie for what it is, a movie about some scary monster.I thought it was watchable, somewhat enjoyable, though a little bit slow at times. Everyhting was pretty average. Some cool looking scenes, like the foggy forest. My favorite scene was the video call sequence where the monster(?) calls a person in the house...That was creative and genuinely chilling...a brand new take on the 80's slasher and "Scream" telephone tradition. Also the nightmare scenes with false awakenings and surreal imagery were cool because I like that kind of dreamlike randomness.In general I felt like the movie was a bit scarier than average horror film. Usually the monster feels just like an enemy and you know the hero is going to find some way to destroy him. But here, the monster is more eerie and abstract and creates an unnerving feeling because you start to fear for the main characters who seem to become more and more helpless against the monster.The monster itself was done pretty poorly. The concept of the character looks good on paper and has potential for super creepy scenes but that potential was not used very well. Yes, the movie is creepy, but mostly so when the monster is not visible. When he enters the picture the mood goes towards 50s' rubber suit monsters, if you know what I mean...you see the monster from close range and it just looks cheap. But even though the monster effects weren't that good, somehow the movie still has enough scarepower to stay interesting.I don't know why the movie has gotten so much bottom ratings. My guess is that fans of Slender Man internet stuff are disappointed in the movie and vote it down for protest. But for a regular horror movie watcher I say it's worth checking out once because it does have some creative quality. There are worse ways to spend your autumn night with.
This is a horror movie that will make you watch asleep. . . I don't know if this is the reason for calling it a horror movie.

reviews.review_title: It was better than Boogey Man
reviews.content: Thats really all the postive I can say about it. One of the actresses really acts her butt off and there is a HILLARIOUS make out scene that just about ended the movie for me, I was laughing so much I missed the next couple of scenes but there's so little story and continuity it doesn't matter. For a not that old internet meme Slender man movies have been done to death at this point. If you are reading these reviews first, wait for streaming.

reviews.review_title: It only ends in insanity or death
reviews.content: Teen girls conjure Slender Man and find him. Lots of screaming and sniveling and whimpering. The first encounter using a cell phone I thought was an effective scare, after that the film scares left something to be desired. Joey King was good but overused. Zelda Rubinstein has passed, so there is no interesting help from the cavalry. I couldn't get into it.Guide: F-word. No sex or nudity.

reviews.review_title: a disgrace to the horror movie world.
reviews.content: This movie was simply brutal. Not at all scary and the story itself was stupid. I would rather watch every chucky movie ever than watch this.
Watching slender man is like taking a poop and looking at it for 90 minutes before you flush it.

reviews.review_title: Puts the Blair Witch Project to shame
reviews.content: That movie was laughable but this one got me all intense

reviews.review_title: Went in open-minded, still found the reasoning behind the bad reviews
reviews.content: It was years ago when we were playing slender man game in a dark room with friends, trying to get scared, when we absorbed the creepypasta and the whole "mythos" of slender man, if you can call it that. I always thought that the concept would make a good horror movie & I still think it could work, but it definetly didn't with this one. I went in open minded, because of reading a lot of sensibly sounding 5 to 6/10 reviews, and because the trailer didn't seem all that bad. With an open mind I watched the 1st 1/3 of their movie, staying positive, but it just went downhill from the starting point. I'll start with the pros, whatever few there is: Cinematography & editing were the only things that held up, it's not really visually bad, if we're judging it by what a pg-13 horror can be. It's decent and does not create problems, that made that 3.1 rating up there happen. Acting was also on level, that wasn't the aspect that will make the most cringe. What could make you cringe is the story/plot - in my opinion, this was the easiest, cheapest way to bring slender man mythos to screen - there's way more potential to this. Even bigger problem was the screenplay which simply felt lazy and lousy, as if they went with the first ideas on the whiteboard, not pushing the creative thinking it all. Basically, you've seen the whole formula too many times already. That's pretty much it, the script didn't generate any excitement, mystery or suspense, so it all came out as a flat note, a boring snooze fest. The trailer was better than the movie itself, and that has never been good. Believe an honest horror fan and stay away from this, read the creepypasta again, if you want a slender man vibe again. My rating: 3/10.
To say this is an awful film is giving it to much credit.
It was so bad... the ending was terrible. The characters were boring. Waste of time. Dont bother watching this

We ain't looking at Carpenter movie here.
This is one in a million b horrors. Forgotten directly after watching.
There Is one scene that could have been really creepy and thats the paranormal mobile cam.
But the actions the actresses make are those of a comatose patient. They just stand there like dummies and occationally fall down and crawl one meter upon danger. And what Is slender mans deal?? Why does be have like 20 different powers. He kidnaps, he turn into a cgi tree sprider, he makes the victim dream nightmares like freddy krueger, he shadowmorphs through doors, he's invisible etc. its just too much crap going on with the character and they dont land on something substational. What, who and why is this thing? Why does he wear a suit?? Whoever came up with slender must have a very bad imagination. This was one of those movies when you surf on the phone and then watch the tv when something happens.

I just saw Slender Man, and it sucks, it had no jumpscares, and it did not even get people chills. Slender Man: the game is good, but the movie, hell no! Slender Man is one of the worst scary movies of 2018. So, Austill a Viesta, Slender Man.

This movie is so terrible, I'm actually pissed I wasted my money. Only saw it because my girlfriend wanted to see it, even when I told her about the bad reviews. I'd easily give this 0 stars if I could.

Several teenage girls whilst playing around regenerate a murderous urban myth and then suffer the consequences whilst trying to get it to stop. This is a standard often used story line that we've seen before. This however lacks all the ingredients to make it a thriller and falls flat. The scenes at night were so dark that you couldn't see what was happening as this happened quite a lot it was frustrating. ( I know it supposed to be dark but in a film you should still be able to see what's going on)

reviews.review_title: First time that I am this bothered by imdb trolls
reviews.content: Slender Man is not a good movie. It's not utterly bad, but it's far from decent or even entertaining. Is that a problem? Of course not. But if you've seen your share of horror movies, than you can't miss the mistakes in this movie. I'm not talking about plot holes, or goofs, but sloppiness.The acting isn't even that bad, and the performer who played Slender Man, did a great job. But other than that, this movie relies on annoying characters, terrible motivation and dialogue, borrowing from an existing urban legend, but without adding background or originality, no conclusive (open) ending etc. etc. The biggest sin from this movie is (a) that it simply isn't scary, and (b) that it doesn't even attempt to be original, resulting in everything just falling flat.Again, is this a huge problem? Of course not. It's a horror movie that you can watch with low expectations. But the amount of people giving this a 1 or 10, while writing a complete nonsensical review, is astonishing. I know this isn't rare nowadays, so it's a pity that many people are (purposely?) raising the wrong expectations.

I just needed to see a few scenes to know it was bad.. I work at a theater so I had to check in on it and man... it was something of another breed. If this was advertised Last minute as a comedy, it would be a lot more effective.

You know, I actually think the Slender Man mythos is quite interesting and has potential as a movie.
And if I try real hard, perhaps I can forget that this trainwreck exists and hope some one will make a decent movie out of the background material, in the near future.The story is horrible and so is the acting. I am fairly certain I can produce better effects myself in MS Paint. The screen is also so dark, that you would think you were watching a certain episode of Game of Thrones.One could go into details but much like the people behind this movie must have thought all through the creation of this garbage: why bother?

reviews.review_title: Not that good, not that bad..
reviews.content: Like many I'm really surprised by the low 3.2 rating of this movie. I've seen better, but I also saw much worse movies with a much higher rating. This one really had a lot of scary imagery (especially the scene with Lizzy in the hospital freaked me out) and builds tension quite well. But the dialogue is pretty ridiculous at times and the acting, especially in the first few scenes, leaves a lot to be desired. Still I'm glad I sat this one out!
The easiest way to describe this movie is that's it's to boring to be so bad it's good. Bad script, bad acting, and poor source material makes a forgettable story.

Hitman with out a face.
Boring, pretictable, useless story line, characters are such a bore no story about characters, this movie misses loads of bits you need to know so much that you wonder why is this bit happening or happened.
Way to much use of the hitman agent slender, he was more a main character than actually being a supernatural force that you couldn't see, way to much use of zooming and making rooms and woods seem to shrink and lengthen..
Very boring all the jump scares are predictable, and the ending well?? At least it just ended.

reviews.review_title: Slender Man - Scary imagery, nothing else.
reviews.content: Now, I have known about good ol' Slendy since about 2013-2014. Watched a lot of playthroughs, even two fan films. One slightly better than the other but both INFINITELY better than this boring, uninteresting, unimaginable, dark film. Oh, I don't mean the story, I mean the actual movie. What happened here? It is so dark that I had to squint my eyes several times. I also spent an entire day as it was so incredibly boring that I nearly fell asleep(I actually think I DID once) I mean, I like thematically dark movies but when the movie itself is so dark that you can't see, you did something wrong.The movie is about this girl disappearing. Why? Slender Man. How? I dunno, there's no build-up in the slightest , it happens in broad daylight and NO ONE SEES HER DISAPPEAR! IN BROAD DAYLIGHT! SURROUNDED BY TEACHERS AND FRIENDS! J-just how? How I tell ya?Now, is the story good? Well, no. It's a story. Long story short( HA!) The Slender Man movie is a compilation of "scary" images. There is no REAL story here, just a guy wanting to show his co-workers his film portfolio. Really, this looks like a demo-reel, a conceptual film about the character.Oh, and how, you ask, does Slendy travel around? Apparently, by watching this rip-off Ringu( (The Ring) video on a website (Yeah, not Youtube, just a website) he comes around creepin' while you're sleepin', weirdly possessing the father of the girl to attack her friends. That's what I thought at first, but NOPE. He's just insane and nothing comes out of that: He breaks into the her friend's house, tries to kill them and gets arrested later that night. Yeah, and good ol' Slendy is in the living room in a scene, but it's so dark that I can't see him. I have to REWIND even though the sound is telling me to be scared.Oh, and the ending? So confusing. I think.In short, don't watch this unless you want a really good nap.

reviews.review_title: Slender thin plot and characters: The Horror Movie Needs Some Tweaking
reviews.content:
Horror movies are flooding into the theater almost as fast comedies, and despite the mediocre reviews they continue to be churned out at the breakneck speed. Tonight, despite a Sci-Fi horror releasing this week, a second horror wants to take a stab at winning the box office battle. Robbie K here, bringing you another movie review to help guide your viewing pleasures. Let's get started as I share my opinions on: Movie: Slenderman (2018)Director:
 Sylvain White
Writers:
 David Birke, Victor Surge (based on a character by) 
Stars:
 Joey King, Julia Goldani Telles, Jaz Sinclair 
LIKES: Short Run Time
Good Cinematography
Makeup/Visuals
Design of Antagonist
Okay Acting Slenderman doesn't have much going for it for me, but at least the movie is at a short run time of about 80 minutes, so you don't have to put up with too long of a movie (assuming you stay for the whole show). The faster pace film has packs plenty of creepy-crawly mood to it, mostly thanks to the cinematography and setting designed for the movie. Bring in the makeup and visuals to further add that shadow of sadness/doom alongside the realistic setting and you an even strong case of being disturbed by the movie. Slenderman's various actions really can get under your skin, and once his form is solidly captured on set, you might get the final ambience of shivering in your skin as the CGI monster stalks the "heroines". As for the cast, they do well with the direction they were guided down, but I can't say more outside of that. DISLIKES: The Characters
The Disturbing Imagery
Plot Holes
Chaotic Camera Work
Aimless Direction Unfortunately, the dislikes pile up, more so in how stereotypical this movie went forgoing any originality and potential for superficial gimmicks. The first aspect are the characters, very shallow teenagers who not only dug themselves a major hole in this film, but refusing to change. The static development leaves little to root for, nor any promise that things are going to go well for the teenage girls. Sadly, the girls primary growth occurs in their ability to tolerate the awful images the CGI ghost brings with him. Like the Ring, these visuals are not the most pleasing to watch and some felt unnecessary to include, thereby making their inclusion all the more pointless. Instead they should have worked on the story, for it had many plot holes and dead ends that were disappointing to say the least. Slenderman's avenues are quickly interrupted by prolonged bouts of cat and mouse games, where the camera work fails to capture all the details you wanted to see. In addition, the movie did not succeed in taking a firm direction, leading to this spiral of hodge-podge horror that left me bored, listless, and counting the minutes for this predictable film to end. I'll applaud the nods to other horror movies, but this piece meal needed some refining to bring Slenderman out to his full horror. The Verdict:  Slenderman looked insane, and it delivered on that quite well in regards to the mental war it plays on the girls. Your scares come from realistic setting and camera work, but outside of that there is little to harp on. The movie's story is unfocussed, needing some editing and rewrites to really dive into the tale they wanted to present. In addition, deeper characters and better focus on the CGI villain is a must if the series is to survive. As such, I can't recommend this movie for theater, nor is it worth your time at most rental sites (unless you are a teen looking to test your merit). Given everything coming out save your money and target those movies in the near future. 
My Scores: Horror: 4.0
Movie Overall: 3.0-3.5

For those who want to know; is Slender Man a good horror film, the basic answer is...not really. For the longer answer, let's strap ourselves in and analyze this mess. Going into this film, I had heard multiple stories; none of them good. I'm not going to focus on the film's tastelessness in bringing to life an internet legend that resulted in a disturbingly horrific crime. By the time this film premiered, the Slender Man craze had come and gone, and despite there been so much material for this film to use, it is really quite two-dimensional.To the film's credit, there are some genuinely creepy scenes that do create a sense of dread, with great use of imagery occasionally used. The functional original score does add to the sustained threat, the drum beat used when Slender Man is near being especially effective, though even the soundtrack can't save the film, with some of the 'scary' devices shamelessly repeated, causing the effect to be significantly reduced. As the film progresses, it begins taking cliché horror tropes from better known franchises, in particular, The Ring, including a cursed video and a girl in desperate need of a hair-cut. If parroting classics wasn't enough, there are sequences of trippy hallucinations, in which POV shots that incorporate Hitchcock's dolly-zoom technique are used, alongside bizarre transitional effects that make little sense. During one 'horror' moment I burst out laughing, and unless Slender Man is secretly a parody, this represents a failure on the filmmaker's part.What doesn't help the horror are the film's characters. Two issues; first, I would be hard-pressed to describe any of them, considering the significant lack of characterization. Second, the main character is boring. Stereotypically in horror films, the protagonist tries to warn a group of rational-minded individuals who refuse to accept the truth, of the supernatural threat. This movie however, probably thinking it was being intelligent, flips this on its head, whereby the lead character is the one with their head in the sand. Hallie (Julia Goldani Telles) is a plank of wood, who isn't particularly likable, for A) her refusal to accept the truth, even when she sees Slender Man watching her, B) the inconsiderate attitude she demonstrates for her friends, being more smitten for a guy than her BFFs, C) her choice to ignore her sister (Taylor Richardson), and D) the idiotic decisions her character makes that put her, and others, at unnecessary risk.If you knew there was an evil entity in the woods, would you go there? Well, these characters do. Perhaps I should now talk about the 'plot'. Hallie, along with her three friends, Wren (Joey King), Chloe (Jaz Sinclair) and Katie (Annalise Basso), during a sleepover, decide to summon Slender Man, which is as easy as clicking on a link. The three girls are all affected by the 'ritual', eventually leading to one predictably disappearing. There is also Tom (Alex Fitzalan), who is shoehorned in as a potential love-interest, and whose narrative is largely unfulfilled in the five odd minutes he appears in. Besides the contrived nature of the plot, the second biggest issue is that the feature doesn't focus upon Wren, who is the film's most intriguing character, demonstrating a determination to help others, studious investigative skills, and courage; three qualities that the other characters lack.This is only exacerbated by the utter stupidity of the characters. Their investigation into how to put an end to Slender Man's pursuit leads them to an 'expert' online, who provides strict guidelines that must be followed to the letter. Do you think more than one character decides to do the complete opposite? You would be right. Do you think more than one character does exactly what they were told not to do? Two for two. This makes feeling sympathetic for the characters a challenge, for how can you feel sorry for anyone who lacks total common sense and reasoning?That said, the film is almost entirely logical...until the 2/3 mark where we get to a hospital sequence. Then it devolves into a contradictory, illogical mess. There is a twist around this part, though it was less a shocker, and more of an 'Oh, that's what's happening, eh?' Over the course of the feature, we occasionally receive glimpses of the world Slender Man inhabits, and in so doing, we can almost imagine the kind of film we could have received. All ghosts are meant to have 'rules' that they abide by, and the lacking complexity surrounding the antagonistic force is disappointing to say the least.Why is he summoned from the internet? How is he able to affect technology? Why does he wear a fancy three-piece suit? Why doesn't he have a face? How come he occasionally has tentacles? Why does he exclusively target children and teenagers? What is his secret to being so thin? I know the film is based upon an urban legend conceived entirely online, and the audience could do some investigation of their own, but still, refusing to add depth to the film's title villain is just lazy screen-writing.Slender Man is ultimately...fine, but it doesn't succeed in developing a compelling or thought-provoking narrative. Neither does it effectively create a nightmarish fantasy that will ruin your sleep. You can watch it once, though repeated viewing may potentially damage your intelligence.

reviews.review_title: Do NOT waste your dime OR time trying to see this on a small screen . . .
reviews.content: . . . since you'll find it extremely frustrating (if not impossible) to do so. SLENDER MAN is filmed in "Rip-Off Mode" (aka, Dark-O-Vision). Viewers are barely able to make out key images on giant theater screens. This certainly "saves" tons of money for the film's distributors, as there is virtually no need to spend any cash for such "extras" as production design, art direction, set decoration, costumes, make-up, or hair styling. (The cast could be acting in the buff most of the time, and movie watchers would never know it.) Why bother with any of these normal film essentials, when the dim, murky gray final product would obscure it all? SLENDER MAN comes from Sony, the official propaganda arm of Japan's so-called government. Sore losers Hell-bent upon seeking revenge over a World War Two that THEY started and lost, Japan has been using Sony to launch one sneak attack after another upon unsuspecting American film-goers. (SLENDER MAN begins with an on-screen warning that it may cause epileptic seizures and other dire psychological side effects.) SLENDER MAN pictures our USA Homeland as a Twilit Dump, poorly illuminated by about one candle power. Don't fall for this insidious slander!

There's nothing worse in a predictable horror movie. Not only was it will be predictable but the acting was trite. In addition the movie was far far too long for what to try to accomplish. It's a shame that we are subjected to movies like this, do not waste your time or your money go rent a classic instead.Spoiler: everyone who dies issue you expect to die.

Just came back from seeing this & have to say that the strong, toffee nosed middle film critic hate on this film is completely out of order! I'll admit it was epic but at the same time it was creepy & scary enough & better than other supernatural films which are blander, boring & let's face it, over rated to the core & made simply for the sake of film snobs & not causal viewers. The film is about the creepy internet & creepy pasta urban legend, Slender Man! Like Jeff The Killer, he's an urban myth demon, who takes children by luring them in. He gets in your head & then reels you into the dark abyss with him!Now there isn't a lot of complexity to this film, but I think that's great considering it makes a change from seeing other boring, complex & overload horrors designed to be made for snobby people as a pose to having a fun critic free night with mates to have a laugh with. The films story-line was simply & I liked it that way.The characters were good too, (beautiful) but the main focus was the horror villain himself. The visuals were pretty good too & the blandness of the film was designed to be like that on purpose to fit in with the films grim, dark & foreboding tone! So those moaning about the bland part obviously were wanting a comedy like film, you're in the wrong cinema screen if that's what you wanted. Though the gore was absent from this, I knew what type of horror this was & in fact wasn't bad. The film was also good for the run time & not too long & dragged out! 1 hour & 26 minutes.Though the film was a little bit weak & dull in a few places I overall thought it wasn't a bad film at all! For those seeking out to cut up films like this remember to do the following: Switch off, calm down, relax & remember this is a film for entertainment! Leave your critic attitude at the door before you leave!6/10

It is not scary, not funny, not anything .. just noise and a disjointed story that makes no sense. Horror is supposed to be scary this got me on one jump scare that's it. It wasn't suspenseful really, didn't get me biting or picking my nails. I was looking at my phone the entire time mostly. This is one of those movies where you can do that. Where you can look at your phone look up a few times and still be able to follow it. It was more of a miss then a hit. They could've done a lot more with it. It seemed as though it was more psychological then horror but even then psychological movies have gotten me scared before. I got nothing from this one. Too bad, there were some good actresses in this movie but they couldn't really put much into the characters because they weren't really thought out that well, in my opinion that is. If you want a movie to be good you have to be able to connect with the characters. I liked the characters I did but I didn't connect or relate. Weird friend group as well because the only thing that connected them was that they go to the same school. No background to why they're such good friends. This movie could've been done so well but they just missed it and it was very disappointing. 5/10 stars just to be nice. I liked the movie but again disappointed with the out come.

reviews.review_title: After reading opinions, you'll think this movie is a disaster. Oh well, it's not so bad.
reviews.content:
"Those who hear the three bells toll, accept his invitation.
When you hear the first, you must close your eyes, keeping words unspoken.
If one wants to hear, you must listen closely, for they are soft and distant."I was really curious about this movie. Not that I expected anything spectacular. But the photos with this cult figure, which popped up on the internet, were rather intriguing. Not really scary but mysterious. A faceless figure with disproportionate limbs who appears in the background while observing children playing. A kind of Pied Piper of Hamelin who lures innocent children and makes them disappear. The fact this creation is the result of an internet competition is widely known. I was only curious if this figure would convince in a horror film. Well, it's not really innovative. You'll see the same clichés again. And the same stupidities and bad decisions are made by those who are about to become a victim. And the same tricks out of "Horror for dummies" are applied.And yet, I didn't think it was bad. "Slender man" certainly isn't such a big fiasco as you might think. It isn't as disastrous as the comments you can read here and there on the internet. It won't go down in history as one of the most frightening or bloody horrors of all time. And the obscure and dark images creates an appropriate atmosphere but also ensure that you can't see a damn thing most of the time. But I felt that constant threat and the fear among the four teenage girls. And no, I won't have panic attacks immediately when hearing the sound of crackling wood. But these sound effects did create a creepy mood.Normally I am such a person who whines about the fact that too little background information is given in a film. You are kept in the dark (appropriate for this movies) in terms of the origin and arising of the particular creepy phenomenon. With "Slender Man", however, I didn't think this was necessary. It made Slender Man even more mysterious. Summoning malicious demons also isn't exactly something new. Only recently you could see in "Pyewacket" how a frustrated teenage girl evoked something similar with the help of an occult ritual. And a long time ago, a group of young adults played a tape in "The Evil Dead" which caused Kandarian spirits to ruin everything. In "Slender Man" the cause of all the misery is a video on YouTube. Maybe that fits with today's time, but perhaps this bothered me the most. They tried to make it too hip. Especially when afterwards this ancient legend also knows about mobile phone technology.Maybe that's the problem with this movie. They focused more on the continuation of the internet hype and tried to make a modern horror out of it. They lost sight of the concept of a well-thought-out horror. Maybe it fits perfectly with the life the four teenage girls Wren (Joey King), Hallie (Julia Goldani Telles), Chloe (Jaz Sinclair) and Katie (Annalize Basso) lead. A group of carefree teenagers who gained a certain popularity status at school (as seen in so many other Highschool films) and show an everyday affinity with current modern technology. They have more affection for their smartphone than for their fellow students. Yes, they display a kind of arrogance. To such an extent that they simply ignore the warnings for watching the video. Until one of them suddenly disappears and they realize that they might be stalked by this lugubrious figure.Want to know my conclusion in the end? The whole legend created around this Slender Man was much more interesting than the film itself. All in all, it wasn't original and I didn't see anything baffling new in this film. But I still found certain scenes successful. Such as the one in the library with the use of a sort of psychedelic footage. And throughout the film, there are more of those hallucinatory passages. Also, I didn't think the acting was that awful. Ok, sometimes the four girls acted rather childish during meaningless conversations. And yes, some of their decisions were downright stupid. But that suited these young girls. And finally, I also thought the appearance of the mysterious Slender Man was reasonably successful. He blended perfectly with the background so you had this feeling that he could appear at any time. It's Javier Botet again who has put his peculiar physique at the service to play this nasty character. Just like he did in "Mama", "Don't knock twice" and "Mara". No, "Slender Man" wasn't disastrous, but seasoned horror fanatics will look at it in a rather condescending way. Beginners, on the other hand, might be afraid this faceless figure will show up. After all, they've seen a large part of the illustrious video. Not?

reviews.review_title: Do not waste your hard earned money....
reviews.content: There is no easy way to say it but this movie is simply boring. It is not even a RedBox material.

This film just is your average bad horror movie. Some scenes are just in the film because the set thought that it looked cool, well thats not how you make an effective horror movie. The movie tries to establish that the teens have been friends for years their conversations are so awkward like they just met. if you want to watch this film, be ready for some funny cgi, bad character development and plenty of plot holes and scenes that just don't make sense. There just isn't any story.

reviews.review_title: A Film Six Years Too Late
reviews.content: This film just didn't really get the ball rolling, the Slender Man character had lost a fair amount of media hype for several years at this point, so making a film at this point seemed a bit odd, maybe if it has been in developmental hell than I can understand that.However the lighting choices were very bad, like I know horror movies are meant to be dark, but not too the point of not seeing anything without turning the brightness up, it could've helped if it was a little bit brighter.The main gripe I have with the film is the summoning of the Slender Man, it's just a haunted video that lures, which is a bit of a pretty overused trope in the genre. They had source material of the actual creepy pasta online, they could've played it up to the slender man that people who were online back then know.A real missed opportunity.

Some college girls invoke the Slender Man (a generic spooky apparition) and spend a few hours being chased around and murdered.This is obviously not a new idea and it isn't presented in a particularly different way.The cast is good and the characters are interesting enough, the camera work and production are fine.Even for a horror this film feels very long.
The Slender Man toys with its prey before finishing them off with impunity.
This means anything the characters do is ultimately pointless.
They run and hide and shout at each other but it is always clear they are going nowhere: unless the Slender Man decides to let them go according to whatever twisted logic he works on.This is not very scary, not very engaging or exciting. It's just a bunch of girls hanging out waiting to get murdered - or not.This is not a bad movie just very standard.

When you decide to make a horror film, actually produce said horror film...
it makes no sense to then chicken out and CUT all the horror from the film and release what is left. 
Anything spooky is gone. All the violence is gone. Entire characters are removed from the film (because they die, obviously, sad-face). 
Sony has gone and done a massive goof again, accelerating their decent down the drain.
Avoid this film like the plague.
Looks noting like The game at all! Seriously, this slender is stupid. go commit not watching slenderman

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as most reviews
reviews.content: I found the movie pretty good. I don't really know why all the bad reviews. Not that scary, but I liked the cinematography. Special effects not great though.

reviews.review_title: One of the best comedy films I have ever seen
reviews.content:
Slender Man is one of the funniest comedies out there. Even from the very beginning of the movie, you could tell it was going to be great. Every scene is composed in such a ludicrous way that it had me laughing hysterically all the way through.Spoiler warning for those who haven't witnessed this masterpiece:
There is a scene in particular that was by far the funniest part of the movie. I am of course talking about the incredible make out scene one of the girls who I can't remember the name of and some dude idk. Their romantic chemistry was built up throughout the movie especially the scene where they exchange glances - that part was just incredible. Anyway so they're making out and then the Slender Dude makes her start to hallucinate and the boyfriend starts to freak out screaming. Never have I laughed so hard in my life. It was like a terrible attempt at after effects - this was intentional of course.Overall, Slender Man is a modern masterpiece.It has just the right blend of comedy and story that makes it a super entertaining movie to sit through.And that's why I gave Slender Man 1/10

REVIEW - SLENDER MANUK release date 24 August 18What started out as a meme in 2009 in an online forum to create a scary character has developed into an Urban Myth, various games and now a film. There have been a few fan films made but this is the long overdue film which fans of the Slender Man character have been waiting for, but was it worth the wait? I am afraid not, not by a long shot which is such a shame because the Urban Myth, character and subsequent games could have ensured a massive audience but with its simple yet predictable story this isn't even scary in the slightest, yes better than the extremely silly Hereditary. In my personal opinion the film is just wrong and could have been far better, take the Urban Myth about Candy man (I dare you to say Candy Man 3 times) which actually acknowledged the Urban Myth or was it, this film from the start takes more 'its real' path and is let down because of it. I will put it to you, what is more scary, an Urban Myth that could be true or an Urban Myth that is ignored and made out to be real? One could be in the real world and the other you know isn't. This is the underlying reason why Slender Man has been so popular but the film will spoil the whole Urban Myth surrounding Slender Man and not add to it, which is an opportunity lost. Rating 3 out of 10

reviews.review_title: I guess the Lost Pages were of the script
reviews.content: Slender Man is a confusing abomination that is barely watchable and doesn't make a lick of sense despite very little actually happening throughout the entire film. There was a real life murder over Slender Man some while back, and for some reason Sony decided to whip this movie together and then back out after realizing it might be a tad tasteless or offensive, and thus they cut it down drastically and that's how we're left with this hollow husk of a movie that has to be seen for one to understand just how broken it is. It's possibly comparable to The Snowman, but I haven't seen that one. If you watch the trailers for Slender Man, and then the movie, you'll notice the boyfriend character from the trailer fails to make an appearance and several shots from the trailer alone fail to appear.What I think needed to be done to make this film worthwhile would be to have upped the ante if anything, making it more violent and wallowing in the tasteless nature of it, or making it a documentary on the real life murder, which is a vastly scarier and darker tale than the hogwash we get here. None of the characters are memorable whatsoever as they are all basically the same generic teenage girl characters, interchangeable from one another and equally ditsy with insane lines of logic throughout which somehow work out in one way or another due to plot convenience and poor writing and very little effort given in this project as a whole. This is only furthered with abhorrent pacing, with many slow, meandering shots thrown in of supposed visions, which are ultimately time-fillers to reach the 90 minute mark with inoffensive cheap shots of the wilderness. The image quality is downright gross and it's one of the hardest films to stare at for prolonged periods of time due to its disgusting color palette, horrible filters, and dull shot compositions.This movie is one of the most boring pieces of rubbish ever made, and thus I can't even recommend it as so bad it's good, because you're likely to fall asleep rather than so much as chuckle.

reviews.review_title: Can't really review it, couldn't see anything
reviews.content: Like the title says, i was watching a dark screen with loud jumpscare sounds and screaming. No idea what I watched

Hearing stories about the legend of Slender Man, four girls watch a video which will supposedly summon him. Although following precisely the instructions from the clip, the girls say that everything is nonsense, but when the suddenly begin to have nightmares about the creature and one of them goes missing, their sanity and also friendship will be put to the test.It's a supposedly horror movie which introduces the legend of Slender Man and how four girls get involved in his stories. I say supposedly because it almost not scary at all. It bases solely on jump-scares, a cheap tactic which makes the viewer startle, but without a truly scary atmosphere or creature which can generate this type of emotion. Speaking of the atmosphere, it is mostly dull, lacking suspense, drama or any sense of empathy towards the characters, making the whole action truly pointless.The plot is simply stupid. It bases its entire action on the summoning of a mystical creature, which is also as dumb as it gets, which will do what it does best to take care of the main characters, one by one. You get no drama, no suspense, no emotion... just pure linearity and also predictability. The characters are very simple, not well developed, acting strange and making irrational decisions in key moments, eliminating any chance of caring for their fate. It's almost laughable when you see how they react in different situations; that's how bad they are.In order to describe the creature, the movie uses some "special" effects which are sometimes so bad that they seem to be made in a coffee break using last century's technology. You can only imagine how disappointing or even laughable this can get, when judging the fact that they should induce fear or at least drama. Another aspect which is to be mentioned is the finale. I honestly expected it to bring something different, something that might make the previous hour and a half a bit less pointless. Unfortunately, as with the rest of the film, it fails miserably do deliver anything out of the ordinary, ending suddenly and almost without any clue.As you might have guessed by now, this movie is a disaster. It isn't able to be what it was supposed to be, a horror movie, it fails to deliver a decent story or characters and it really fails to generate fear, drama, suspense or anything like these, except a couple of cheap jump-scares. It's a truly awful movie which should be avoided at any cost.

reviews.review_title: Worse than Ju On the Grudge
reviews.content:
I'm a big Ju On hater and when I tell you it's worse it is the worst. The film was continuous on the scares which was good but there wasn't anything else in the film which made it powerful. Like the scares were repetitive but they were equally as scary which made it dull cause the scares in the film weren't really scary and the story was just about them slowly going crazy. But nothing else was present in the film but the scares and them slowly going crazy, no real other subplot that would make you want to keep going.
 I heard the people behind the movie wanted to shoot for an R rating but they couldn't cause a company or something wanted it to target a teen audience and also how some scenes were cut out but if they made it R and added the deleted scenes then maybe the film wouldve felt more complete.
If they make a extended cut with over 5 minutes if new footage I'll consider buying it. It's The Grudge meets The Ring meets It.

When the scenes get dark, give up, can't see anything happening
So much could have been done with this film but everything came across really lazy.
The Slender Man bashing is unjustified, because this low-budget supernatural horror film is really interesting.

Don't know what to say... This is terrible.The whole Slender Man phenomenon/mytholigy is intriguing. And the sociological aspects terrifying.
That said. How could this movie be so terrible?One star to the cast. Who at least try.

But this is not necessarily something bad (as the majority of ratings suggest). It's an ok mystery with some eerie scenes, nothing groundbreaking in any sort or way but also not amateurish. I'd have loved to learn more about the evil itself and the actual background story. But hey, with a bag of crisps a mildly creepy yet entertaining approach.

"Slender Man" is a Mystery - Horror movie in which we watch a group of teenage girls who are fascinated by the internet lore of the Slender Man, attempt to prove that he doesn't actually exist by summoning him with a ritual. After the ritual, each one of them started to experience some supernatural phenomena that make them believe that the story is real. Everything changes when one of them mysteriously goes missing and the others start to worry not only for her but also for themselves.I have to admit that I have high hopes for this movie and I was really disappointed by it. The plot was awful and had many plot holes and a script that could not cover them not even a bit. The cast made below average interpretations that made the audience not able to understand their feelings and what they have been through at these moments of terror. I did not like the interpretations of Joey King who played as Wren and Julia Goldani Telles who played as Hallie, and I have to say that I expected more from Annalise Basso who played as Katie because I believe that she did not reach her potential. The direction which was made by Sylvain White was average and some suspense moments - scenes were not enough.To sum up, I believe that "Slender Man" is an awful movie with a bad plot and poor direction. I do not recommend anyone to watch it but if you are curious about it and you want to watch just do not have high hopes for it because I am sure that you are going to be disappointed by it.

This isn't as awful as I expected, but it's not great by any means.Visually, it was pretty appealing. The colour palette works well and the camera work was fun at first, but got tiring by the middle of the 2nd act. The character design of slender man was also well done, and Javier Botet did a great job portraying him.
Speaking of, acting also wasn't half bad. It was a little stale at times, but for teenage actors, I think the three main actresses did their parts pretty well. Kevin Chapman also had a really solid role as Mr. Jensen, though it was rather short.The plot had potential but got real lot washy, and the third act felt all over the place and a little silly. There's little to no suspense and anything really effective in the scare department, which is a shame. This is also a film that falls victim to an over-written script, which is always frustrating. I also felt the score was really over-worked, ineffective and a little obnoxious at times.All in all, a pretty run-of-the-mill modern day creature feature. Sadly, a bit of a let down.

I thought for what seemed to be an amateur film: it had a lot of interesting film effects used throughout the movie, and most were put to reasonably good use. I thought the girls did a good job acting despite their younger age.

Slender man was your typical low budget horror movie that tries hard to scare the audience, but falls apart like a pair of cheap shoes.The good - the movie doesn't rely on constant jump scares, murdered animals, & faux blood. The actresses try to put on a decent performance but fall flat. The special FX were decently done. When you finally see old SM he's more cool looking than scary. The banter between the girls was realistic. The madness scenes were spot on, but outcome was predictable.The bad - too dark and you couldn't see what was going on. You learn about the lore towards the end of the 2nd act so at that point (if you are still watching) no longer invested.The ugly - w/o going into spoiler territory...screamy teen girls. This movie could have been a metaphor for drugs, growing up or puberty.Conclusion: I think it was a missed opportunity. If the actors, set pieces, and director were the same but different script it might have worked.

reviews.review_title: I wish the Slender Man would kill me
reviews.content: Okay so a slender man movie could be really cool, by why on EARTH did they wait this long to make a theatrical studio slender man film? The character has been outdated for like 6 years now, and NOW is the time you want to make it? Well maybe in those many overlong years they thought of something really good? Hahaha, no. Wishful freakin thinking. Instead, Slender Man is literally as bad as they get. Just think Bye Bye Man mixed with Jeepers Creepers 3 bad. The directing is really awful and it most of the editing and shots are super lazy and boring. It feels like they just got the director of one of those crappy teen dance movies..oh, wait, that's exactly what they did! And it shows. Most of the actors are bad but it usually looks like poor direction than bad acting. The script SUUUUUUUCKS and is literally the most cliche modern horror film ever, like a computer wrote it or something. The Slender man himself acts nothing like he does in the games or in the lore, and he actually runs around chasing people and roaring! Remember back in the awesome game when he just stands there staring at you from a distance? Remember how haunting that was how he didn't even move? Well now he runs and chases people like a zombie from The Walking Dead. Worst of all, the film just isn't scary and instead it's attempts to scare you are just really funny! You're blind if you don't see 99% of the jump scares coming and most of them are over the dumbest things. There's a scene with a girl in a library and you know a jump scare is coming...and it's just the librarian who walks past the camera in the most boring unclimatic way possible, like the director told her to not be scary...but the music is SO INTENSE when it happens, like this librarian walking past the camera was just the freakiest thing in the history of cinema! The entire movie is like this, just a painfully generic and boring modern horror film with nothing interesting, unique, fresh, or good. I gave it a bonus star because SOME of the cinematography shots are nice, and the musical score is occasionally good, although still a bit basic. Without those two things, this movie would be a hard 1/10 and the worst horror film since Jeepers Creepers 3.
Feels like a lot of content was cut, the characters are only relatable to middle and high schoolers, too much reliance on CG, formulaic, utter waste of time.

reviews.review_title: Just made me wanna rewatch TribeTwelve. (Copied from myself with permission)
reviews.content: For fanantics of the mythos and meme, Slender Man is too little too late. Slendy has been given mockumentary web shows (in addition to the awesome Marble Hornets) and plenty of fan films better than this supposed real deal, not to mention the popularity he was granted when an unfunny Let's Player screamed at some video games he was in. NOTE: One scene includes honest-to-God Deviantart images of the eponymous creature.It isn't original or interesting as a film on its own, either. Its similarities with the Ringu series have been noted, and it fails to translate to film that which sounds intriguing when presented as a creepypasta; a purportedly legitimate blog accompanied by an ominous series of inexplicable YouTube clips. That close-to-home realism and, dare I say it, found-footage camera work is what made the mythos believable and effective. This film is visibly more expensive, stars obvious actors (bad ones), is shot like any other movie, and has an OST by the talented Ramin Djawadi, albeit asleep at the wheel with this one.I don't mean to say that the Slender Man can't ever appear in a feature-length horror film with a budget. It's just that his is a story that works best when you read it in an email, see strange videos immediately afterwards, and soon begin to pay attention to noises from far away, as well as your own coughs. If you want to make a full-on movie about him - especially years after the Slendy ship has sailed and people are more horrified by American politics than forest-dwelling monsters that cause space-time disruptions and insanity - you'll want to make something less derivative, poorly acted, unironically formulaic and bland than Slender Man.

I knew right from the get go, that this was going to be bad. I basically just watched the movie, because a friend wanted me to go with him. The worst thing about the movie is it's boringness. The 90 minutes felt like 2 hours. Aside from that, the movie was predictable, laughable and und dumb. Pretty much every horror cliche was used in the screenplay, I guess. The characters were actually no characters due to non existent personality. Worst thing was by far how they depicted Slenderman on screen. They used CGI to create him and obviously didn't had the budget or talent to make him look realistic. When you could actually see him in all his "glory" at the end, he remembered me of a not fully rendered character from an animated movie of the 2000s. That's the reason for the horrible pun in my review-title. If you really want to watch this terrible flick, than look out for the date scene with our protagonist's boyfriend. It's hilariously bad.

Wow this movie was garbage. I'm so lucky atleast the theater has leather seating. Was able to have a nice snooze. Half way through I actually forgot what the movie was supposed to be about. I cared about 0 of the characters either. Even when we were supposed to feel bad for the main character Hallie, I just really wanted her to die the entire time. Characters were very stereotypical high school teenagrr portrayals but the actresses were not half bad. Maybe if the writing or the Adobe stock footage and camera effects didn't suck, it could be decent at most. Save your money.
The movie just plain stunk. The acting was horrible and the narrator was borish. If this movie came out in movie theaters I can imagine many empty seats because of people walking out.

reviews.review_title: A movie only good for the Slender Man fan
reviews.content: I thought it was great, really. I loved what they did with the character. It wasn't shown too much and the movie does explain a few things about Slender Man. For example: it consists entirely out of wood, and so do the tentacles, or branches in this case. There is no suit, it is just the wood giving the illusion that it's wearing a suit. The teleportation was also kept in (although it used walking or hovering most of the time), and so were the drawings. But what surprised me the most was his "final" form at the end of the movie, which I won't spoil, but it is heavily inspired by an internet image made long before the movie.Honestly, I thought it was great if you have an interest in the character, but it definitely is not your money worth if you just want to see a horror movie. The CGI in one scene was definitely bad, the branches moving at his back looked awfully fake. And the movie was too dark in my opinion. But overall, the acting was great and so was the soundtrack and setting.

reviews.review_title: Dreadful, boring, below ABC Family level horror

Joey King is interesting to watch so I have high hopes hoping she could elevate this dreck but she couldn't even save this sinking ship.

Through a feminist lens and applying environmentalist objectivism, this movie showcases the modern fear of environmental destruction resulting in devastating personal consequences. By making the beloved character of The Lorax into a terrifying emblem of masculinity and misogyny, viewers are left to question their environmental impact and their roles within society.The frequent symbolism of the oppression of the developing female body manifests through sensationalized imagery about the misunderstandings and stigma again representative of society's views. As feminism and environmentalism often go hand in hand, the film pays homage by using an actual image of a young pregnant woman birthing the roots for a revolution as far as environmental destruction pervades our society.The scene in the library helps the viewers visualize The Lorax's other hunting ground, as wooden shelves (the tortured and disfigured products of logging) are forced to cradle even more flayed and minced products of deforestation of Mother Earth. The Lorax is angered by this blatant disregard for the gifts of Nature and attacks one of the young women. While herself not a perpetrator of environmental destruction, she is struggling with her own development, and the conflict between environmentalism and feminism is representative of the way the patriarchy turns the oppressed against one another to distract from the oppression they face.In conclusion, this reinvention of the classic "Lorax" tale showcases the patriarchal fears of the consequences of oppression regarding deforestation and misogyny. The true message, as explained in the final scenes of the film, is that women must embrace environmentalism as a symbiosis to free themselves from misogyny and, at the same time, lift up the most powerful female entity of them all: Mother Nature.

I was introduced to the whole Slender Man mythos back in the day on Somethingawful. It was a photoplasty job where somebody shooped a sinister slender figure into a could of old pictures and created the being we know as "Slenderman". Memes were created. Indie survival horror games were made. And an unknown group of internet filmmakers expanded on the whole thing with their "Marble Hornets" series. And you know what's sad? When a group of film students with no real budget and bargain basement equipment can make a better movie and more interesting and layered story than a big budget movie house you know something is wrong. This movie is boring. It's dull. It's plodding and there's literally nothing to like about it. I was interested in seeing how Slenderman would be depicted on the big screen. But in the end it's just another example of how Hollywood doesn't understand the source material and messes it up every single time. This is right now in the running for the worst movie I've seen this year. Seriously. Don't see it.

reviews.review_title: Slow, Boring, Cliche'd Rip Off ... But There's Far Worse Out There
reviews.content: You'd think that they'd at least try to be a bit original with this concept, but no. Instead they did their best to rip off better horror films, namely The Ring. Well, they forgot to make it scary like The Ring, so I guess it's not a complete rip off?Sure, it's bad. It's not interestingly bad or even funny (aside from a few keen scenes). I honestly don't know if they tried to hard or didn't try hard enough.Yet, for all of it's flaws (how many times do we need to sit there and watch these girls stare at a computer screen?), at least it's somewhat watchable, albeit only once. It has some intriguing visuals and some nice cinematography (most of the time), so it wasn't a complete waste.I see this as the kind of thing young teen girls would rent for their slumber parties, because that's the only future this film has. I don't think any serious horror fan would have this in their collection and, if they do, I'd really like to know why.Hey, at least it's better than anything from The Conjuring series.
