I love no-face but the reversal leaves me disappointed. This is a bad horror but it's not the worst.

reviews.review_title: Easily the worst horror movie of 2018, maybe even of all time.
reviews.content: I didn't think it possible but Slender Man is quite possibly the worst horror movie ever made. And I've seen things. 93 unbearable minutes of stupid teenagers feeding into a 9-year-old Internet meme. Even if it was made then, what would have been the point?In 2018 Wisconsin, four teenage girls learn about the "sensation" that is Slender Man, the supernatural, faceless demon that steals children and haunts you nonstop. Via typical horror movie clichés, they watch the video (depicted in a similar manner to The Ring) and proceed to have their oh so ordinary lives upturned after one of them disappears.Either because this meme actually (most famously) inspired foolish pre-teens to try and appease the entity by attempting to kill a classmate or it's just outdated, this thing that calls itself a movie is one extended eye roll that's surely to end up in the 99¢ bin at your local convenience store. 0.5/5.

SLENDERMAN is only good if you like B-List scary flicks and cliche horror tropes. There are a few disturbing images & sound cues that create some tension, but it's all undermined by predictable jump-scares. Bring a soda, as this one tends to drag in places. Either because Slenderman is an internet meme, or just as a sign of our times, there is Heavy reliance on #Textposition, or using text messages & webpages to move the story forward. Leaves you feeling somewhat entertained, but not really scared. A brief newsfootage reel plays as the end credits start. This meme movie gets a "Give That Ghost a Sammich" rating.

reviews.review_title: An okay chiller that could have done with being more disturbing
reviews.content: A quartet of Massachusetts high school girls have read about the eponymous Slender Man, a tall faceless individual who abducts youngsters or drives them insane, and decide to perform a ritual to summon him. Not long afterwards one of them disappears. The others believe there is a way to get her back and head into the woods to summon the Slender Man once more... somewhat inevitably this doesn't work and soon they are haunted by visions of him. Will any of them survive?I thought this was okay... but it could have been so much better. On the positive side there was a good creepy atmosphere, the effects were okay and the acting wasn't bad. On the downside it felt far too anaemic, as though the makers sacrificed the chance of making it really scary or showing any gore or unpleasantness to get a more child-friendly rating. There are also quite a few genre clichés that are overused such as dreams within dreams, lots of screaming and false scares. Overall I'd say this was decent enough for something I watched on Netflix; I was just left a bit disappointed as I felt the ideas were good and could have made a great horror film... perhaps it will one day.

reviews.review_title: Is the Slender Man really for real
reviews.content: Four Massachusetts high school girls, intrigued by the internet lore of the Slender Man, conjure a ritual in hopes of debunking him. One of the friends mysteriously goes missing and what could be deduced, that she too was one of his victims. Remotely scary and pretty generic, short of boredom. Not entirely bad of a movie, just a film that could of been better.Starring are: Joey King, Annalise Basso, Julia Goldani Telles and Javier Botet as the Slender Man.

What did you do? Why why why?! This could have been amazing! I could have written a better script and I have no production or director experience! I hope you realise how bad this is and that you never direct or produce another movie again. You should be embarrassed

reviews.review_title: Uninspired in general, but not a bad effort, per se.
reviews.content: Wren (Joey King), Hallie (Julia Goldani Telles), Chloe (Jaz Sinclair), and Katie (Annalise Basso) are four small town high school students and good friends. They end up making the mistake of their lives when they meddle with "Slender Man" (six foot six, long-limbed Javier Botet of "Mama" and "It" chapters one and two), a mysterious, wispy being. "Slender Man" is selective about what he does with victims, but those he chooses not to kill or spirit away *do* end up going insane. As the girls start succumbing to the terror, those that are left desperately try to think their way through."Slender Man" is neither the best nor the worst in the entire supernatural horror sub-genre. It's let down by routine plotting by writer David Birke, and, in general, the presentation and visuals lack any real imagination. That said, at least director Sylvain White ("Stomp the Yard", "The Losers") tackles the premise & story with *dead* seriousness, and very few attempts at humor. White also refrains from going overboard on jump scares, and cuts down on the potential for cheesiness. The whole thing is suffused with a great deal of dread & atmosphere. And the young actresses in the leads do manage to actually create characters whom it's possible to care about.All things considered, this is a fairly decent modern horror film, although it's not strong enough to make it memorable in any way.Five out of 10.

I remember when Slenderman was good. When the lore itself scared the absolute ba-jeez-us out of me. That was in 2009 - 2013. Fast forward 5 years later, it's the most overused thing in the creepy pasta fandom.Just from the trailer, I could tell that this would be a bland and unoriginal movie, and boy, was I right. This is more of a random short film you would find on YouTube, normally filmed by college students on an iPhone 6 rather than a big production company.The movie uses too many overused things, like forests, maggots, hallucinations, and others you'd probably find in the "My first horror movie starter pack" or any other crappy-pasta. In conclusion, this movie uses far too many dead topics and other lores. This movie is in no way creative and is straight up plagiarising the original creepy-pasta instead of coming up with another way to tell the story.After all, Slenderman isn't that scary anymore. It's either the plot writers and creative producers live in 2009 or they seriously have no imagination when it comes to producing horror movies. Enough said.

The movie was kinda okay while I was watching it but I dont like the fact that they are scaring us with jumpscares and they are all the same for me ... and also I dont like the ending its kinda unexplained for me .. so my point is its kinda scary while you watch it ..?

As a long time follower of CreepyPastas I had very high hopes for this film, an origin story? A documentary? Nope, just a terrible horror film that got more laughs than scares out of me. The problem a lot of horror movies today suffer from are stemming the plot from the stupidity of the main character(s) and this movie is no exception. The problems start when the protagonists try to summon the Slender Man and one of them get scared and go against the rules told, thus starting a very bad string of events. This led to cheesy jump scares and the infamous start making out/doing anything sexual then the monster comes out right then moment. This movie just suffers from Horror movie cliché after Horror movie cliché and it is so upsetting to see this from a film many had hopes for.

It's boring with lazy horror clichés en even more lazy scare jumps. It all leads to nowhere, so I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Half the actors aren't very believable and the other half doesn't contribute much. Don't waste your time.

This is by far the worst movie of 2018... possibly ever. The initial idea is slenderman is dumb but of course the trailer drew my teenager in like a moth to a flame and I took him to see it today... wasted 2 hours of my life watching a potato sack wearing an old suit.
I have seen episodes of Barney that were more scary than this garbage.

Four girls summon evil thingy 'slender man' on the internet for a laugh and he starts coming after them.There seemed to be potential to make something scary out of slender man, but this misses by a mile. One by one the girls are taken by slender man, but not through frightening set pieces or any semblance of a story, but through whacky visions and dreams within dreams such that the whole thing becomes wholly derivative and basically deadly dull. King is quite convincing, but generally a poor film and one to avoid.

reviews.review_title: I know why I don't like this movie
reviews.content: Yep, I gave it a low rating. Why? Because I expected too much. I didn't mind the 3.4 rating when I clicked on this as I beleived I was gonna be scared and I was in the mood for something creepy but, this failed me. Plain & simple. I'd rather that you, yes you, just watch another movie! I love Joey King by the way, I'm just not of this movie. ;-)

Some teenage girls summon an evil supernatural being called The Slender Man by watching a video online. Kind of like a modern Ringu (1998) or its 2002 American remake The Ring, both of which involved the watching of a cursed VHS tape. Plus a bit of Candyman and Nightmare on Elm Street. Problem is this movie probably wouldn't scare your typical 10 year old, I didn't find the acting too bad but the picture is very dark and the "slender" plot just does not deliver much. Sadly this is so typical of modern horror films that get churned out left, right and centre.

reviews.review_title: Worst film I have ever seen. Total poop.
reviews.content: This is one absolute stinker. Boring. Zero character development nor sense of 'legend' as found with superior classics like Candyman. It was like being an unfortunate fly on the wall of a teenage girls sleepover. I wanted them all to die just to get it over with. The horrors start with them watching a video, ironically much like me at the start of this 90 minutes of detritus.
It could be a good movie if we are in 1990! not recommended at all

I think personally, that Slender Man should have gotten more reviews!! The jump scares were really good and terrifying! They did an excellent job with the fear of Slender Man and the affect he gives on his victims. Though I do admit that the dialogue between some of the characters was a bit cheesy and they could of made slender man look more realistic, despite that in my personal opinion the film is worth watching! :)
The most entertaining part of the 1 hour 30 minutes runtime was when I went pee

reviews.review_title: is it bad that I liked this?
reviews.content: Is there something wrong with me? Am I just a tasteless individual out there with bad taste in film? Did I just zone out of my mind and pictured a way better film in my head instead of what was on the screen? I enjoyed the Slender Man movie. It kinda disappoints me that a large majority of people hate this movie while I feel like I'm the only person in the world that likes it. If you don't lije this movie, that is perfectly fine. Do I see flaws in this movie? Yes. Do I think it's god awful? No. Do I think it's the best film ever? No. But I think it's somewhat decent. If the 16 year old part of me didn't like it, the 12 year old me definitely did. I have been a huge fan of him and his games back in 2013. I thought that a movie based on him felt like a good way to get him into mainstream again. I feel like it did it's job. The Story felt lack luster, The CG where tendrils explode through the mirror and where Tom's Head was shaking rapidly and making a distorted face felt unfinished, there was many Cliches and missed opportunities here and there. Slender Man himself looked pretty amazing, seeing him always left me with a smile on my face. The library scene has to be the best scene in the movie, it is executed very perfectly, and The Scene where Slender Man rises on his tentacles made me smile so wide, teeth were showing. So overall, not the worst film of the year, not an amazing movie, but I wasn't bored while watching it. -6.4/10

I could go on forever with my gripes about this movie, but I will confine this review to its most annoying flaw: lighting. Considering most of the film is shot in a forest at night, you'd think the filmmakers would be sure to make that footage clearly definable for an audience. But no, we aren't that lucky. In these wooded scenes, we get the classic "screen's too bright, so this black is actually a light grey" and everything is indecipherable. We get layers of different shades of black, and hardly anything can be seen. So, ultimately, you're paying to see a film that you can't even see most of the runtime. Of course a fan of the movie may argue that this is on purpose to create a mysterious atmosphere, blah blah blah. I've seen enough films to know that this error is plain and simply that: an error. There have been dozens of terrible Slender Man films, and this is no exception; don't let its semi-blockbuster-looking production fool you.

Hey, It's just 'Groot' in a suit girls, calm down!Anyways, I must say, it's a wasted opportunity, and perhaps a big one in that too. 'Slender Man' is something that had originated from the internet itself, it did not come from any ancient texts or anything, so, I guess, it would have been more desirable, had they opted for a nicer crew to work on this project! Why? Well, let's just say, this one messes the whole thing up.Despite a multitude of attempts from their end to create scares, nor once was I frightened! And this just goes to show how inefficient and incompetent the writing really was. Not that it didn't have any qualities, it definitely did, but then again the makers failed to capitalize on any of those positives, cause in the meantime, they were too occupied with incorporating the conventional touches, which didn't work out in here by the way.
What stupid little film, why even make something like this, oh yeah money, o but its awful.

Is there a need to overreact, to be so merciless and cruel with this movie, when horror fans constantly glorify and exalt films as half-baked as this? I see no reason why to give «Slender Man» such a low rating and bad comments, as if their lives depended on trashing it. After I saw and read the unfair (and coarse) reactions to Oz Perkins' beautiful and poetic «I Am the Pretty Thing That Lives in the House» in 2017, I do not trust the judgment of horror audiences anymore. It became obvious to me that we have very different definitions of horror and that we like quite different kinds of ways to evoke fear and human magical thinking. «Slender Man» is not even half as good as Perkins' motion picture, but it is efficiently packed, tense and scary. The problems I find about the movie are that its fable is underdeveloped, the profile of its horror source (the Slender Man) is underdone, the plot needed more elaboration and the creators should have gotten rid of some visually effective but dramatically pointless pieces. Just consider the scene when Hallie wanders through the corridors of the hospital where her sister is. It is a succession of gratuitous images to make the movie a bit longer. We have already seen many movies about girlfriends messing with the occult, we have seen the disappearance or killing of those kids dozens of times, and we have heard similar conclusions, told in the grave tone of the final narration, which are as silly as in this one. It is a pity then, because it speaks a lot about American fears, about the roots of terror in American folklore. It would have benefitted from more research and creative scriptwriting. As it is, «Slender Man» only achieved a small part of its purposes, but I am sure that you have seen a lot much worse "pelis" than this.

reviews.review_title: Worse than the reviews led me to believe!
reviews.content:
I started watching this movie with low expectations. I loved the Slenderman games and find them incredibly unnerving to play (particularly alone in the dark with headphones on) and when I heard this movie was being made I was certainly intrigued. I mean this is such a mysterious character. That means that the movie has unlimited options in terms of what sort of story to tell.
However, once the trailer was released I knew what we were getting: a movie that is weird for the sake of being weird. But...as a fan of the games (and someone with too much time on their hands due to the recent development of insomnia) I decided to give it a watch. I checked IMDB beforehand just to see how it was being rated. 3.1! I've NEVER seen a movie being rated so poorly. But, the comments were fairly positive. In fact, many of them claimed they didn't understand why the movie was receiving so much hate.
I'll tell you why:
1. The story is one of the most poorly written stories I've ever had the misfortune of experiencing. From the moment the movie starts, every single character is a cliche. Somehow, they manage to all be cliches and yet are still entirely underdeveloped. The character development is little to none and any character development that does take place is done through the characters themselves actually saying it.
2. The sound effects used in this movie are supposed to resemble the game (I assume) but they happen at random times, they don't sound creepy, and worst of all, you can see that the creators were under the impression that cheap-sounding special effects would help set the tone...they don't.
3. Without giving away any spoilers, you can actually see, moment by moment, all the other movies that this one took inspiration from (I say inspiration but it is closer to plagiarism.All in all, rather than leaving me scared or unnerved, this movie has actually managed to make Slenderman seem less like a horror characters and more like a spoof of one. If you'd added some jokes here and there, this movie could easily have been considered a horror movie spoof because it's THAT far away from being scary!

The characters in this movie are boring. They're maungy and melodramatic, and the generally shaky performances are okay at best. At worst, it's Wren during the second half when she's always panicking or crying. The dialogue the leads are given usually sucks, especially during those first few scenes where they're basically speaking in teen angst mode.The whole plot kicks off because the girls watch a clickbait video on some shady message board, for no reason, and we're supposed to believe that this successfully contacts Slender Man (it actually comes across more like a hypnosis or brainwashing video, curiously). Katie allows herself to be taken by him, then the rest of the girls accidentally let him in by performing a ritual to try and get her back. Most of the film, then, is just spooky scenes and situations - Slender Man hacks into the girls' Sony phones and gives them video calls (twice!), but mostly he just torments them with hallucinations.The hallucinations and nightmares at least have some creepy imagery like Hallie lying naked in pieces under piles of leaves, a girl in a bathtub with a caved-in face, and tentacles coming out of eyes and mouths. Not like any of that means anything. There are also some nice shots of scenery around the town and in the woods, lovely camera movements, and beautiful shots like Hallie looking out of her bedroom window, illuminated by police lights. The music video-like editing is a problem, though, and it makes the sexual angst scene between Hallie and Tom look really stupid as he writhes about with a monster face.This is a movie that really plays on those horror tropes, without understanding what makes those tropes work. Jump-scares abound, characters have angst, and the sexual undertones of films like "Halloween" (1978) and "It Follows" (2014) are badly imitated.3/10.

This film is only 93m long but it felt like forever. The film is filled with the usual horror cliches. When girls are trying to run away from the villain, they inevitably trip and fall. When they're all together as a group they obviously have to talk about the boys they like. It's frustratingly all a case of been there, seen that. The jump scares, well didn't make me jump. But there are handful of redeeming features in the film. The four actress did a fine job. I also thought that, there were moments of threat that were genuinely decent. On a couple of occasions the girls see footage on their phones of someone/something from that person's/ thing's POV. I quite liked those scenes. There is also some good imagery and sound work, these also helped in creating a mild sense of horror. All In all, Slenderman is a cliche horror movie with a seemingly good concept but it's sadly wasted.

reviews.review_title: Creepy, but dumb. The Ring without Samora.
reviews.content: I love horror movies, so I am very generous when it comes to hoaky plots. This was too much. So if you google "slender man video" anyone in the world can watch it. But we are supposed to believe that law enforcement hasn't caught wind of this? There is no background, there is no logic. What is slender man? Is he a shadow? Part tree? A tall skinny guy? Just accept that watching the video means you'll disappear or go crazy... yet again, all the teenagers in the world know about it, but no one else.I have liked Joey King in the past, but she way overacted here. The girl who played Hallie did the best, but no one could save a plot that had more holes in it than a Vegas brothel.

The idea of a Slenderman movie has been up in the air forever, now. This film overall displays a con to this idea, tremendously. There's so much that could be bashed upon through technical views, though to keep it simple, this film in general is a collection of lifeless, flat, completely overused horror cliches. The suspense factors were at an all time low, mostly, since the film made every build-up as obvious as possible, almost every single jumpscare, and abysmally slow-paced "suspenseful" execution was blatantly obvious, leaving nothing truly horrifying or new to speak of. The jumpscares, mostly, are cheap, laughable, and even head-scratching, mostly. ( The entire theater laughed at a specific jumpscare, even. ) The characters mostly find themselves in situations that lead nowhere, with some happening for the sake of fill-time, really it'd seem. They carry a small bit of life with their characters, but such can be seen mostly in the first quarter of the film, the time where things were organized. Otherwise, the film began to feel rushed, sudden, and in general a confusing, random seeming ordeal. In all honesty, aside my love of horror, seeing this film was sheer luck; I knew this film wasn't going to be great by the 3.4 or so rating at the time. To wrap things up, if you're fond or in general a fan of Slenderman, I'd recommend this for a laugh. This truly isn't the worst, but it's surely wasted potential; Slenderman as an idea seems as if it needs a lot of ideas to carry a whole film, this didn't carry a whole lot. Cliches, laughable moments, CGI Slenderman, and confusion moments that'll have you thinking. That's what you'll take away from this film. This is the second most unintendedly laughable horror flick, it almost topped "The Bye Bye Man".

Negative: I didn't like the characters and they were idiots, this movie had boron and confusing scenes.Positive: the look of slender man looks cool and this movie had creepy imagery in scenes and one scene in the library was trippy.Overall just go see it if you like Joey king and horror movies for the creepy imagery and tone.

reviews.review_title: What a huge waste of potential
reviews.content:
I'd heard about the awful reviews before watching the film. Knowing that the film was supposedly terrible, I prepared myself for 1hour and 33m of awfulness and desperately trying not to fall asleep, and man was it a good thing I prepared myself.
I would start with some aspects of the film I liked and as you would've guessed... there are none. My god was the acting awful, a well earned razzie nomination for [actress's name I forgot], congrats! But honestly the actors deserved a lot better, really isn't their fault they just had to run, get predictably jumpscared (I'll get to THAT later) and scream at some atrocious CGI for most of the film. Oh, if only there was a zero rating I could put. But its not just the poor cast, Slenderman doesn't deserve this either. one of the most famous horror tales and one that creeped out many during its popularity, especially me, being transformed into completely the opposite of what it was, and made into something so laughable it looks like it would be one of the parodies in Scary Movie. Poor old Slendy is barely in the film either, less than 5 minutes screentime in total and the occasional jumpscare appearance. Speaking of jumpscares, the ones in this film are some of the most cliché and hilarious attempts of surprising/shocking the audience I have ever witnessed. The sheer amount of predictability in them is unbelievably stupid. The simple pan to one side, nothing there, Oh no! Then pan to the other, and there's nothing there either! Big surprise right? And then just when the character thinks they're safe and there is nothing there after all, they turn around and BOO! These are done so lazily, and it pains me to see that Blumhouse still uses them in their films, Invisible Man being an exception. Now I love Psychological horrors, Midsommar, Hereditary you name it. But that doesn't mean that I still don't like jumpscares. They can be used really well, in stuff like the original Insidious, or in IT. But this film misses every shot. I don't see the need to make the film a Pg-13, since when was Slenderman for people at that age? And I know, I know, pg-13 doesn't always ruin films. But with films like this and Venom, it does feel off. I'm going on and on so i'll finish my review here.
Verdict: Lazy writing, bad acting and hilariously bad scenes drag this film down deep into 1 star territory and up to the point where it may even offend Slender fans. I give slender man a 1 star. My first on the website, and hopefully my last.

Simple Review:
Extremely boring! Nothing really happens. The "jump scares" are disappointing along with the "tense" moments. The acting, editing, etc. are all ok, it's just a really boring movie.
I told my brother to not watch this he didn't losen so we watched it and then he regret it
I should have guessed by the title, which easily could have been 'Skinny Chap,' 'Thin Bloke' or 'Lanky Lad,' that 'Slender Man' was going to be AWFUL!! Absolutely dreadful!

reviews.review_title: Not Awful, But the Same Bland Material You've Seen and Predicted Before
reviews.content: Although Sylvain White's take on the well-known internet monster is freakily-toned and has its unsettling imagery, he forces it through really predictable storytelling and poor horror jump-scares. In the end, the 2018 Slender Man movie feels like something we've already seen too many other times. The only thing that makes it just barely likeable is the fact that it's at least watchable.From the start, and heading all the way through to the climatic point and the finishing, Slender Man is a horror movie that feels more like a teen coming-of-age movie. It should've stuck to at least trying to be scary or haunting in any way, but the focus on the stereotypical teenage life is still quite appealing. The trailer certainly seems like a lie in telling us this was a horror movie, not a teen tale with a freaky mystery.The storytelling is really dragging and utterly predictable, meaning that yes, you can sense the "jump"-scares from minutes away and the actual theme itself could've successfully been more mysterious and ominous, which makes already makes it a missed opportunity. To top it up, the teenage performances are dreadful and the direction and camera-style are well-thought but fail miserably.If you liked this review, check out the full review and other reviews at aussieboyreviews.

Well I first heard of slender man the urban legend about 8 years ago and I was hooked with the diligence of research and mythos. I think this movie could and should have come out years ago. The movie was mediocre and could have been creepier. Channel Zero also from creepy pasta is an anthology series and has done a great job at creating fear. This movie dropped the ball I expected a lot sacrier.

I went into this movie with 0 expectations and somehow managed to still be disappointed. The movie was not even scary at all in the slightest and in fact I was even laughing at some of the scenes that were supposed to be scary and I could hear other audience members giggling as well. The acting was really cheesy and over the top too. There is practically no build up and no suspense, they just throw the action at you. There are so many things that they could have done to make this a decent movie, but it was an obvious cash grab that played on a popular topic among tweens and teens. My daughter liked it but she said it wasn't scary, just annoyingly loud. The only comment she had to make of the movie was that it was "interesting".
Wasn't worth 10 but doesn't deserve a 3.1, special mention for that video call scene that was something new

I had to create an account just to write a review for this piece of garbage.Seriously, how can you take a creepy character and make it look dumb and ridiculous? This movie takes the goddamn cake. I can't believe I spent over an hour of my life watching this boring piece of crap. The acting didn't bother me but the script? Are you serious? Who thought it would be a great idea to take a cool legend and straight out make it cringey?Just don't waste your time. Please.

Really don't understand some of the ridiculously low ratings for this film. 1? - come on, it's far better than that. I nearly didn't give it a go because of the low rating bit it's not too bad at all. The acting is good too???
Looks nothing like The game, everything sucks. Go commit not watching slender man
This movie is a totally waste of time and money. One of the worst horror movies i have ever seen. Don't ever consider watching it.

This movie was so bad. It wasn't scary in anyway, the acting was bad and slender man was bad CGI the whole time. So many things were left unanswered and the ending was one of the worst I have ever seen. I usually accept horror movies for what they are but this one was down right awful. Don't waste your money even if your bored out of your mind and save your time if it ever comes to Netflix because you will never get your 1hr 33 min back.

reviews.review_title: Just a dumb confusing movie without a plot
reviews.content: I'm trying my best to read why people gave it such a high rating. I can't figure out what movie they saw cause I saw none of that. These were not even close friends that they claimed to be based on the bad acting and horrible lines. There was not plot as I didn't even know what this movie was trying to articulate. Four females one that looks lifeless and disinterested, one that was a pretty ugly red head with bad acting, one that is black because you have to put at least one in there also with bad acting, and the one who had very little acting skills was taken first. My review is probably bad because the movie was so bad because it was that bad that I just can't explain it. I guess the people that liked it are idiots or just ones that like pointless dumb movies. I really don't have an explanation on why people would give this anything above a star and I'm still trying to figure out why I even watched even though it was on free. Smh I think this ring ripoff movie made me an idiot and a lot dumber cause I can't seem to summons the right words for it. All I will say is don't waste your time but if you do, don't pay for it or you will pay for it in brain cells and time.

reviews.review_title: Bad directors should be banned from filming
reviews.content:
Oh God... Such a shame. I had been waiting for this film since who knows when. With such a cast I really wanted to like it but the rest is it is just so bad... Joey King is still insanely good even with such poor directing. She must be missing James Wan's intelligence. As an actress I can easily see who is to blame when I watch a film, although I believe it is quite glaring to the eye in this movie. Directing, awful; Cinematography, poorish; cgi almost made me cry; story and script let's not be rude.
As I said, bad directors should be banned from directing (and fundraising, but who would spare a cent on this?). He must've a wealthy chap I bet.
I switched to Atypical from Netflix as fast as I could.

Such a great character to terrorise audience and yet such a terrible execution. I don't know where to start: Lame teenager characters or absolutely no focus on Slender Man. I expected Sony to follow the footsteps of Blair Witch and create a mysterious horror story with one of the scariest horror characters, Slender Man. However we don't even get a clue about what it is and story just turns into a Ring cliche: watch the video and die. I mostly watched it as a Sony advertorial as you see Sony phones more than Slender Man. I don't understand how Sony agreed to release such a bad movie.

I see the effort, I see how the actors tried to do the best they could. But honestly, it was not worth the time I spent watching this. The movie drags itself, has almost no pacing, and most importantly: Is not scary. Look, I'm scared of the dark. I'm scared of damn wasps. No matter how easily scared I am, this movie didn't even menage to scare me. There are plenty of good horror movies, don't watch the ones based on internet creepypasta unless you hear that it has stellar reviews.

reviews.review_title: A complete joke of a movie
reviews.content: I'm not going to say much on this one. One thing I will say is that my friends and I either laughed at the scares or we just sat there in shock that it was a scare. I went home and laughed to myself because I still couldn't believe I saw the movie. If you find this movie to be scary, you need to raise your standards of a horror movie because this thing shouldn't even count. I generally don't give a movie a 1/10, but there was nothing good about this movie. I'd suggest watching videos on it instead, it's probably funnier.

reviews.review_title: Not a fake reviewer.....just someone who got creeped out by this movie.
reviews.content: I really enjoyed this movie. I saw it a while back and just saw it airing right now March 17th 2020. Love me some Joey king. I don't understand the hate for this movie at all. I found it super creepy. Scene wise and atmosphere of the movie. People just have to many expectations it seems today.
The film is very exciting but the stroyline and the efects are unrealistic. Written by Julia and Dylan from the Alfrink College

reviews.review_title: AWESOME watch while high horror movie
reviews.content: Had absolutely nothing to watch on TV and Slender Man had just started and I watched it with my girl, knowing about the movie score e having declined watching it at the movies. ( I was high throughout the movie). If you followed the Slender Man, one of the most famous creepypastas out there, and heard about the story through those dark websites you're going to love this. The movie has the actual drawings I saw on some websites and creeped me out when I was younger, also some scenes are straight from the game Slender Man : The 8 Pages. The movie really highlights the creepypasta theme, and how it is viral and from the dark parts of the internet. I really liked that. The movie seems to introduce a form of being haunted really similar do The Ring, I don't recall having that on the original story, but I actually liked their approach. The movie really depicts what fear feels like. I felt serious chills down my spine. The movie soundtrack and effects are SPOT on and very immersive, those 3 bells really set the scene to Panic Mode. Also, the hallucination scenes were awesome. I loved this movie to all its extents, my girl thought didn't like it all, I think most people would have the same reaction to it as she did. But if you're like me, you might have a really great time watching this.

reviews.review_title: I feel bad for the actors
reviews.content:
I'm not a creepy pasta fan but I know slenderman pretty well (I think everyone does) and to be honest I was kinda excited for this movie looking at the trailer, It felt like I was gonna watch a guy wrenching horror based on the famous creepypasta but no, JUST NO.
Where do I even begin, this film has a terrible start, it only took 5 minutes for the film to introduce us to the slenderman curse video which all the girls watched, I found it incredibly stupid we've hardly got to.know these characters but they expect us to sympathize with them.cus they have been "cursed" NO I QUITE FRANKLY DONT GIVA A SH.
If I went into everything I hate about this movie then it would take hours to read so yeah.
1 more thing WHY THE HELL DOES THIS FILM HAVE SO MANY PLOT HOLES, MY 2 YEAR OLD COUSIN COULD DO A BETTER JOB OF MAKING A MOVIE. Anyway peace out.
Stop making these movies. I better go bent my deck than look at this again. It smells like basement.

Quite possibly the most boring film I've ever watched. The story of slenderman had such potential this just didn't even touch it very boring I don't remember anything that happened someone went missing that's it
Bruh. Dumb. Boring. Not scary. It's always dark. Slow. Awful. Just bruh.

If someone wants to give me that amount of money I'll make you 20 movies and they'll all suck. Or maybe they won't. It's hard to say. What isn't hard to say is that this movie does suck big time. Nothing about it is entertaining at all. The acting is terrible for the most part and the script is almost laughable.I know from what I've read that the production company was nervous about releasing the movie due to a real world event. It seems they butchered it to be less offensive to the people involved in that event. In doing so they made a dull movie.Watch "The Losers" if you need something from this director that you can enjoy.

This movie had potential to be a good movie, but it just wasn't executed correctly. The way they went about good ol' Slendy's attacks seemed strange and unrealistic to his lore. Even my boyfriend, who I know as the biggest scaredy-cat alive wasn't fazed by this film. The attempts to build suspension and uncomfort was spoiled by generic jump scares. This movie could've been better, but it's probably better to leave the Creepypastas on the internet.

Worst film I've ever seen. Not one part of it made me feel scared, the jump scares were awful. It's a complete mess it made no sense what so ever, and in places was so dark I couldn't even see what was going on! I have never written a review before but it was so awful I felt like I needed to share my opinion. Was completely bored to death would not recommend.
Utter piece of crap! 4 bimbos summoning some slender crap and then guess what everything goes to crap then more crap. 30 mins in I feel crappy, bored and more crappy.

reviews.review_title: Slender Man is like a vasectomy
reviews.content: You come in nervous but it's actually not scary at all and you leave missing a part of yourself.

Slender Man Review:Slender Man tells the story of three high school girls who summon Slender Man through "a website video" (because they can't say YouTube or anything), a monster that looks like a pale, tall man with freakishly long arms and no face, after watching porn at a sleepover and there's a lot of screaming and jump scares. Wow this was a terrible movie. I never expected much in the first place. When they first announced that the movie would be made I thought maybe they could make a decent horror movie out of it. Then the first trailer arrived. It was a bunch of random creepy images and didn't even involve Slender Man at all. That's when I knew it would receive horrible reviews. It currently has an 11% on Rotten Tomatoes, 29 on Metascore, and 3/10 on IMDb. The plot was horrible. Very predictable, a bunch of jump scares, stupid decisions, and many laughable moments. The cast was horrible except for Annalise Basso, who is actually a good actress. But the order of disappearances for the girls goes from best actress to worst actress. Because of that the whole ending was so painful to watch. It was pretty funny to watch. The last 5ish minutes was hilarious. Because I don't care I'm going to spoil it. The girl we're left with is freaking out because of everything that's been happening so she goes to the woods to give her life to Slender Man so it can all end. When Slender Man goes in to full monster mode to take her she runs away screaming. Like a few seconds ago she wanted to give her life. Another hilarious moment with that girl is there's a part where she goes over to this one guy's house and they're about to have sex. She looks at his face and it's violently shaking with a smile and the room is spinning and she's screaming. It was one of the funniest scenes in a movie I've seen all year. The last dumb scene I'll talk about came earlier in the movie. Annalise (the good actress) went missing and the three girls go into the woods at night to get rid of something they love as a sacrifice to Slender Man so they can get her back. The girls are supposed to be blindfolded and not to look because if they see his face they'll be messed up forever. Of course one of the girls gets scared so she takes off her blindfolds and sees him, which had horrible effects and looked dumb. Then it's just a bunch of screaming and tripping through the woods followed by fake jump scares. There is not much good I can say about the movie. The only things are that Annalise was a good actress for the 15 minutes she was in the movie and there was maybe two instances where it was sort of creepy. Honestly it could've been a good movie if they did a plot similar to the video game, like a found footage thing with the plot of the game. Instead we got some funny jumbled movie with bad acting from Julia Goldani Telles and Joey King (who has been in horrible horror movies recently). This movie is going to win some Razzie Awards for sure. Don't see it. Don't waste your money. If you want to watch laughable horror film then this is the movie for you.My Grade: D

This movie seems to have a lot of really bad reviews. I don't quite understand why. This movie is not actually that bad. The acting didn't bother me. What bothered me was the sound. The effects were just too freaking loud - but hey that's jumpscare movie for you, if you're ears aren't bleeding you're not scared. And scared I was not, this was not a good horror movie like that - there was nothing really scary here, just a lot of jumpscares and visual effects.The story..well I can't really say there was much of a story. To be honest I was playing bass for most of the movie and didn't really pay attention - maybe that's why I didn't hate it so much.

Let me start by saying that I've seen plenty of worse movies that rated higher. That being said, I enjoyed this movie. I felt the story was good, although I wished they'd done it differently. The acting wasn't bad. Most of the dialogue was ok, only a little of it felt contrived or stereotypical. Overall, I feel it deserves a higher rating than 3.1.

If people want to review a movie, they should review the actual movie. Seriously. If you had certain expectations or thought that the movie was being portrayed differently than how you thought that it turned out, it does NOT make it a one star movie. I'm really beginning to distrust Imdb because of this. Three stars?? This movie got railed here.If you would like a review here you go. The cinematography was nicely done, with some nice effects. The story was solid but a little cliche. The writing and dialogue was lazy at best, and the acting was decent. The film used every modern horror movie trope but tried a few new things. Far from perfect but really not that bad."This movie said it was the scariest movie ever and it's not, so I'm giving it a one" is NOT a movie review. You do realize that it's someone's job to hype a movie right? Just because someone did their job well and you fell for it doesn't mean that the movie is trash. You only have yourself to blame and that's why you're upset. Maybe don't believe the hype and just watch the movie or don't.

I don't know if all these people that are rating this movie high stars are being paid or just part of the cast and crew. This movie fell into so many bad horror tropes it was embarrassing. Did anyone ever consider turning on a light?? This is why Scary Movie1-X exists. Because people direct ridiculous "horror" movies that are simply laughable and completely unbelievable. Nothing about the characters made any sense. Their actions weren't even remotely driven by the plot.

reviews.review_title: The Worst Movie I've Seen this Century!
reviews.content: Very hard watch, I would even say terrible! It just missed me entirely!!!
I go to the theater. I wait 20 mintues and there still isn't any sign of Slendertman. All I'm seeing are some kids!! What Slandermon flick is this I need more slenderman.

Let me start this by sayin I get scared very easily. Thusly I went into this movie expecting to feel scared at least once. Well, I didn't. The plot was very very predictable and the whole film was boring.

I saw it all.. so I guess is something good about it. But in general.. bad, poor, boring at times.. not happy. Message at the end is good, lets keep away from spreading nonsense on Social Media. !!!!!

Slender Man is enjoyable what it was going for this movie is about these teenagers watch a video on the internet and they get infected my slender man by the video which Is goofy so each of their friends starts to disappear in this movie which can make since but the thing I don't like you don't really care for the characters which suck I am a big fan of the slender man of my fav horror characters to see this movie fail sucks I really hoped for a slender man movie that is great sadly did not happen what is dum about this movie there is a cliff hanger why the hell you will make a movie of slender man make a cliff hanger just why I feel like this was box office movie to just making money not to make an interesting movie So disappointing but I do enjoy what they tried to do sadly was not good So I give Slender Man An D+

reviews.review_title: What is up with the lighting
reviews.content:
There is nothing more disappointing than a promising trailer that shows the best scenes but is actually advertising a huge disappointment in the shape of a film.You'd think by now film makers would know not to use clichés, because they make the film too predictable, especially when it came to jump scares, making this film such a bore. I couldn't wait for it to be over.I could excuse the bad acting, cause yes, the actresses probably did the best they could with a bad script. The script did not bother to make the group of girls original or likeable, the one thing accurately shown about them is what teens do when they get together.
However the lighting was unforgivable. I don't know where their budget went but they should have invested in a few more lights, as it was really hard to make things out (even though I was watching with the brightness to the max) and the shades being sliced in clear lines did not make it in the least a professional looking production.I know they probably really tried to have the climax of the film be all creepy, but again, clichés. There was a clear lack of originality but one aspect of the film that was actually a little redeemable was their one use of trees at the end of the film; that was interesting, but I wouldn't say it's worth watching the film for that.

This movie just checks the boxes of your average horror movie and somehow manages to even ruin that.As I said the movie pretty much just goes scene by scene quickly checking each box a basic horror movie would need. Bunch of teenagers find spooky video one of them goes missing ahhhhh fight breaks loose amongst the group, random cheap jump scares with an obnoxious noise. But this set up is at least tolerable if you really like horror but they manage to just make every single basic element just down-right awfulThe movie is not scary, at all. There are cheap jumpscares everywhere with the most obnoxious and stupid sounds I think I've ever heard. Honestly by the 10th fake-out jumpscare I just laughed. The movie is also for some reason just incredibly dark and I couldn't see anything and Slender man looks just as bad as the terrible photoshops you would find online. For some reason the characters just hallucinate stupid ass distorted demon faces on people and the cgi is atrocious. All of these factors just don't build up any tension at any point in the movie and as a result who cares what happensI need to talk about the characters and acting because it is just something else. I do not believe for a second any of the actors cared enough about this terrible movie to bother trying because they are all so boring. Every scene where anything is happening they don't seem to care at all. Joey King's character just goes on speeches asking her own friends for help and they literally just don't respond or only say one word answers it's absolutely mind boggling. It is hilarious when the characters just say random plot points and it feels so unnatural. They are all 0 dimensional characters with not a single interesting quality.One of the reasons the movie is so boring is it completely lacks personality. The movie is so dreary but it doesn't make up for it with a compelling story or compelling characters with realistic and/or interesting emotions, behavior, and arcs. Sad and dreary does not mean your movie has to also have nothing interesting within it.If I'm being honest I don't know how I would bring slender man into a movie as I don't know much about him but the way they do it in this movie I don't really like at all. In the movie he feels less like an impending threat of him always watching and instead just feels like some stupid cgi monster with tentacles. I think one huge pitfall of this movie is slender man himself isn't scary anymore and the movie was made way too late.Now for the positives!!!!I liked 2 songs in the soundtrack(most of the songs in the soundtrack was basic horror movie soundtrackI like some of the more unique shots and camera movements (there were some though that were extremely jarring and dumb, additionally combined with some insanely weird editing choices that skip over entire parts of a scene, ex. One of the characters is crawling and then the next cut she's sitting down)Overall this is the absolute worst of horror movies and it's definitely disappointing considering the iconic character and the great uniqueness in horror genre over the past 5 years. Nothing is unique about this movie and even the basic stuff is made really bad.

How can I put this ? If you are looking for a thrilling , scary , unpredictable horror, then this movie is NOT for you .If, on the other hand , you want a boring , uninteresting , not in the least bit scary movie , then , by all means watch this one.Also , the character Hallie , played by Julia Goldani Telles was very unlikeable , bland and lacking personality , not a great actress .I do not recommend this movie .

Well first of all I think the movie was bad. It started very nice with the slenderman video on the web etc. But after the half the movie started to lose from everywhere even the cast for some reason started to play bad ... And also this movie never ended for me.. I mean ok in the end All the girls died but so fast and the last 2 deaths were bad and predictable 
I don't think there will be a sequel but I hope for one more to fix the mess the movie left
I give this movie a 5 cause I think 3 it's too harsh.. It had some nice moments and I enjoyed it for some time but that's was all

reviews.review_title: I didn't dislike it as much as some....
reviews.content: Don't get me wrong, it's not great, but I was more frustrated than anything. It was apparently hacked about at the last minute on the orders of execs who were concerned by some of the gore as well as the plot coming a little too close to the famous Slender Man 'inspired' murder attempt by two young US girls in 2014 (you'd think the studio might have spotted that earlier!). Consequently there's quite a bit in the trailer that didn't make it into the movie, resulting in some confusingly nonsensical scenes and characters. But the cinematography is pretty atmospheric, the acting's okay (I think it seems worse than it is sometimes because of the last minute hatchet-job), and although it's low-budget I think it had the potential to be a decent little scare-flick. There are actually some online hoping for a director's cut! Btw, Slender Man himself is played by Javier Botet, who played the title character ghost in Mama.
Hey dudes. I was shocked about the rating here. But I liked the movie very well. Actual a 3.0 is defenetly to low. It's a stable horror/psycho with a very strange second half. ;)
Don't waste your time. I thought by the trailer it was good, but not, terrible acting and just boring. I stopped watching in the first half an hour and didn't even bother finishing.

Lol! It tried its very best up until about...10 minutes left. It had some interesting audio cues and couple really unique visuals. It wasn't OUTSTANDING. But it kept me mildly interested. Up until the end when Slendy turned into an tree octopus. And then I realized exactly why we need someone else to try their hand at slenderman. If you like Lifetime thrillers, I mean. Might as well? It'll give you something to laugh at. But if you're looking for something to actually scare you, keep looking.
Movie makes no sense, wasted my precious Time.Only good thing about the movie is not to do stupid summoning thing. Ending was super dead. Would have been great if I watched News instead.

reviews.review_title: If you go down to the woods today ...
reviews.content: Ok I expected to not enjoy this , I didn't read the reviews but I see the score and expected it to be a 3/10 movie but for the most part it was hovering at 7/10 but it was let down by the most important part of the film - the slender man simply wasn't even partially scary he was more comical than anything ! However there were so many good points about this film that the fact it didn't live up to the title didn't matter so much . Go with low expectations and you'll enjoy this . Fortunately I had no idea of the back story or game so no preconceptions were going to ruin it for me . What stood out for me was SOUND - absolutely top notch and oscar winning potential - an absolutely essential ingredient for horror , PHOTOGRAPHY was exceptionally good throughout with many hirchockian tricks . ACTING all of the main protagonists acted extremely well in particular the character WREN . LIGHTING another essential element of horror - and finally DIRECTION - as a technical movie this was superb , it was only let down by the the key elements of script , story and sheer scare factor of the main character the monster ! Perhaps it was a metaphor for adolescence and the horror came from the cerebral conflict in the pursuit of female adulthood ? It was clearly influenced by the Ring but by trying to be real and believable rather than horror myth it kind of failed in its true potential - but it was TWICE as good as I expected it to be and I'm glad I saw it - I wasn't disappointed and neither will you be if you have low expectations. Pad.A 5.5/10 rounded to 6/10 for SOUND

Let's start off by saying that the 3.2 score (which makes it one of the bottom 100 rated movies of IMDB) is by no means justified, it just isn't, at all. Having said that, it's not a perfect movie either.I don't know the Slender Man story other than it's a figure appearing in pics and videos. Can't say I know much more after this movie, which is one of the few downsides of this movie. There isn't much of a mystery, if there ever was any. There were interesting ideas, some of which came in the epilogue (and feels a bit like they needed to add some beef into the story afterwards), but in general this is more of an atmosphere flick.And the atmosphere is where this movie really shines in my opinion. It's well shot and the atmosphere is super creepy throughout. Music is good and there are some pretty interesting visual trickery that actually works. The slender man itself is not necessarily as scary as it might've been and would've probably benefited of "keeping it more in the shadows" so to say.The acting is ok, but the biggest gripe is that the story is really thin. It's kind of like a watered down version of The Ring, could've easily passed as a Ring sequel. Again, I don't know the relevance of watching the video in web stories this is based on, but here it's pretty much how it worked in Ring, you watch a video - weird things start to happen.So.. super good and strong atmosphere is enough to make it a winner in my books, but the story could've been better. Not necessarily everything makes sense here and I'm not sure if it needs to always either. There is practically no gore in this movie (another plus in my books).For what it's worth I thought The Nun was much worse and boring than this, watched both during the weekend. Maybe this is a bit of a slow burner, but I like my horror that way.

reviews.review_title: I wanted slender man to come get me so I wouldn't have to finish this movie.
reviews.content: Most boring and predictable horror movie that still makes no sense at the end. Every single department that worked on this movie has failed gloriously. The script sucked, there was literally zero lighting during the entire movie, the actors were average at best and the cgi looks like it was made by a student using technology for the first time. The camera man/woman tried to do some inventive, new and cool shots that backfired completely and ended up just looking weird and actually contributing nothing to the film. If you want to spend 1 1/2 hours looking at a black screen, unsurprising jump scares and nothing else, then maybe this movie is for you.

Just as a quick review, Slender Man dose not really deserve all the extreme hate it is getting. Sure, there are some bad dialogue here and there but it's still ok, the film dose have some ultra cringy moments that make it hard to watch but thats passable. Slender, himself is also pretty good, we never actually really see him up close and if we do, its either blurred or far enough away. The acting is passable, there are a few pretty creepy scenes aswell, one actually had me shaking! Overall, go see it if youre bored, just don't expect s masterpiece!

reviews.review_title: Remember the directors name. Boycott her
reviews.content: To make a movie after a girl was nearly murdered, purely for money, is disgusting. Forget that the movie is just plain bad, but the writers and director's names should be forever remembered for having no class and having even less talent.

This was not an awful film but just seemed to plod on with out any momentum, all a bit boring, maybe it is my age when you know these things do not exist and there is no such thing as ghosts but I can suspend my disbelief and enjoy a good horror but this is not one. Was a bit relieved when they all met their end.
Don't waste your money this movie was so bad A water down horror movie with no real story no good character is no good death scenes

reviews.review_title: This not a movie, it's a disgrace
reviews.content:
Slender Man is not a movie, it's a highschool project gone wrong. Very wrong...Think about this. Somewhere in the final production process of this movie, there was a moment where people (director, producers, actors) decided: yes, this is it! This is ok! This is something we can show people. They actually looked at the final cut and were satisfied.
I don't know whether this is a Hollywood thing, an American thing, a 21st century thing...but how on earth can we justify this as an 'ok movie'? This movie is so cring-worthy, so bad, so so bad...avoid this as the plague!Acting: bad
Scenes: dark, so so dark
Screaming and crying: a lot
Scary: not in the slightest
Story: oh my god...
Is a rondom youtube clip better? yes!

Very disappointed with the film, it's the abrupt ending in particular. I'd rather stick with the marble hornets series and videos on Youtube. The trailer was really like something else. Definitely not the film we're getting. But on top of that, the final cut of the film gave me a very horrendous viewing experience.

reviews.review_title: not so special, not so bad
reviews.content: I watched this movie with a couple of teenagers and that made it more fun. i'm at least twice as old and the movie was very predictable for me but they where frightened and scared for real a lot of times so i had a couple of laughs about that. the movie is nothing new or original, the acting is pretty descent, of course no reasonable discision making with people running around in any direction. but if your in the right setting it'll give you a good enjoyable evening anyway. i would have given it a 5,5 because there are a lot worse out there.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie of this year
reviews.content: In absolute the worst movie of 2018, and also one of the worst movies of the last 20 years, the plot is awful, characters absent and a narrative for kindergartens.I had some hope from the trailer, especially the second, but a disgust come out!Making a film about Slenderman was too late now, the legend of the creepypasta character stopped working five or six years ago.Not recommend, i hope they do not do a sequel.Seriously bad movie!
Don't waste your time.more of a comedy then horror film.

reviews.review_title: Too bad to even get a laugh out of
reviews.content: I'd read the reviews prior to viewing but I regularly find myself enjoying horror films many don't appreciate... in this case though I should've listened. I left wanting a refund for a film I got a free ticket toTo describe it in short, it was like watching a film made by middle school students who just learnt how to use Adobe After Effects and gotten over excited about it. The acting was so cringe it became harder and harder to watch as the film went on however I've seen these actors in other work and I'm going to have to blame it on direction and writing here. The Slender Man concept, although slightly outdated had so much potential but unfortunately was made into one big snooze fest. The major fault here was showing Slender Man, thus eliminating all suspense and having to rely on underwhelming jump scares and making the audience wait for some sort of twist that never comes. If this film was created the exact same but produced 10 years ago for a teen audience I think it would haver received a much better reception.If you're as excited or intrigued as I was about this film, watch it by all means but go into it with extremely low expectations so it is at least borderline bearable

Firstly, this was made in poor taste. It would be like making a movie based around the guy who murdered his family and stuck them in a silo, and somehow glorifying him.Secondly, the movie itself is boring. It cuts important scenes and yet drags on empty dialogued scenes with little tweenies who have no personality. It's like they tried to replicate ouija but cut out all the scenes we need to see. Don't talk about what happened, SHOW US. It doesn't make it suspenseful, it makes us confused.And half the movie was too dark to see!! And some of the "scary" scenes just made me laugh because they looked hysterical or the acting was bad.Just no
Maybe the late release was to blame for this bomb. If it was the early 2010s with Slender Man stories on early Youtube Slender Man would had been a big sleeper hit.

Don't waste your time and money on this garbage. 
No storyline and very boring !

Cute girls, horrible acting , and nothing scary. Some scenes were ok but otherwise then that, nothing to offer. The slenderman was not scary, his story wasnt scary. Only thing that was horrifying is that a film studio gave the writers and directors to make this ass of a movie.

reviews.review_title: Slender Man (2018) - So Bad It's Bad
reviews.content: Before watching this film I'd heard a lot of bad things about it, and I can tell you that they're all true. As a horror movie, this is truly just awful. As a comedy though, there is some value and fun to be had.The film follows a group of teens, Wren, Hallie, Katie and Chloe, who are such well developed characters that they don't even have last names. They are supposed to be teenagers, and they do look roughly the right age, but dear god the dialogue is just unbelievable. I'm convinced that it must have been written by a bunch of studio bosses that haven't interacted with the 'youth' in decades. It was only a year since I was a teen myself, and I can say that none of us ever speak like the caricatures in this movie. The very first thing they discuss is a YouTube cat video, commenting that it would be cuter if it exploded? Then one of them meows. Literally. The scene is so cringeworthy that it's been cut out of the extended previews online. The acting is atrocious but I hesitate to completely blame the actresses since the script is dire. They are all equally awful though, and the side characters are no better.So after the frankly bizarre cat video scene, the film properly opens with an equally inane conversation in a school hallway. Stilted dialogue highlights include, "Super funny, like whoa" (complete with gratuitous vocal fry of course) and "The dudebros in their natural habitat, let's observe shall we?". The girls awkwardly 'flirt' (I think) with some guys, only one of which will ever be seen again for an absolutely brilliant CGI moment which I'll get to later. The girls are going to hang out for the night, and just before that, Hallie's little sister sees Wren coming to the door. This is to set up a friendship there since Wren is going to introduce the sister to Slender Man later on, but they only interact once, and the tone of the scene seems more like the sister is in love with Wren, so it really doesn't pay off. So the four friends laugh and giggle, they watch a porn film (which we don't see or hear, thank god), they have a little chat, then out of absolutely nowhere, they search up Slender Man and watch a video to summon him. This is not the only Googling scene in the film, and it's reminiscent of Twilight, but worse. Chloe narrates a Google page about it for some super subtle exposition, literally telling us exactly what is going to happen next in the story. This is 5 minutes into the film, and we've just been told the entire plot. Wow.The 'summoning' video is an issue all on its own. So they play it, and we see some unusual, unsettling imagery that seems unrelated cut together. There's a blue tone over the shots. Some of it is related to a death later in the film. A creepy high pitched music plays over the scene. And best of all once they watch it, they're doomed by Slender Man. Yep, they tried to rip off The Ring. It's just not even close though. The tape scene in that film makes me feel properly uncomfortable like I've just watched something genuinely dangerous. The video scene in this film just makes me groan with cringe, and anger at the blatant copying. Not cool.So the film trundles on, Katie vanishes out of the film which is the catalyst for the rest of the 'story'. However, it has no impact on us since she has absolutely no development. All she has done in the film is chat about cat videos and watch a porno, so it's pretty hard to connect to or care about the character. After Katie disappears, her father breaks into Hallie's house, convinced that the friends are hiding her somewhere. He violently confronts her, and it feels as though he's being set up as a proper threat in the plot, since they have a scene showing his alcoholism too. But no. The next night, the girls break into his house instead to snoop in Katie's room for clues. One of them stays at the front door to distract him and they have a little 'emotional' chat. So is he an abusive bad father? Or is he a pitiful man who just lost his child? We don't find out, and he is never seen or mentioned again. Great.The 3 remaining girls enter the woods to confront Slender Man, and it doesn't work. But then it does, and Chloe breaks the magic circle and looks at Slender Man, which curses her? Or something? It's so darkly lit that it's nearly impossible to see what's happening. Which is a shame, since the only positive thing I can say about the film is that there is some nice cinematography, but sometimes that gets screwed up too. This leads to the point which I find the least funny, and the most frustrating out of all the problems. Chloe (for no discernible reason) opts to lie to her friends about her meeting Slender Man. Wren can tell something is wrong and keeps asking her about it, causing conflict between the friends as Chloe and Hallie think Wren is going mad. That's right, they shoehorn in a forced conflict just to create character drama in the most cliched way I can possibly imagine. Immediately after that happens you just wait for the girls to realise, 'Oh no! Wren was right all along, we should have listened to her!' There are multiple obvious cliches (to the point where you can predict all incoming story beats) but I think that one is the most irritating because the film can't even be bothered to provide us a good excuse for Chloe to lie about the whole situation.So after the pointless friend conflict, Chloe goes mad and strangles herself, it's not seen if she dies, but similarly to Katie and her father, she just vanishes out of the movie and is never mentioned again. I didn't even realise it till after the ending, I actually thought I must have missed a scene, but no. It's just that bad. Now we're down to 2 friends, and one of them, Wren goes to the library in a scene which I was almost ready to praise, for actually feeling similar to the game. She runs around the library corners in terror, and each time she turns, Slender Man is there. There's a shot of her face made blank like his too, which actually looked not bad. I thought, ok, that's fine, just keep it up, but not even 10 seconds later they ruin it. There's a very odd scene where the library corridor stretches till it just looks silly, and the effects are really not good. I am by no means an expert in the lore of the character, but I wasn't aware that he could warp space and time. To top it all off, they decide to attempt a jumpscare, which consists of putting a loud boom noise over a woman slowly walking through the library. In what universe is that a good scare?!So we inch closer to the end of the film. Hallie goes to see one of the boys from the opening scene to hang out, but she's starting to go a bit mad too. This leads to by far the funniest scene of the film. So they lie on the couch together, they kiss, then something happens... I don't know how they shot this but oh my god. His face is still while the background zooms in and out. Loud noises are screeching in the background, then his face glitches out, then it cuts again and his face twists into what I think was supposed to be like the expressions in The Ring, but again it just doesn't compare to what it's ripping off. It's hard to describe quite how ridiculous it looks but I was laughing almost hysterically when it happened. In fact I laughed out loud pretty often during the film which I know was not the intended reaction.We're almost at the ending now, but just before we get there, something odd happens. There is a short scene in a school classroom. Nothing happens, but there is an animal eye shown on the desk. Hmm, strange. This is because there was supposed to be an eye getting stabbed in this scene, which got cut out to try for the PG-13 rating. Instead we are left with 30 seconds of characters giving each other dramatic looks, and then a random eyeball, which should really have been left on the cutting room floor. I noticed another instance of this a few minutes later when Wren is about to jump out of a window to commit suicide. Hallie just stands and watches, but then all of a sudden pulls her away. Again, the scene got cut for the PG-13 rating, and it's stilted, disjointed, and obvious. No context is given for either of these scenes which really messes with the flow of the film and leaves the viewer baffled. Wren and Hallie have an angsty chat for a minute, then Wren is unceremoniously wrenched out of the window by Slender Man, and we don't actually get to see what happens to her. This is the 4th character that this happens to. There is no atmosphere and no tension, I actually didn't know that this was supposed to be the climax yet. All of a sudden Hallie goes to the woods, then she is made into a tree. Yep. That's the ending to the film. She just walks into the woods. Goes near a tree. Then the roots grow into her and she is now inside a tree. My husband and I just sat back, floored at what we had just watched. The cherry on top though, is an ending narration from Hallie's sister which is thematically irrelevant to the plot, over a shot of unrelated students walking down the school hall. (A setting which has only been used twice).Wow. I can't understand how a film could go so badly wrong. The pacing is jarring, probably due to the very short 1hr 30m running time which is just not enough to set up either the story, or any of the characters properly. Everything moves at a breakneck speed and scenes end without any warning which left me confused about what was important to the story and what was unimportant. Another huge problem is that it isn't scary in the slightest. There were so many cheap and pointless jumpscares that weren't clever or done well, By far the worst one though was a girl walking down the stairs and looking out the window. Nothing changes or moves in the scene but we hear a loud sound. Even though the sound was.Overall, I could go on for hours about how terrible this film was, but honestly I did enjoy how bad it was, so I give it one point back. I'd give it a 2/10.
This movie is so bad, don't waist any second of your time.

I personally love this movie, really fun to watch. As a true horror movie though it definitely has flaws. The story and idea behind it is really good and I think they could've really taken it somewhere. However, there are scenes that I found straight up cheesy and silly, and the suspense was mostly boring. Don't get me wrong though I love this movie to watch for fun; I think Slenderman is really cool and they did a fair bit of showing him which I love. This movie just tried and failed at what it set out to be, but on the flip side it accomplishes being a cool tense thriller that's a tad scary at times. I highly recommend this movie; just don't go into it, expecting to scared out of your skin.

The problem with this confusing, convoluted mess of a movie is that big chunks of it were shot in the woods in the dark, and I couldn't see anything. Also it's well known that the film was pared down to get a PG 13 rating, but I think it was edited in a blender. The film is completely disjointed, although there are a couple of creepy moments and some jump scares. The acting is, for the most part, weak and the direction is at best, pedestrian. The music is eerily effective at times. Definitely a movie for millennials who spend to much time on social media.
I bet Stephen Merchant was gutted that he had to wear a potato sack over his head for the entire film.

Slender Man back in 2018 when i first saw the trailer for it i was so excited but after seeing all this bad reviews about it i was unsure whether to watch it or not and kept my expectations as low as possible but i needed to see it bymyself, i think technically the movie is so good the story of slender is worth to be told through our screens, unfortunately there are some scenes in the trailer that you won't see them again because It is claimed the scenes were cut to bring the film down to its (PG-13) rating and to avoid potential backlash, i wish they didn't remove it because it just completes the movie for the characters, so is Slender Man that scary? Yes it is the movie is mainly dark and you will have some jumpscare moments really they did it good with it when ever it was there my body right away signaled my heart increasing the rates, characters did their job too, anyways theirs no need to under rate the movie i think it's under rated, highly recommended for Slender Man fans when ever you heard about it before, 6/10⭐
