I really miss the horror genre. Of what was, of the tantalising edge of wanting to be and being seduced by works of genuine and credible horror. It's debatable as to whether it's all just been done before and we are all conditioned now to the horrors and mundanity of everyday life as it is. I however, don't want to believe you just mature and grow out of horror films and stop being scared by them, I'd rather believe that a simple lack of talent and savvy behind most of the juvenile and it would appear, gay male directors in the field is attributed. The DVD special features to this film prove of more entertainment value that the actual film itself. The cool and attractive young cast talk about their intricate roles in this masterpiece of a film they're making, that they (posthumously?) believe is going to scare the **** out of everybody. Fat chance. Interestingly there is a couple of key scenes included that are shown being filmed in a natural light and you can see the 'potential' in it immediately. It's of course, too bad as usual that the filmmakers don't trust their instincts and basically cloak the whole movie in darkness, where blackness and canned sounds stand in for anything image wise. It gets pretty boring. The girls immediately summon the urban legend and make asses of themselves and are systematically removed from the picture. How or why we're not too sure of, nobody else exists or is in the picture, it's just a bunch of cutesy fools all flailing around in the typical supernatural vacuum. Minus scares.
Just a bunch of silly teenage girls running around in a really foggy and dark forest.A few jump scares, a very dumb story and bad acting.Slender Man turns out to be just a really hungry tree.

reviews.review_title: Horrible but not in a good way
reviews.content: Silly and not scary at all. I am always amazed that people with zero imagination are allowed to make movies. And way too much texting and chatting on the phones. It brought the already slow flow to a halt each time.

reviews.review_title: Maybe the worst movie I've ever paid to see
reviews.content: My daughter was all excited to see this movie. She's been talking about Slenderman for YEARS. Less than halfway through the movie, I turned to my child and said, "This movie sucks," and for the first time in her fifteen years, my child agreed with me.There was nothing likable about most of the characters. Jaz Sinclair was the only one who could act, and who had a relatable character. The rest of them were vapid and annoying.The movie was not scary. It wasn't even creepy. The effects were cheesy. I left that theater feeling cheated of money and time.
This is perhaps one of the best movies I have EVER seen!!!!!1! I was scared throughout the whole movie

reviews.review_title: Congrats, you're the worst movie of the year, Slender Man!
reviews.content:
I know it's late to make a Halloween Specials, but here we are!Okay, Slender Man was one of the most anticipated movie of 2018.. I enjoyed playing the game and listening to these urban legends about him, but this movie was.. EH!!!!
Just to know, this review is gonna be a funny review actually.Slender Man is directed by Sylvain White, written by David Birke and starring Joey King, Julia Goldani Telles and Jaz Sinclair.The story is about a group of girls summoning Slender Man and when he got summoned, one of them gets missing, and the others trying to run away from him.. this is the whole story!Now, that's what I call a horror-pranks film, it's full of unscary scenes, with Slender Man pranking these girls.. or poor girls.. how did you talk all these pranks from a man without a face?First of all, let's count the dumb choices in this movie...
1. They summoned Slender Man from a website, by a link says "SUMMON HIM". I mean what kind of creatures can be summoned from a website?
2. To "summon him", you must watch a video and follow the instructions in the video, and when you're done, congratulation, Slender Man is summoned, go and have fun with him!
3. Slender Man is a good pranker! He made me laugh a lot with his pranks... What's dumber than making a pranker creature in a horror movie?4. Oh, yeah, the cast was dumber than Slender Man.5. Slender Man, please, grow up.. stop playing with the trees, it's noisy!!6. The CGI of Slender Man was like a man with some toilet paper rolled around his face.7. This message is for the developers of this "game", please, fix the glitch of the faces, and the horror-dreaming stuff.8. One more thing, please, fix the performances too, cause they are bad!9. The finale.. LOL!10. And now, the dumbest thing in the movie award goes to... The script! Congrats to the script, it was super-dumb!WOW, this movie is terribly bad! As I said, it was one of the most anticipated movies of the whole year, but it disappointed me very very much! It easily became one of the worst movies of 2018 -if it's not the worst already-!One more thing, why Katie's father thinks that "people can not just disappear"? Wake up, MR. There's something called kidnapping, didn't you hear about it?I think you already know what I'm gonna give this terrible movie, don't you? Yup, it's definitely an F!!Okay, guys, thank you as always for reading my review, let me know if you like my reviews or not, and I welcome all the comments.

Tragically shot film, very subpar acting and a plot with no direction. The main driving point of the slender man intending to be mysterious and creepy is ruined due to him not being mysterious and creepy. Some scenes the music helped build on the atmosphere, however as a whole the film is years to late and utterly underwhelming. No interesting characters, all lacked substance. Main character turns into a tree, the end.

First of all, how did this garbage get green-lighted? I've made better low budget horror films with friends. I knew in the first ten minutes that the movie was garbage. The Slenderman wasn't scary at all and was shown way too much. Bad writing is always covered up by cheap "jump" scares. Good horror movies have a great build up and suspense and the really good ones make you not want to look at the screen anymore. When I first saw the commercial I laughed because by now we've all seen so many of these that we know what is good and what's bad.

Slenderman, Bye Bye Man. Is this what Hollywood has to offer? What happened to real horror? Guess its time for another Rob Zombie trailer park horror film. Haven't seen ten of those before.

reviews.review_title: Slender Man: Yet another cheap horror flick from Hollywood.
reviews.content: Slender Man is an interesting character. It works well in video games but i always feared how it would be when it came to the big screen. This is yet another generic Hollywood-horror flick that we've seen hundreds of times. There's little salvaging this from being a complete dud. The approach they took with bringing Slender Man into the film was just terrible. Summoning him like some sort of demon but instead of using a Quija board it's a laptop.The tension in the film is so poorly built. Things just happen for the sake of them happening. This film isn't boring because nothing happens, it's boring because the same thing happens over and over again. It's rushed. Characters go missing early on with no development or build up. The 'scares and sequences' are as generic as possible. Running in the woods, twigs snapping, repeated jumpscares of just random people popping up with the cheap tense music the background. It gets repetitive. I found myself laughing out loud multiple times. Such as the scene where Slender Man videos calls one of the characters. Think about it. The supposedly scary monster video calling people? Come on. Also the hallucination scene when the lead character was kissing a guy at his house. Comedy gold.The dialogue is plain, and kinda cringe at times. The acting is pretty good. Joey King is going to be a big star someday i think. The effects aren't that good. Looks like they took them straight out of the video game. This film feels like a horror movie put together by people who've read summaries of great horror movies but never actually seen one. Although i have given this a lot of criticism, i don't believe this is one of the worst of it's genre like it's been rated to be. It's low effort, cheap, but watchable enough. At least i didn't fall asleep like my friend did.

So, I just saw Slenderman and wish I hadn't.
This easily is one of the most boring horror flicks I've ever seen, to the point where I'd would say that any low budget Hong Kong Martial Arts movie is way more entertaining.I kinda have pity with the actors in the movie having to portrait rather generic and bland characters. The only good thing about the movie was the music. Other than that the atmosphere was boring, cheap effects and weak jump scares that wouldn't even scare a child.There really is a LOT of missed opportunity here for a decent horror movie based on the Slenderman myth... but instead they just wasted their time and created a crappy film you should forget about and rather read some creepy pastas about Slenderman, since they will definitely get you more spooked than this.

Dear Hollywood,
This really has to stop! I recently saw the trailer for this film and it looked intriguing and exciting. Based on the trailer I went to see it earlier tonight but couldn't have been more disappointed and furious. Not only is this film horribly boring, what makes it worse it that key scenes from the trailer didn't actually make the cut. This leaves a film with artsy boring psychedelic-ish effects and bad sound effects. Not to mention the dreary script... I mean does anybody ever enter somebody else's house without turning on the lights? And what actually happened to the girls? Oh yeah it also mentions self mutilation but nothing ever happens. But what is worse is that Hollywood keeps putting out trailers with scenes that don't ever appear in the movie.... Stay away from this film!

reviews.review_title: This movie doesnt deserve the hate!
reviews.content: I seriously dont get why this movie has this score...I think the build up is very good, it has a unique way to scare you, you will understand when you see the movie, and overall the movie is ok. Dont start the movie expecting to be scared so much and to be a movie form a videogame that basically has no plot...They did a great job transfer the feeling of the unknown, because you dont know what to expect from a myth/creepypasta just like this. The ending is what you feel is gonna happen in my opinion, at least i thought of that...Dont hate the movie cuz you wanted to be something else...go open minded. I have played many slender games and i started this movie while i was thinking i am going to see a bad movie cuz of the reviews....People who rate this with 1 star i think they need to see more movies for sure. Good cinematography, good acting in most of the cast (only one girl is out of character for me), good effects, good tension, GOOD MOVIE!

reviews.review_title: aweful story and direction and acting. Pathetic
reviews.content: All poor ugly actors and a story that is so predictable it's sad! Every actor in this should just quit and get jobs as waitresses at a diner! Yuk

'slender man' is the worst movie I have ever seen. the acting is terrible, the writing is horrible, the directing is embarrassing. Sylvain white should never be allowed near a film production ever again. slender man is a popular character yet is utilized worse than the bye bye man. great opportunities missed in this unoriginal ripoff of truth or dare and the ring. the cinematography is so ugly and dark, it's hard to see most of the movie, and when you can see it it's ugly to look at. the camera shots are so lifeless, sometimes you ponder why sylvain white placed the camera where he did. the storyline doesn't make any sense, you don't know how much time has passed in the movie since randomly it's day and night. the source material is not respected in the slightest as slender man is barely in the movie and is not scary, he is utilized terribly. this movie isn't scary, jumpscares aren't scary, they're a cheap scare, and even those are barely in the movie. it's so predictable. this movie is however funny and should be seen as a comedy, the scares are so poorly done and unintentionally funny, the audience in my theater were laughing. the script is clearly written by someone who doesn't understand how teenagers talk or act. the first 20 minutes feel like an hour and is boring and the rest is funny and quick. if you do go see this movie, see it with a friend or something as this would suck to watch alone. This movie is an embarrassment and is one of the unintentionally funniest movies of the summer.

I watched this movie purely because I told myself I had to in order to close that chapter in my life that involved Slender.All those times playing the 8 pages game when it came out and watching Marble Hornets on YouTube.It wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. The scares were eh. Kind of predictable as far as the story goes. The "main" characters weren't that interesting; misunderstood teenage girls, how original. You actually get to see Slender a lot more than I thought which I did and didn't like. I would of liked it more if it was a mere glances of him that you as a viewer get to see rather than showing him to us in detail.I wouldn't watch it twice though, or if you've never seen it and think you might want to (doubt it) I wouldn't.Save yourself the 1 1/2 hours and watch Texas Chainsaw Massacre (1974).
We walked out in the first half hour and got our money back.

I know a lot of the reviews say it sucked but it actually kept my interest. The first scene the teen banter seemed really generic and forced but the movie got interesting pretty quickly once the girls tried to summon slenderman. There was some good disturbing imagery in this movie when the girls were depicted as losing thier minds, but I felt that slenderman could have been much scarier looking. That aspect fell a little flat. Overall its watchable but not worth buying your own copy.

reviews.review_title: It was okay but better than 3 stars
reviews.content:
I give this 7 stars because it did keep my interest and wasnt the worse movie out there. I loved the video they had to watch to summon SM. It was very creepy. And I loved the woods scenes. And the idea of getting a video call of their house and someone walking up to their rooms was very unnerving. The acting was okay. The very first scene where the girls are on the bleachers, it was very terrible in the acting but it gets better. Some things that I wish had been different were
* the lighting in the background. I wish slenderman had been more illuminated in the background so I could see him. The girls would see him and gasp and I hadn't even seen what was scary. This happened several times.
* the CGI was a bit obvious also. It wasnt too distracting but the make out scene where his face was distorted. that was terrible lol I laughed at it as it was happening.
* the plot was okay but I wish it would have said something about why their parents were letting these young girls out at night after a girl had just gone missing. I wouldn't let my kid out at night in these situations. And also the end was very abrupt. I wasnt expecting it to be ended so quickly and it was weird she said take me then ran away? Maybe she just got too scared but still was a disconnect there.
* I wish the characters were a little bit more distinguishable. They didnt really have anything that stood out about them except the one girl was African American and the other was a ginger and one had a sister. That was how I kept track of them because I didn't really know which one was the main character.
But overall I think the movie did its job on being a horror movie. It had its unsettling scenes and creepy moments. I did enjoy it but it did leave me with questions at the end
This is a pretty entertaining film if you take it for what it is.

reviews.review_title: I have had more fun watching paint dry !
reviews.content: The movie doesn't look too bad, but my god it's so boring. The characters are bland, the story goes nowhere for 90% of the time and the horror part consists mostly of weird clips and not very good jump scares. I tried my best to enjoy it, I even putted on some good headphones in order to feel everything but sadly the most interesting thing that happened was me putting some e juice in my vape. It didn't even had a moment that was so bad, that it was good moment. This movie is taking itself too seriously. I prefer watching Victor Crowly at least that movie was so bad that i had some funny moments. There is nothing redeemable in this movie! You would be better off with painting a wall and watching it dry.

This movie is absolute garbage just another abomination of a movie made from a video game the movie is not scary at all as to how the slender game is if you want a slender man scare play the video game because you won't get it here

Terrible.awful.not good.waste of time.not scary.this sucked.it has to really try hard not to be sad.they should've tried to burn him,and the script.shot bad.acted bad.poison ivy is more enjoyable...the rash;not the movie.

This really has to be one of the worst movies in the so-called horror genre I've ever watched. In fact, I switched it off after 30 minutes it was so bad! Wtf. This movie is not good and you had something really good to go with. The urban legend Slenderman and you did this. It's so so sad, cause the story is sooo creepy by it itself that you don't have to do much really.You overdid it big time, it's a myth that you need a lot of effects to make a creepy movie, and you don't need jumpscares.

Terrible movie. Don't watch it. It's not scary at all and just lost of time
Pointless, stupid and literally has nothing to offer to film. Don't waste your time.

I watch a lot of horror movies, I have an IMDB list called "Best Supernatural Horror Movies" you should check out for horror movie ideas.In any case, I put this in the "solid effort" category.Pros:
The motives of the Slender Man are interesting.
Acting was EXCELLENT for a horror movie. The girls were very believable.
No giant plot holes or people doing unrealistic things.Cons:
Derivative work in some ways.
Design of the Slender Man could have been better.
CGI was just bearable. Needed more budget.And a final note I'd give to horror directors, from a true fan. We like our supernatural critters to be discovered when people do things completely at odds with their normal behavior. It makes it plausible that the Big Bad could have been out there the whole time. I wish our introduction to the Slender Man could have happened a different, more intriguing way.And we like our critters with inhuman motives, things SO DIFFERENT from what we might consider motives, that we could never understand them. This movie does a good job with that, but others do not.I give it a 5 out of 10, with no markup to "balance" the low scores. 5 is a solid score for a horror movie on IMDB and this movie deserves that.
Despite all the bad reviews, I still decided to give the movie a try. And it is as bad as they say. Very slow and boring. TERRIBLE effects and graphics. Slender man looks stupid and too fake.
Very funny movie. No character development so I had no emotion when they all die. They were really stupid too.
This movie was all i expected it to be.... just typically like what i used to rent from Blockbuster in the 80's.

reviews.review_title: Wasn't as bad as I had anticipated... But still bad nonetheless
reviews.content: While I can't understand why anyone would release a Slenderman movie in 2018, I didn't think it was as bad as people made out to be. If this was made in 2011 or 2012 when Slenderman was actually relevant I would imagine it would've been huge box office success, it'd still probably be bad but the hype would've helped carry and help with the succession. The writing, first and foremost was unforgivably cringey. In the first ten minutes there's pieces of dialogue that I've never heard any real people say, let alone a bunch of fifteen year olds. It lives into endless bad horror movie cliches with both the characters, dialogue and cheap jump scares but manages to savour some sort of dignity with the occasional scenic shot. I'm sure if this was a 12A young tweens would be terrified by this for the best part of a year but as a 15, for the people who were around for the Slenderman phenomenon who are mostly in their 20s now Will just this mundane, cringey and tiresome. Worth a watch if you're interested but it's mostly a waste of time.

reviews.review_title: I was hoping they went big!!
reviews.content: In my opinion very bla! Very amateurish bummer because it could've been really good. But this just puts a ending to a fun creepy pasta!!

Tried to hard to be like 'The Ring' instead of following the lore already set up and created for Slenderman. There are scenes missing from the movie that we're in the trailer so no doubt the studio made them edit and neuter the movie even more. It's a sad sad attempt at something that could have been great. The few actual scenes with Slenderman are awesome except the CGI looks like it's from the 90s.

reviews.review_title: Slender Man, a movie about running around in the woods while causing viewers epileptic seizures.
reviews.content: I was hoping that this film would have some potential as the video games left me on my toes. But that wasn't the case. The character build up was horrible. The plot was all over the place with no fluidity to it. The CGI was not so great. Acting was okay for a horror film. I yawned for a good portion of the film and actually wanted to step out but I wanted to see how it ends. The ending was the icing on the cake to say the film is something worth leaving in the past and never worth seeing again.

reviews.review_title: It had the makings of full on creep-fest

The Slender Man was nothing more than a character out of say 'Miss Peregrines School for Peculiar Children', not scary at all. There were a few effective formulaic jumps and scares, not many. Looked slick in parts and poor in others. Just meh, never got going.

Not too bad, not too good
medium Grande

score low but good

reviews.review_title: A Horror film with scare effect that doesn't affect
reviews.content: The cast are amateurish. They're pretty and they know how to act but that's just it. Nothing impressive. The story is too simple. It's like finishing a book in one seating. I intended to watched this film alone so I will get scared. But it didn't happened even though I'm using a Hi-Fi earpiece and no lights in my room.The CGI effects are not good. Half-way the movie, I already lose my interest. I'm no longer expecting anything. I just want it to end. That's it.Thanks!

reviews.review_title: This is my first time writing a review ever, so I'm sorry if it's all over the place. I'll try to write it as best I can.
reviews.content:
I really don't know what to say. Acting was wooden and stilted as hell. 
Only memorable parts of the soundtrack were the many sudden piano sounds and other cliché (DUN!!!) jumspcare noises that played over everything. EVERYTHING. Even things that aren't scary (Example: There's a scene where a librarian walks past the screen and apprently it's supposed to scare you as evidenced by the sound cue, but the problem is: she's not doing or saying anything scary. She just walks past looking like she's lost. Like how was that scary????).
That's just about the only thing I can even recall as the story and dialogue were easily the most forgettable part of the whole movie. Actually, there almost IS NO STORY. All I remember is that 4 girls in high school summon Slenderman by going onto some forum or chat room and clicking on a link to a video that makes Slenderman come after you after watching it (which is already stupid on it's own, by the way. If that's all you had to do to get him to come get you, wouldn't the whole world be dead already?). After that, things just happen with no rhyme or reason and with no real consistency. Sometimes Slenderman decides to take victims immediately, sometimes he decides to let victims get away even when he has no reason to and the perfect opportunity to just take them. 
Slenderman himself looks like a poorly rendered Playstation 1 game model. They actually had an actor play as him? When??? He looks like he was built completely from scratch in CGI but done in like 2 minutes. Way too much CGI and way too lazily done!
I'd also just like to point out that some of the best scenes from the trailer are NOWHERE in the movie. Like the eyeball stabbing or the guy throwing himself off the roof or the cops finding that pale girl in a field holding something in her hands. The most interesting parts of the trailer: completely cut from the film.
Overall, I was really hoping for this to turn out good, but then again, this was made by Sony. So I really should have seen this coming the second it was first announced. If you're wiiling to basically turn your brain off for an hour and half and you're VERY easily scared, you might like this. But me? I'm gonna go re-play some of the awesome Slender games like The Eight Pages, Sanitorium, and The Arrival and just forget this ever existed. Leave it to Sony to make disappointing half-assed cash-ins on whatever is or was trendy. :(

I really wanted to like this, and I have no idea if the movie is good or not BECAUSE I COULDN'T SEE IT!!! I didn't have a problem with the actors, or the plot. And it built suspense just fine. But it was way too dark. Aliens vs Predator Requiem was the same way. Like they don't know how to light a dark scene. Everything gets completely lost at times.

An obscure urban legend too absurd to be true, continuous references to the power of social media sharing, twenty-something actresses portraying high school students... I'm pretty much sure they tried to pull a "The Ring for Generation Z" and the result was this thing. Boring, predictable, not really compelling in any of its parts, with a sole exception: Joey King and Annalise Basso being part of the cast. Too little.
I didn't like the movie like slenderman should of had a better storyline to it. I was disappointed.

I've been looking forward to a film about slender man for a while now, but it is terrible. So damn boring with every cliche in a horror film imaginable thrown into one film.
I couldn't take it seriously with all the terrible and illogical decisions from these girls. I almost slept in the theatre that's how bad it was. I didn't care about the characters, at all. Actually, I didn't care about anything at all. 2018's Bye Bye Man.
Movie copies "The Ring" with the main characters watching a cursed video which summons slender man. Poor acting And dialogue, and really bad scares. Don't recommend.

This movie was so bad made bad didn't make any sense. Would not watch it again even if it comes on tv . It didn't have a real story line it wasn't worth watching. Please don't waist your money to watch it .

reviews.review_title: Slender Man a.k.a. Tree Man or Horror Comedy

Boring, boring, boring as another horrible Sony movie, this movie is about Slender Man without Slender Man, the beginning is totally unattractive and this movie has no story, unimaginative, I think this movie was shot without a script, this film has a problem with cameras therefore it was not viewable, oh terrible, terrible, nothing was original, it's a copy of The Ring
1/10

reviews.review_title: PLEASE DONT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE I DID
reviews.content:
I MADE AN ACCOUNT JUST TO WRITE THIS

reviews.review_title: Average horror that should have been better.
reviews.content: Found this watchable and not a complete disaster like many reviews suggest. More like "Boring man".The film is so bland, even the jump scares are kind of "meh". It's not a good sign when you fight sleep to keep watching a horror.The story is as thin as the Slender Man, who's in turn as thin as the source material.

This somewhat forgotten picture of 2018 amounts to a disappointment more than anything else. To address the obvious first: yes, this movie was made a few years too late, and sadly the quality of the finished film means it's likely that it will never be redeemed by gaining cult status by fans of either the horror genre or Victor Surge's eponymous character.There are maybe one or two frightening scenes that work well in the movie and it occasionally plays with suspense quite well for the first hour. Alas, as the film drag on the numerous fake-outs make the film a laborious bore and it's a struggle when it comes to the last half hour.You are waiting for the film to end once you've passed the sixty-minute mark, yet even when the film ends it's very unsatisfying. There's nothing wrong with the film's ninety-minute run time but there were far too many scenes cut from this movie (often integral ones revealing the fates of the characters we come across), so when the film ends seemingly out of nowhere it really feels as though you've missed something. You're just sat there left wondering, what was that all about? There's no resolution and therefore, no payoff so it feels as though you've wasted your time.Even watching the trailer back after finishing the film they feel like two very different products and that's a shame because this could have been so much more than what it ended up being. Especially when you consider Sony already had a ready-made story in their grasp as they could have easily adapted the 2014 'Slender Man' stabbing of Payton Leutner into something appealing. Nevertheless, what you're given is what is essentially an unfinished film, one I definitely would have felt cheated at paying to see in a movie theatre.Ultimately, Slender Man itself is an old internet creepypasta/meme from a by gone decade, which like this movie is best left forgotten. But, if you're someone out there looking to be entertained by this character (though I can't seriously believe there are many of you nearly a decade on), you're probably better off watching an old YouTube "Let's Play."

reviews.review_title: WARNING FOR THOSE WITH EPILEPSY AND/OR SENSORY SENSITIVITIES
reviews.content: For starters, the movie wasn't that great. It was kind of boring and the ending sucked. It wasn't entirely scary either. However, there seems to be very little warnings on the internet about a couple scenes that involve flashing lights and/or flashing imagery. They don't last very long, but the only warnings I saw were at the movie theater and before the movie. I researched for information about any sensory warnings for the movie and didn't find anything. So please be aware of it before going to see the movie. There are a couple scenes with flashing lights and/or imagery that could affect somebody with epilepsy or sensory sensitivities, and I haven't found many warnings on the internet about it.

reviews.review_title: Got lost not what I expected
reviews.content: I live in Wisconsin and thinking they made this movie due to the stabbing we had . So I somehow thought the movie was going to lead me into events that would of been close to that . Being they decided to use slender man now after all that . But no ,, went off into what i am still not sure . Wasn't horrible but wasn't good either.

Very big opportunity that was poorly done executed. The poor acting and storyline killed it for me. The only cool part of the movie was the soundtrack so props to whoever made it. I love Slender Man but this movie ruined his reputation. Javier is an awesome actor too, yet there was little to no screen time for him during the movie. There were no scary parts at all and certain scenes were very cringy. It felt more like a teen drama with a few shocking scenes.
This film butchered the creepy pasta very badly! Highly recommend it if you want a good laugh.

reviews.review_title: Desperately average but still better than Hereditary

Acting is meh, direction meh, and the jump scares don't make you jump. But not offensively bad and still less insulting to your intelligence than Hereditary was

reviews.review_title: Creepy but could have been better

I am seriously considering contacting God and ask him to give me my 93 minutes back. It's His business if He decides to subtract these 93 minutes from the life of the director of the movie.

Poor and lazy writing, and poor acting dog this film throughout.To be fair that's not unique to this film, but this is a particularly bad example of a horror film.As is often the case these days, the film is littered with poor and odd decision making, like going to the woods to try and find the Slender Man, wouldn't you take some adults?And where exactly are the parents? Aside from a couple of cameo appearances they didn't seem to be involved in their kids lives at all.The acting was probably the worst part though. I don't know where they found these young ladies but it wasn't Rada.I paused the film part way through thinking it must be nearly finished and there was still 36 minutes left. I've never experienced time drag so slowly.Overall there are a million other films that are better, avoid!!

reviews.review_title: I love the idea of the best slenderman review please
reviews.content: Best thing I ever seen before I hope to see more of the slenderman in the future I love this movie of the best in my life.

reviews.review_title: Could of be good. It really wasn't.
reviews.content:
I don't often write reviews but I'm compelled to write one this time.
The slender man legend has always been an interesting premise for me so when I heard a film was coming I was excited. It came out in the cinema and got shocking reviews so I waited for home release. I wish I hadn't bothered. It looked good, in places. But the main thing was you saw him too much. The point in slender man is that you barely see him or just glimpses. It wasn't scary at all, no jump scares either. You can tell it had been cut to pieces to get a lower age rating and in places it didn't make sense because of it. The acting wasn't too bad but the script was badly written also. It was so cliche in places you wanted to throw things at the tv and scream why would you do that it's 2018!! The pace was slow in places for a "horror film" and it just seemed so bland. It trails along from bad to good effects then bad again. Parts of it looked creepy to start of with then looked silly. It could of been so good. It's great source material and if someone like James Wan had the directors chair I think it could of been something special. However I struggled to finish it but did and didn't really care about any of the characters because to be honest parts of it just didn't make sense. A waste of a perfectly good premise. Avoid if you like decent horror. I would say try the Nun this year but that also was pretty poor considering it was a conjuring spin off.
Please someone try again and make a good movie of it.
The beginning was pretty good and i like the plot of the movie, but towards the ending it got worse

I watched this move for joey king... I dont know why she chose this script at this point of her career.. she is a very good performer. This script is not suitable for her..
The truth is i cant watch this film after 45mins...
Lazy screenplay , predictable dialogues , seriously i didn't realized that this is a horror movie!
I am totally disappointed!!!
Pls dont watch this movie.

Slender Man has moments that are solid and have the makings of being a terrific and truly scary film. It presents an eerie atmosphere, as the majority of the scenes are shot at night with dark lit rooms, fog slowly creeping in the background, and ventures into the deep unforgiving woods that forces us to constantly scan the background for a shadowy figure. The acting is sufficient, I thought Julia Goldani Telles stood out and played this role quite well. With all of this going for Slender Man, its main downfall is that it lacks a fluid story that captivates its audiences. The pacing is erratic throughout the film, characters are so busy that I was never able to connect with any of them. Despite some nice visuals and tense moments, the main villain Slender Man also fails to be scary, he comes across as a generic boogeyman that we never really learn much about. Overall, I didn't think this was a bad horror film, it definitely has certain qualities about it that passes as watchable, but I feel like a much better movie is somewhere deep in those woods.

Less than stellar acting by certain people is one of the many things that holds this movie back. Its just bland and even boring at certain parts, wich is bad for any movie, but for a horror film is even more so.
This is probably the best horror movie to come out this year and I almost didn't give it a chance because of the low rating. I don't usually post reviews, but this movie is seriously amazing.

This just seems like the typical boring teenage horror movie. Some teenagers do something stupid, then bad things happens to them. Feels like they tried putting in some jump scares, just to make it enjoyable(which they failed, miserably).
After the girl who was stabbed you would think that Sony would have the decency to not show this movie but it is clear that they do not have any such decency.

After reading a bunch of reviews from you guys, I decided to go watch it and give my own opinion.I simply don't like the story. In fact, I hate it. I don't find it interesting at all.
I yawned 14 times (counted).At this point I think slenderman should remain in videogames and stay away from the movies. I've played Slender: The Arrival and I must say it's a 1000 better and scarier than this attempt of a movie.

reviews.review_title: Gave it a fair shot and it still sucked
reviews.content: It was like a bad film student project. Trippy bits here and there using supposedly scary imagery with no connection to the already weak plot. Couldn't wait for the end.

One smooth evening 4 slender girls call doom upon themselves by invoking - "The Slender Man". They do the act online with as much ease as placing an Amazon order. What arrives instead is a faceless figurine of a slender spectre who eventually transforms into a slender spider and finally into a slender tree. The slender "man" sways in and out of the girl's hallucinations and dreams like a gentle twig suddenly disturbed on a wild stormy day.This movie put me to sleep on a vibrant evening with its slender logic. I'm sure the money it made was as slender as the movie's plot.

The movie is hugely underrated. It's not the best movie of 2018, but it's not the worst. Some of the talking amongst characters is very cringe worthy and the jumpscares are kinda cheap. It reminds me of Slender:The Arrival.
To conclude:
Great movie 8/10.
Reminds of the second game.

It took me 4 attempts to watch this as each time i fell asleep.. frankly i wished i had not bothered. Its very rare i say this but honestly.. don't bother with this one. You'll miss NOTHING! Very boring film with 0 story. Garbage!!!

Despite some creepy bits that helped the film, overall it was a disappointing low-budget film very similar to a student film. You can tell it's low-budget due to the use of sound and the mostly human-like antagonist with some special effects. It tried too hard many times to the point I was bored of it. Slenderman should not have had as much film time as he was given, if the film was made in a more atmospheric manner it potentially would have been better. The line for me was the excessive use of the Hitchcock shot; as a film student myself we were banned in college from using it! Overall this was a cheap, disappointing film that could have had potential, but tried too hard to scare and unnerve the audience.

Firstly, because they wanted to show that you can make a movie without use of any lights.
I guess its scarier that way?
No, its not.
Secondly, since teens are flat lines in terms of acting and making decisions trough the movie, slim guy is more scary?
No, its not.
Thirdly, absence of parents suppose to prove what? That unsupervised teens will get the first chance to summon a demon, and spend the rest of their short lives running trough woods in the middle of night?
Anyway, bad movie, not scary and very easily forgotten.

The movie has no horror, a bad story, a bad script, a flawed slenderman and nothing makes sense. Looks like the director doesn't know about the slenderman story and out of the blue decided to do this disgrace! I have never been so uncomfortable with a movie.

There was nothing redeeming or good about this film. If you like bad acting, or awful editing, or cliche writing along with bad directing and just bad shots all around then you'll love this movie. Goosebumps is scarier than this. Incredibles 2 is scarier than this movie. I refuse to spend more time on this review. I only made this review to warn others to not waste there time.

This movie might have been good. I really don't know. When it wasn't too dark to make out what was happening on screen, I was extremely distracted by the stilted, weird, and creepily awkward dialogue. The filmmakers had a pretty neat story to build off of, yet they blew it horrendously.

reviews.review_title: ITS NOT AS BAD AS PEOPLE SAY
reviews.content: Sometimes I can´t understand over rating movies and some other like this one, under rated! This it´s actually pretty good movie! keeps you in suspense all the time... enjoyable!

reviews.review_title: Movie with good awesome effect but not so good story.
reviews.content: The actting are awesome and the movie effects is pretty awesome but the story like it was written by an amateur. Well writing a movie based on urban legend with so many version is hard, i understand that. I hope it will improve if they gonna make another version of this.

... great. It could have been a really great horror psychological thriller. I didn't mind watching it and I knew what to expect since I've seen the ratings. But I enjoyed poor rated horror movies before, because beauty is in the eyes of the beholder.I decided to write this little thing here, in hope to see a better Slender Man in the future and also because the ending made me laugh so hard; let's say the ending is the wet dream of eco-philiacs. reviews.review_title: DNF! Do not waste your time please
reviews.content: Most of the time I can drag myself through worst of the worst boring and drag movies but I could not even on this one! I Had some expectations because of the cast but they could not save this disaster. Weak plot and not so scary Slender Man was the end of me 😂

Slender Man is one of the worst movies in history.
It has the worst dialogue, awful acting and awfully bored me to death. I pretty much stopped paying attention to the movie when I realized what I'd gotten myself into.This movie doesn't even deserve 1 star. It's not the it's-so-bad-it's actually-kind-of-funny type of horror movie. It's just bad and bores you to death.
