1/10 because there is no 0 stars.
I feel humiliated by this piece of S... Simply don't understand how could anybody rate it 10/10. They are definately not fans of horrors.

Slender Man is only just watchable and then quite unengaging. It is so forgettable a film I am not even sure I hadn't already seen it. The plot and direction are so derivative and predictable, one could be mistaken for thinking it was computer generated.The actors put in perfectly good performances but ultimately can't make this much more than a distraction from time better used.

Man, I had high hopes for this one. Such a nice, creepy story, it could be really nice. Instead, they put a bunch of school kids, running, and screaming. The scariest scene is one that a working lady passes by in the library.
Too bad. That's 10$ I'll never see again..

reviews.review_title: Too late, and too horrible to be scary
reviews.content: From the director of Stomp The Yard (yes, you heard me right, the dance movie) comes Slender Man, based on a internet trend that died out years before this film came out. The basic premise is that a group of girls come across a online "ritual" to summon the titular creature. Then one of them goes missing. Now the remaining three have to dig deeper into the Slender-Lore to hopefully get their friend back. But why even bother caring? Why would anyone make this besides for the money? Slender Man is hardly scary. It actually feels a bit dumb. What really bothers me is that one of the actresses who plays a part of the main group, Jaz Sinclair, is WAY older irl then her character lets out to be. Proof? Slender Man came in 2018. Sinclair starred in another Screen Gems film, When The Bough Breaks, which came out in 2016. Her character in the latter was 21 years old. So assuming that was also her real age at the time, Jaz would have been 23 years old at the time of Slender Man's production. Wow. What a bad decision among the other ones this movie makes. If you want to watch it, go ahead. Just don't say i didn't warn you.
Only watch if you have nothing else to watch - lacking A star actors
You're not missing anything. The acting, characters, storyline, boring and uneventful.

The audience spent more time laughing than being scared. This film looks like it has been written and edited by a 14 year old on acid. The story is bland with too many unfinished plot holes and the effects are rediculous. Every time Slender Man actually appeared the entire cinema laughed. Felt a little more like 'Scary Movie' than an actual scary movie. The acting was poor on all accounts to top it off, the horror scenes were too amusing to be taken seriously and after a while everyone found themselves asking "will you just kill her off already?". Enjoy.

I haven't read up on this film yet, I only saw that it was rated by enough viewers to reflect a true value by its viewing public (which is apparently very low). I don't like movies from this genre to begin with and, rather than jumping, they usually just put me to sleep. But Slender Man is an objectively good film. The production quality is top-notch, the acting is believable (that's all I ask for) and there's a proper story. Also, it doesn't play kitschy tropes from the dime-a-dozen horror flicks that come out each year. I'm guessing there was too much anticipation (and expectation) and that led to seething disappointment. While not a "must see," it is definitely "good."

reviews.review_title: Don't know what people are on about.
reviews.content:
So this movie has gotten alot of negative reviews, and I have no idea why. 
The acting was completely fine, dialogue was on point as well (in the German version at least). The effects were of a surprising variety and even the sudden change of style added to the suspension. I especially like the lack of gore in this movie, as it keeps Slenderman itself somewhat mysterious. 
The story was solid, nothing new but definely not bad. There were some new ideas to build up suspension, one in particular caught my eye and I like it alot: the video-call scene where Slenderman haunts one of the girls from his perspective, yet is nowhere to be seen. 
If all you want is gore, this movie probably isn't the one for you, but otherwise it should be pretty fun to watch, even though the ending is a little disappointing.

reviews.review_title: I should go for -5 but imdb don't allow
reviews.content: Oh god.This was so bad that if i review this i consider it insult to my self.actually watching this movie is vituperation to audience.
I very scared, good halloween/spooktober watch. It scared me and my friend tim (we are both 8 years old). Very spooky

reviews.review_title: NOT worth the money or time to go see
reviews.content:
Honestly the worst scary movie I've ever watched. 
I saw Bye bye man and thought it was better than this.
a lot of people went to see this because they played the scary slender man
computer game in high school, but TRUST me its nothing like the game.
The fact this movie was made in 2018 is embarrassing. Just please DO NOT
waste your money to go see this.

reviews.review_title: I don't know what everyone is talking about.
reviews.content: Honestly, I'm surprised at the low reviews Slenderman has received. This movie could have been SO cheesy and cringeworthy, but it wasn't. The scenery paired with the music/sound effects did an incredible job of pulling the watcher into the gray and ominous mythology that is slenderman. Was there a little cheese in some parts? Yeah, of course. What movie doesn't have that though? The scares weren't terrifying, but they were mostly presented in unique ways and honestly I just thought it was a good, chill movie.

I thought this would be awful but it was really good. Made me jump which is what I want in this sort of film. It's been made in a cult-film artsy type way, but if you just let that wash over you, it's honestly not a bad film.
The first 15 minutes had started off promising but it never picked up, flatline straight through. No Excitement No Horror

This movie is absolute garbage! Will never watch again. It didn't keep my interest! It wasn't that scary. There was a few parts where I jumped...because something comes out of nowhere but don't waste your time...or your money!!

Was this movie good? No it wasn't. Was I expecting it to be good? Not really but it felt kind of like of those fun B movies that are fun because they're not great. When Slendy was on screen, he didn't look to bad and with these kinds of movies I want the main characters to die

reviews.review_title: I don't get the low rating
reviews.content: It's obviously not a game changer but still fun to watch. Acting is good, shots and visuals are fine, it even has the latest best horror addition in the industry : javier botet. I'd say do not skip a nice, fun scare.

Slender Man is a movie about an iconic creepy figure that is usually put into old time photos that a myth was built upon much like the Mothman. In the myth people end up just vanishing and this movie does a good job portraying that.A lot of people seem to be complaining that there is no "gore" or that the character's just "Vanish" But that is the point of it, even during the movie it makes mention to how the Slender Man effects a person's mind. Either way, take it for what it is, a creepy horror film, not some slasher that most seemed to have expected (for some reason).It was an enjoyable watch, not an amazing movie, but enjoyable.

Not sure why this movie has such an awful rating. I thought it was pretty good for a pg13 horror. Although I wish they kept the gory and disturbing scenes from the trailer that were cut out due to fear of backlash :/ nonetheless quite a good movie! I will definitely be watching this again.
Best thing was, that it had an end! worst thing was, that it has been produced anyway!

This movie was so awful I couldn't even finish it. I lost interest within the first 15 minutes due to the terrible acting but I tried to stick with it. I ended up doing some chores while it was playing in the background because I literally could not sit down to watch it because it was that bad. I turned it off with 30 minutes left and I'm still mad I wasted an hour of my life. One of the worst movies I've even seen.

reviews.review_title: The True Curse of the Slenderman is this Movie
reviews.content:
I went into this not expecting a masterpiece. Maybe a passable popcorn movie based on one of my favorite creepy pastas. I didn't even get that much.This feels like a parody. The typical group of high school victims aren't even given any developed or likeable personalities. The choices they make are beyond stupid, even for a horror movie. One of the main girls kept crying and whimpering, even while giving out important information about the Slenderman, it just comes out as fragments. When she finally gets taken (killed? I honestly don't know), everyone in the movie theater cheered. You won't be rooting for these insufferable kids, you'll be rooting for the villain. 
Are horror movies not allowed to have any blood anymore? There is not a single drop of the red stuff to be seen anywhere. No clear on-screen deaths either. The Slenderman gets sold as a creature that will screw up your mind more than it will actually cause any physical harm.
The special effects and creepy imagery are nice enough. Certainly well done. But what the point of using it if there's no payoff?
Slenderman is weak. Weak in scares, weak in plot and character development, weak in not trying anything shocking. 
Go see a real horror movie that has some blood and balls.

reviews.review_title: Loads of potential gone to waste
reviews.content: Various elements of the cgi totally take away from immersion was well as predictability throughout
Liars! The 50% of the trailer is missing from the movie, the best scenes why I went to watch it! Cheaters, that is the deception of the audience!

If you want to see a well made crappy pasta turning into a horrible movie, then you should watch. By the way, why did you have to use triangle and eye? And the girls? That was a big dissappointment. I thought they would be searching and finding papers like one in the game but instead... I mean, that was a disaster.

It gets a 2* review based solely on the fact that some scenes have decent cinematography, and that's all.It's not scary, the acting is quite poor for the most part, and the effects really aren't very good. I've seen better CGI in video games and for the budget this film had, that's pretty laughable.I've seen a fair few 'best horror film I've seen' reviews, and they MUST be fake. Surely. To rate this any higher than a 4 is just a plain lie in my opinion.Give it a miss. 2/10
Promising storyline turns out to be stupid. Boring and misses its potencial. The trailer is just the best outtakes. save your money for the cinema.

reviews.review_title: Could have been so much better.
reviews.content: There is a great deal of source material that could have made this movie a classic. Sadly, it fell well and truly short of the mark. No character development, no real plot if I'm being honest apart from teens in peril. Could have been any monster as a protagonist. That said, some of the cinematography was superb.

The first time I saw this name, I was attracted, and it felt very novel. As a result ... I didn't expect such a plot. I watched a good nap. A little taste of Pandora, ghosts and fairy tales. After reading the whole story, what the hell is too bad?
This movie was not good, simply because they took all the good stuff out. There was no girl stabbing herself in the eye. And a guy jumping off the ledge. It was a snore feast to be honest

This un-scary, Uninspired film only serves to pocket the money off 'believers' of the myth that is the slenderman. Terrible special effects and laughably bad acting just added to this lackluster attempt at something that could of been genuinely interesting.
This movie was not good. Of course , I have seen worse but idk. It could have been way much better. The acting was ok but sucked at times and the ending was left unfinished.

I think this film has been unfairly critiqued, there's few good horrors out there and the majority these days are either exorcisms done boorishly or old lady ghosts screaming. It's nice to have something a bit different and the young cast did an excellent job, I recognised a couple of them with one girl starring in the new Sabrina series so I felt confident it would be a good film and I was right, yes the premise is a bit silly aren't most horrors? I've watched a lot of horror films including foreign horror so these days I rarely get scared yet a few times during this film I actually felt a sense of fear and after all isn't that the point of a scary movie? To be a little scared? Ignore the bad reviews, I thought it was a great watch.

reviews.review_title: Mostly Boring, Plus a Few Laughs
reviews.content: Slender Man will surely go down as one of the worst movies of the year. As the title of this review indicates, it is mostly a boring, nonsensical series of events saved from a lower rating by a few scenes in which it crosses into "so bad it's good" territory.Although the acting and visuals are both terrible, the writing is probably the weakest aspect of Slender Man. Most of the plot involves characters doing the same things over and over again. Various "scary" set-ups are reused multiple times. Characters utter awkward, wooden lines at inappropriate times. Together, these constitute about 90% of the runtime.The remaining 10% of the movie is where things get funny. A few scenes, which are concentrated in the middle-to-late portions of the film, go completely off the rails. In one, a wildly underdeveloped character's face morphs into a caricature while speaking normally. In another, the staff of a hospital turn into automatons. People openly laughed in the theater. These funny scenes elevate the movie from a 2 to a 3.

reviews.review_title: One of the movies you wasted you time and money
reviews.content: Rubbish movie ever I have seen in my life, short meaningless movie ever ever ever

reviews.review_title: THE WORST MOVIE I'VE EVER SEEN
reviews.content: I fully watched this movie, not bad and not scary. Worse, and completely worthless, I just waste my time to watch this nonsense movie..
This is a very boring, predictable and dumb film with a bad acting and terrible script.Of the pluses I can mention the soundtrack.I do not advise anyone to look.
I literally watched the first 40 minutes and then stopped watching it. The only reason i got through 40 minutes is because I was on my phone, barely paying attention.

reviews.review_title: As a connoisseur of trash horror movies
reviews.content:
This is worse than bye-bye man. I have had this account for 4 years and never have I felt so assaulted that I finally left a review. Cinematography - there is 1 cool shot in the movie. If you go into the movie asking "what is this shot trying to convey?" get ready for a lot of frustration. I wanted to like this movie, and I wanted it to succeed. It did not. There is no passion, and no attempt to scare. Plot - the plot is weak and without imagination. Woah the kids saw a scary video and now the monster is going to get them! 
Characters - par for the course in horror movies which is to say terrible. 
Sound design - cliche to the point of nausea. 
Please save your money and wait until you can see this for free. I had quite a bit to drink hoping to make this a great experience but even that was not enough. Even sloshed I was bored out of my mind and constantly questioning who could have made a movie this devoid from the average person.
The acting was bad, the film was so weird and cringy, it just wasn't a good movie, I love Slenderman the urban legend, but this is just- TERRIBLE. Don't waste your time on such a stupid movie.

This movie although it had a great scare element to it had a thoroughly average storyline with no twist to it at all.I would recommend to this to anyone just wanting a bit of a creep factor but not expecting too much else.

It took me almost a whole day to watch this movie, it was so boring that I had to stop and go shopping, and have my hair cut and clean the house and finish...
It is a film that it doesn't leave the story line, repeating itself frame by frame and the lack of good actors makes it worse...The worse...Very dark, some scenes one can't see a thing...I guess they were trying to save on the energy bill.

reviews.review_title: Worst Movie That I Have Ever Paid To Watch
reviews.content: I try my best to keep an open mind when watching movies, making a real effort to eliminate any subjective position I may have and objectively rate a movie. I literally cannot objectively say anything positive about this movie. Nothing.

The trailer hyped it up to be more than expected..When you watch it ,you'll realise it's really got no head on plot, it kinda goes nowhere and gets as predictable as British weather. No lie, I did dose off for a few seconds twice towards the end. interesting-ish visuals, but overall this is a bad film

This movie was absolutely horrible. However when I watched the trailer I knew what to expect with the predictable jumpscares and odd camera work but I surely didn't expect it to be THAT bad. I was literally about to fall asleep on how unamusing it was, the plot was just very laid out which made every scene so predictable . With the girls encountering slender man one at a time & the eerie music that's supposedly building suspense , you can just tell when the jumpscares are coming. The only part I fairly enjoyed was the library scene, the camera work was intriguing. There were also some parts that were flat out confusing and had no correlation to actual plot but most likely added to keep the story going , which is fine, but they should at least explain it further on during the film. The ending made absolutely no sense it was poorly executed. Don't waste your money, everyone dies or goes mental and the dead ones get turned into trees, that's basically it.

I had very high hopes for this movie as I was very into creepypastas when I was younger- but this movie was very boring and disappointing. It had no depth, and left pretty much everything to the imagination. The cgi and graphics were not only ridiculous and childish but it was very obvious that they tried to use the graphics as a saving grace for the horror aspects- but failed there too.

reviews.review_title: I genuinely couldn't make it to the end.
reviews.content: This movie just came out on NETFLIX and good god.. I started watching this movie with not very high expectations anyway because horror movies never have the best acting and movies that use video games as source material are usually quite bad, but I thought it's a decent concept what might they do with it. JESUS CHRIST. I couldn't bear it. The characters annoy me, very big jumps were taken when trying to work out what happened to Katie [kadie?] the first jump scare took me 6 rewinds to actually find (it's a small shadow in the top right hand corner if you've not seen it) I heard the jump scare noise but couldn't see the actual "scare". I usually sit movies through and try to see the positive sides of it but I would get more entertainment from watching paint dry if I'm entirely honest. If you are reading this before you watch the movie.. go watch another movie it isn't worth it. Give your time to something at least semi decent. Not a massively in depth review just some things I hated.

The only people who would actually like this movie is the people that have an iq of 10. Everybody else SHOULD notice the terrible writing and filmmaking, and that the movie's whole substance is just a bunch of "creepy" imagery. I HATE THIS MOVIE SO MUCH. IT WAS EXTREMELY BORING, AND HAD NO POINT. INSTEAD OF PEOPLE PAYING TO SEE THE MOVIE, THEY SOULD PAY PEOPLE TO WATCH JUST 30 MINUTES.

A terrible non-story that will rob you of 90 minutes, leaving with an empty soul and a numbed brain. After watching this movie you will wonder what went wrong in your life so you would waste an hour and a half looking at this cinematic adoration. Thus, the movie achieved actual real horror. Two stars for some good acting and decent CGI.

This movie is at least trying to be scary, but it might be trying a bit too much. I feel like the movie makers were focussed so much on the scary imagery that they forgot to put some sense making in the movie. The acting isn't bad, I think they just didn't have much to work with.
Horribly written and acted, lacking visuals, baffling odd plot framing (including underdeveloped subplots that didn't need to be there). It lived up to the question "Why the hell make this now?"
This movie is too bad to be true. I was expecting so much more. So predictable and no quality. Too poor in every way.
Waste of time! Really and truly boring. The story has no beginning, no middle and no end. They cut scenes out of the movie. The trailer is not the same as the movie.

If this movie was a soup, it would be bat soup.
If this movie was an airline, it would be Ryanair

reviews.review_title: Not bad. Not scary. Just meh.
reviews.content: I'll admit - I didn't enjoy the movie. Acting wasn't too bad, but I seriously think there's just too much needless screaming. Who am I to judge the acting? I'm not a director. I just feel that when a horror movie relies on so many jump scares, you know the horror just isn't working. I turned off the lights, blasted the sound system and watched the movie alone and yet, I find myself falling asleep. Special effects aren't convincing. And yes, I strongly believe that horror doesn't need to rely on gore. Not at all. I was genuinely terrified by "The Ring" (Japan version). Thai movie "Shutter" sent chills down my back. "Mirrors" made me fear my own reflection for months and these movies relied not on gore but atmospheric tensions and the fear of the unknown to grip viewers in fear. However, all things said, I don't think "Slenderman" deserves such low rating. The horror just didn't work for me.

Big "thank you" to creators of this... because of this stupid movie we won't see a real good scary Slender man for a very long time.
2 seconds of him in "It Follows " stay with me forever. This flick I will forget right after I finish typing this.
Slender man's scaryness comes from his being so much of a human, not a spired, tree or octipus.. sounds, cheap cgi, story? Come on.
Please avoid this one. Keep Slender men scary.

reviews.review_title: Better than I expected, but that really doesn't say much.
reviews.content: I went into this movie with incredibly low expectations. I thought the trailers looked more comical than scary. I was honestly surprised that the movie wasn't completely terrible. However, I can't say I recommend this movie to anyone. Things I liked:-Slenderman himself looked cool (except in the final scene)-Some background details were interesting (ex. Slenderman's shadow in the background)-The movie doesn't show Slenderman much-The movie makes good use of found footage in some scenes-Some memorable visuals-The movie builds tension wellThings I disliked:-The performances were extremely unconvincing -Too many pointless jumpscares that make no sense-The story felt like it was directly taken from other shows/movies (excluding the ending)-Several pointless scenes that add nothing to the story or characters-The movie takes itself too seriously-Toward the end of the movie, the main character's sister becomes severely ill and the movie expects the audience to care. However, this character has had only two scenes and has not been developed in any way up to this point-The ending is incredibly unsatisfying. I can't describe it without spoiling it.In the ending, Halle, the only one of the four girls still alive, goes into Slenderman's woods in order to sacrifice herself to save her sister. Once she finds Slenderman, she runs away and he grows massive spider legs and runs after her. She then gets wrapped in Slenderman's tendrils and becomes part of a tree. Halle's sister is no longer ill and then the movie ends. Overall, Slender Man isn't the worst movie I've ever seen. It has several very interesting and suspenseful scenes. However, it is held back from being anything memorable by a cliché story, uninteresting characters, and an overly melodramatic tone. 4/10

reviews.review_title: Filmed with a mobile phone that has a maximum of 8MP
reviews.content:
I watched on Netflix on my 4k TV and i must to say:
Worst Quality of image i ever seen...I saw movies from 1990 who has a better quality

Where have all the good horrors gone?I'll be brief. Too dark, couldn't see much, too much pointless screaming, irritating characters and a plot that's all over the place.Considering this 'Internet myth' caused an attempted murder on a child I'm surprised this got made to be honest.
This film really was just awful. That's it. That's all I have to say.

As a horror fan I expected a bit, and thought it might be a fun horror movie. Instead it locked story and was solely based on jumpscares and effects, which weren't even enough to make me jump. Had potential, yet failed.

reviews.review_title: Pretty good, personally loved it in spite of flaws
reviews.content: I really like this movie, but I know not a lot of people do. Sure, it's more creepy than scary, but that really did well for me with the subject matter. Though very isolated from his CreepyPasta lore, this movie acts as a really well done incarnation to bring this character to the minds of people who may not know that CreepyPasta lore. I know there are other incarnations of this particular creature/character, but this movie was phenomenal in my opinion. Not big studio, huge budget phenomenal, but phenomenal in the way that 28Days is. Lower budget than some big name horror movies but definitely put to good use.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everyone says, but it is very mediocre.
reviews.content: So is Slender Man really that bad? NO,but it isn't good either. I'll need to justify what did i just say about this film. Story and charactersDumb teenage girls summon creature and get killed one by one. Okay so story isn't interesting at all, in fact it's one of the worst examples of uninspiring writing and story telling. Characters are really dumb and generic as well, with no personality to speak off. There is girl that dies first, token black girl, suspicious girl and girl that believes in legend.Cinematography, acting and soundTo it's defense there were some cool and good looking scenes, especially how some of the camera angles were utilized. But really it relied to much on the cheap stock footage effects and facial close ups. Effects were overall alright, but you can clearly see that budget was lacking to make it look good. Acting was horrendous, wooden and over-exaggerated, with some cringe worthy moments in between. Sound was well used and it did fit the scenes really well, but like some effects, they used way to much stock footage like sounds for moments, although they were well utilized.Enjoyment and verdictI really enjoyed this movie, for all it's lack of creativity and scary scenes, it made me realize that this isn't really a boring movie, rather a really generic one. If you like Slenderman, you'll probably enjoy it, but if not skip it.5/10Recommendation lvl: PASS

reviews.review_title: Don't offer something and not follow through
reviews.content: This movie had captured interest of many people to go watch it in theaters due to the already large hype behind the legend that is Slenderman and because the trailers advertised scenes from the movie to give insight to the plot and thrill. Said movie then features in theaters and you are left disappointed because the movie did not deliver what was offered nor did it even meet any expectation I had for it (whether I based it off the trailer or even if there had been no trailer, the general knowledge of the legend just as itself), thus taking its hype and general quality down. I'm upset that I spent money on this because of the trailers featuring scenes and scenarios that were never even part of the actual movie and the overall missing the expectations set for it. You are better off saving your money and staying home to watch the Marble Hornets slenderman series in the dark than going to experience this let down.

reviews.review_title: Ignore the negative reviews, give it a chance...
reviews.content: Don't understand why this is getting such a bad press.While it's not award material I enjoyed the dynamic of the film. Humanity has always been interested in any kind of bogeyman theory, and I found the film delivered that reasonably well.Dialogue wasn't too hokey and the score fitted well to the theme.

reviews.review_title: Greatest Horror Movie Of All Time
reviews.content: A brilliant Hitchcockian masterpiece that defies all expectations. For those out there who have been turned away from this film, try it out. It is absolutely terrifying and it gripped my soul like nothing ever has before. I see this film being one of those.that critics hat at first but then gets reevaluated years later. Seriously, watch this movie!For starters, there are so many cool kills in this movie. If you're a person who likes death then watch Slenderman. Also, the Slenderman himself is like so sick, I couldn't imagine having to wake up next to him in bed.All in all, no matter who you are, you'll love Slenderman.

Sooo many things wrong. 1. All the parents need to be reported to CPS for neglect. Where are they? 2. Nobody has lights in their homes??? Turn on a light. 3. Its just slow, weird, and unclear what's actually happening in the movie. Who's affected and how? Not recommended unless you're just bored with nothing better to do.

reviews.review_title: Like Ed Wood Rose From the Grave to Insult Viewers
reviews.content: Full Disclosure: I saw it in a nearly empty theatre and was concerned I'd be removed for laughing.I have something in common with the cast of this film: I did no research before a film called Slender Man. Goodness, this is a terrible movie. How it was not a straight-to-Netflix release is the most mysterious and scary thing about it. I forget the rating, but you can take little kids to it. It's not a frightening film at all.The plot, such that it is, involves five basic and very stupid teenage girls with impossibly basic names like Haley, Chloe, Wren, Leslie, and Katie. The girls possess about as much intelligence, courage, and resourcefulness as the Scooby Doo gang. Unfortunately for them, they also possess a link to a Slenderman video, which they watch during a camping trip. Or sleepover. It doesn't matter.Katie is the first to go, unless I've confused her with another character. Her absence bothers the remaining girls enough to finally sit down research Slender Man on the Google. They really struggle with the concept, but eventually come to understand that Slender Man is sighted by folks all over the world and is responsible for most missing children cases. You know, *that* Slender Man. The one from the Internet!What makes this an awesomely bad movie, rather than merely boring one, is how rudely Sylvain White treats his audience. I felt like I was being insulted by Donald Trump after sharing my "belief" that the human body isn't really like a battery. Some insults came in the form of overtly referencing other horror films like The Ring, Silent Hill, and even Hausu. (Who does that? Who includes Hausu references and expects their viewers no to laugh?) Other insults were verbal. Characters explained things I'd just seen or already understood because they were so easy to understand. Characters asked each other if they were okay when they obviously were not. The music and sound effects were equally insulting. Slender Man's bell sounded like it came from a cartoon. Slendy himself looked like he was wearing a tight-fitting sheet face mask he bought off Amazon.If you enjoy stupid horror films-and I do-this can make for an entertaining theatre experience. Do you want to miss one of the funniest sex scenes ever committed to film? See it before the RiffTrax version so you can tell your friends.

reviews.review_title: It Tries to Hit and it Misses
reviews.content: It's a very weird movie when you're in it, things follow up too quickly, there are random motivation and characters that appear for one time and then never again/have any impact on the story. Looking back it's obvious alot of film is on the cutting floor of the studio, take Tom for example, its stressed that he acted weird the day after but there's no follow up. The three boys in the beginning of the movie that were supposed to Summon SM but chickened out dissapeared after that scene never to be spoken of again. And the girl from the mental hospital? You'd expect a visit to her but no this is the climax already and now the movie's over and you didn't care enough about the characters or felt their connection to eachother. And Slenderman himself, they never properly explain to the audience what his 'thing' is (engulfing teenager girls in his special tree, but why), his powers, the "he wants us" comes out of the blue, he's shown way too much so that you become desensitived and cherry on top looks directly taken from the original Slenderman game, with the bad graphics and all.Go watch the Nun instead in the cinema's and wait for this to hit the internet

reviews.review_title: This is underrated. It's not 10 but ...just enjoy it's creepy
reviews.content: I don't understand why people hate this movie. It has some predictable elements but every horror movie after HALLOWEEN or BLAIR WITCH PROJECT is unoriginal in one way or another. I was genuinely creeped out and maybe it's that monster we don't see effect or the idea that it's not an " in your face scare". However I watch a LOT of horror movies and this was scary enough that I felt that knot in my throat that said LOOK AWAY NO DON'T YOU WILL MISS IT BUT I'M SCARED BUT I WANT TO SEE IT. And the visual effects were subtle and quite interesting. If you pay attention there are lots of little visual tricks that support the SLENDER motif. And it doesn't really end...does it....

reviews.review_title: Don't waste your time or money.
reviews.content: Super boring. I kept falling asleep. Me and my daughter were so excited about this movie. We love creepy pasta. The plot sucked and the scares were few and far in between. Do yourself a favor and wait til you can rent it from Redbox for 2 bucks.

Absolutely the most dull, boring and least terrifying movie of the year. After 20 minutes, I knew it wasn't going anywhere. After 40 minutes, I caught myself dozing off. I wanted to finish it to see the climax and ending, however, there wasn't either. I'm sorry to say that Dwayne Johnson's, Skyscraper, was ten times better, and that's saying a lot!

The film itself on a whole was very well done the lighting was perfect for each scene the story was very good and the character design was excellent but one thing I would say is they should have gone into more depth with the story of slender man
91 minutes of my life I'll never get back. So bad it physically hurts to watch it. How did this movie ever get produced????
Anyone who greenlight this project must be clinically insane

This was potentially a good story but has been very badly delivered. The scenes don't seem to flow together and it's like it's been edited really badly. Very little actually happens and slender man isn't really in it much. It's more about paranoia and bad jump scares.The documentary about the 2 girls who killed a third because slender man asked them to is much better.First review from me so it just be bad and I watch LOTS of movies

This is probably one of the worst horror movies in 2018.
Most of the jump scares are laughable, bland characters and bad plot. The only good thing about this movie is the quick ending so I could get this movie over and done with.

I love horror movies and jump scares, but this film did not have it. Sure it had the scary effects and sounds, but when someone in the movie see's slender man in the forest, you don't even see anything. You'll have to rewind it and look very closely to see what they saw. Most of the time you can't even spot anything.I was expecting a lot more from this film. You can read a short article on the internet about slender man and get more scared than this movie.

reviews.review_title: Nonsense with no compitent thread of story
reviews.content: From the outset the film throws up the rules and regurgitates them for 90 minutes over and over again. No character progression, needless reliance on flashing images across the screen to show nothing in particular. Incoherent story and all of this is forgivable but for the sheer tedious boredom of it all.In a word. Dross. Don't waste your time.
A cross between...candyman and the ring. Low rating and boring but creepy
I'm not sure how to take this movie. It never got to a point where I was satisfied with it. And yes it was worse to than the bye bye man. But I've seen worse like Dead End.

This was probably the worst 'horror' movie I have seen, it looks like it was shot and edited on IMovie. Basic plot, basic movie, basic everything. Do not waste $10 to see this movie, if you want to see it, watch it illegally on a movie website for free.

reviews.review_title: 6/10 it' wasnt so bad, as it is rated.
reviews.content:
When their friend mysteriously disappears, a group of teenage girls explore whether the culprit could be the creepy internet urban legend character Slenderman by summoning him with a ritual.
Ok, one star bonus, cause im loving this genre. But the movie wasn't bad acting for teenegers was ok. If had a bigger budget and probably time and wish, they could have made a lot better movie. but it is awerage, fright movie. So Im not regreting it watching.Once it can be watched.

reviews.review_title: Not Scary, No Story, Absolutely Stale and Boring
reviews.content: As a young adult I remember a few years back about the whole Slender Man story and how his images were shown on YouTube videos and there was even a game that you could download that was about slender man, which made me wanna see this movie even more, I was so disappointed how slow the movie started because right then and there I knew this was not gonna be a box office hit, the movie must've have more boring than I thought because there were young adults behind me laughing and making jokes, and at the end of the movie, they had no problem obnoxiously saying, "That movie sucked!" I give this movie a 2/10 just because I like that they tried, and I know if a better director and story writer were put behind this movie, it would've done better, I do believe the story of slender man in general has potential but this movie had no story.

reviews.review_title: Slow and dark (literally dark, as opposed to metaphorically)
reviews.content:
2 stars for the effort and enthusiasm of the young actors...
This is one of those movies that uses (and abuses) night shots to (unsuccessfully) evoke fear and suspense, but even more, to make up for poor effects, and boring action scenes.
There are too many untied loose ends in explaining the origin, motives, or direction of Slender Man. I couldn't make it through the entire movie, so couldn't even tell you if there was any closure on these points.
Bottom line, use your time more productively... like watching grass grow...

Didn't obnoxiously ride current trends, probably because the writer is still in 2008 when slenderman was a thing. Overall a pretty bad movie, very poorly lit, hard to follow, incoherent, poor dialogue, bad acting (no big names in this one). I expected this movie to be a so bad its good type of deal because actual effort went into the editing and acting (albeit the editor could have made it a bit brighter). I did burst out laughing in the theater at one point, but the movie is so clichè and mundane I already forgot what it was.

The main issue I had with this was that the sound was completely off from the beginning. One minute the background noise would be so loud but as soon as a character spoke it's like the ambient sounds and music did not exist any more. Another major issue with this film is that I honestly didn't learn the characters names until 45 minutes in.
The characters were so bland and undeveloped, I really didn't care is any of them survived. It's not that the acting was bad it was the directing and writing that ruined it.
I would highly recommend that nobody should go watch this movie, don't waste your time or money on this.

reviews.review_title: The trailer was better than the movie.

It wasn't boring, it was bad.The movie was entertaining where it needed to be. The problems are coming form actors and directing. It wasn't a brilliant plot. It was simple and cheap but nothing too bad. The flaw is how it is executed. Terrible acting to say the least. The actors were undoubtedly the worst part. Except for Annalise Basso (Cathy), most of the girls are terrible actresses mostly Joey King. Where the movie tries to be scary, just ends up being creepy. Like that scene, when a teenage girl looks at herself in the mirror, then becomes pregnant, then some kind of tentacles come out of her belly. I don't know if it was supposed to scare but all it did was a big WTF.The movie isn't complete trash. I have to admit that the visuals and the aesthetic of the movie are on point. The lightning, the cinematography, everything is beautiful and they did a really good job.
I also liked the « disturbing » imagery. The summoning video Ring rip-off was actually very great. Also, Slenderman is almost full CGI but I think he was well executed and isn't too noticeable. He still looks better than the crooked man from Conjuring 2!
The music from the movie is also really great even if you hear it scream Game of Thrones. It is good but I would've liked Ramin Djawadi to explore something else.Before we end, I have two more flaw to point out. I saw a spoiler-free Youtube review before I watched the movie. The guy from the video (I can't recall his name so I can't credit him, sorry) said; « How do you think the movie ends? ... Yes exactly, that's how it ends », and he was right. This is one of the most predictable ending ever but my problem isn't there. My problem is with the final narration from the sister of one of the girls. No one cares about her, the movie talked about her two times, and it ends as if she was an « hero », she is the only survivor... the end... ???? ???????? Like they couldn't just end the movie with « They all die, he's unstoppable, the end »?? The felt necessary to add the sister telling what happenned? BUT in their defense, I think it's probable that they feared a lawsuit or something with their original ending, so they added this voiceover saying « slender man is bad. no summon him pls. »
Last flaw here, this movie feels soooooo unoriginal. I felt like it copied so many things. Most of the scenes reminded me of other movies, which cannot be only an « hommage ». Here is a list of what I can recall;-Library chase scene: Obviously reminded me of It (2017)
-Demon video thing: CLEARLY a copy of The Ring, even though some might call it an hommage
-The weird camera effects (like zoom in and out at the same time): Look I know they don't own these but the Insidious movies really used these effects and I wouldn't be surprise they took it from there.
-The hospital long hair lady: This is the craziest. I almost laughed out loud. How low do you have to be, to copy a concept from an American Horror Story teaser? Like not even the show, a t e a s e r!! The movie litterally steals an idea from a trailer for Season 6 (Roanoke)
-Hospital hallway man: Reminded me of It Follows
-The « sex scene »: this one is a little pushed I'll admit but it reminded me of Truth or Dare.Overall, if you expect to see an awful movie (like I did), you will end up having an OK experience with an average horror movie.
This movie has a great idea, but it is literally horible.

Slender Man is a movie one ends up watching just to satisfy a morbid curiosity. It's obvious to anybody who has visited online horror forums before that nothing good is gonna come out of a major motion picture based in an internet creepypasta. The source material is not elaborate or cohesive enough to justify making a full-length film about it, unless the writers are able to expand on it and fix it, which is not the case here.Since there's so little backstory behind this creature, the plot is very straightforward and a little uneventful. Four friends decide to summon the entity known as Slender Man out of boredom during a sleepover. At first, they don't take the consequences of their actions seriously, until, after a while, one of them disappears. Not much else happens. However, part of the narrative feels disconnected from the bigger scheme, because some minor events are left without resolution.The characters are basically non-existent, with only slight hints of what could pass as a personality for each one. The consequence is the audience's complete indifference to what will happen to them, limiting the interest in watching this film to an occasional jump scare or possible gory outcome to a particular scene. The actors do what they can with the material they're given, but the result is mediocre at best.The awful CGI is distracting, though there's not a lot more they could have done here. The biggest problem is the concept behind the story, too broad to be scary. It negatively affects the cinematography that follows the same generic path. There is one or two interesting images that would form nice compositions if they were part of a collage in an art exhibit, but here they're just not very special.If anything, the biggest flaw in this film is taking itself too seriously. It misses the opportunity to have fun with its own stupidity, and prevents the audience to do the same. Therefore, there is no reason to watch it. Skip it.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely awful and totally annoying film

They go online to research Slenderman and completely believe all the videos are completely legit (as we all totally believe everything we read and see online). There are too many flaws to bore you with.Awful acting, awful script, completely annoying lead characters and the movie looks as if the most important (and scary) parts which would make it watchable have been left on the cutting room floor.

reviews.review_title: Slenderman Is Crunchy and This Sucked Hard
reviews.content: I have a lot of feelings about this movie, mostly because Slenderman-related horror is a main interest of mine, and as a writer myself. It wasn't ALL bad, it was nice to see it go back to the original story, by having Slenderman hunt after vulnerable children, and the acting wasn't awful. Hell, even Slenderman itself didn't look too bad, but dear god I was disappointed.The characters were flat and disappointing, with little to no development throughout the movie. The dialogue was ridiculous, with its feeble attempt at connecting to other Slenderman horror series through the "It's like a computer virus but the computer hardware is your brain" line. Especially when the virus connection has been made before, but through the physical sickness way. It would've been perfectly fine to reference MLAndersen0 or Marble Hornets by calling it a sickness or something like that. Some of the way the scenes were filmed made me think they had a GoPro attached to a selfie stick on their stomachs.I'm mostly upset with how Slenderman was portrayed, as it is the main villain and focus of this movie. Its appearance was fine, it looked nice, whatever. But... why was it crunchy? When its tendrils would move, there were crunching and cracking sounds. The way it was "summoned" into the movie was pathetic, a video? Really? Who's idea was it to make Slenderman walk? It ruined the horror factor of it, because it just looked downright silly. To quote my friend's opinion on that, he said, "Slenderman has effeminate hips." Also, why did it clip through the houses like this is a poorly rendered G-Mod map? Why did it video call the main characters? Why, why why?!To close this off, I want to mention a line that was downright insensitive. In the end scene, the younger girl says, "Messed up people doing messed up things, to make more stories to talk about" which is a very obvious connection to the stabbings that happened a long while ago. Which is... pretty yikes, to say the least. Why do people keep on bringing it up? Do you really want that poor girl to relive her trauma?

I've seen pirate VHS tapes with brighter images.Horror films are not even remotely frightening if you can't see what's going on. A bunch of screaming people running about in a pitch black scene with some booming sound effects doesn't work.Nor does showing the boogeyman well lit, it's like watching Alien and thinking "that's a guy in a rubber suit".If we can't see what's going on at all, it destroys the tension. If we can clearly see the supernatural monster in daylight, they stop being frightening.
Tbh, it was alright. Only problem i had with it is that it was kinda droned on. I liked the lore of the slenderman, but this movie kinda took its own spin on it. I wouldnt watch it again though

reviews.review_title: Not very scary, but very funny

Definitely a great watch if you want to unwind or have a good laugh with some friends but if you want some good horror, you best look elsewhere, although I will give credit where it's due and that is that there was some scary imagery in there but they were far and few between. Definitely a great romp with friends.

He has them cover their eyes because the sight of him as humans is to much to bare. He has a female soul and a male body. He loves the girls. Thats why he gently stroked her face. Shes beautiful. I've watched a lot of bad movies and Slender Man is by far the worse movie I watched. Yes a lot of movies had a bad ending or they didn't have good effects but the plot was great and it can be the other way around, but Slender Man didn't have good effects or a good ending it was just really bad. Slender man is a trashy movie because it has weak character development and a muddled plot.When the movie first started they didn't really give any specific information about the character Slender Man. As the movie started to come along they only gave a couple of details about Slender Man. I didn't really like that because if I didn't know who he was and went to go watch the movie I would be confused about who Slender Man is, I wouldn't understand what Slender Man would do. Leaving character development out is a big thing because you wouldn't understand what was going on. It makes the movie worse because you won't get the concept of the movie or the character because you don't understand.The plot made it a bad movie too. The plot was muddled. At first, everything was fine until all the girls had a sleepover and they were face timing some boys from there school, When the boys dared them to go on the dark web and watch some video. First of all, you shouldn't go on the dark web and watch some random video and second, you shouldn't be talking to boys late at night. So after they watch the video of a glitching screen they all went to bed. The next day one of the girls go missing; this is where everything just gets so confusing and stupid. All of a sudden all the girls start to feel something weird happen to them. Then the scenes just start to change to them hiding them running in the woods then hiding and holding things in the middle of the woods walking in the street at night, then more people go missing. To me this movie was very confusing it was pointless, like why are girls running in the woods in the middle of the night? Why are they walking in the middle of the road at night? Why are they walking in a cemetery? Why didn't you inform someone instead of gathering your friends to go sit in the middle of the woods to see if Slender Man comes? It just doesn't make sense to do all that extra stuff that doesn't even connect with half the movie.I do not recommend this movie to anyone. This movie overall was awful, it just didn't make sense, the movie was all over the place. For me personally, it bored the crap out of me my cousin fell asleep my mom and my sister left to go to the store, and at some point of the movie this random lady got a phone call and her conversation was even more interesting than the movie.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as some say
reviews.content: The movie as a whole is by no means mind-blowing, I'd call it mediocre at best. Though it isn't the worst movie ever made. The characters are bland and pretty forgettable. Slender man looks pretty bad. But the filming and cinematography looks surprisingly good. Much better than I expected going in to this movie. Sound design is also decent. But I ultimately think that the real pitfall of the movie is that they took the Slender Man name and made a very average movie with it. I believe many people are familiar with the creepypasta and expected a fantastic movie, which they ultimately didn't get.My verdict would be, watch it if you want to and don't be deterred by the low ratings. But don't expect it to be the best horror movie you have ever seen.

reviews.review_title: Would have been great if it were a comedy
reviews.content: I know horror movies are often cheesy, but this movie takes it to the next level. Dialogue felt forced and was difficult to listen to without a few cringes, cinematography was bland and overdone in all but one portion which lasts for almost a minute, and the general story was not good. Generally movies based on something has a clear picture of source material, and a movie like this had so much source material to work with. Multiple games, a youtube channel with enough content for multiple hours (which is something I would have appreciated seeing become the movie adaptation, so take this with a grain of salt if you will) and stories upon stories on wikis and creepypasta. None of these sources seem to have been referenced, as any ideas lifted aren't explored as much as touched upon. The villian has many powers, most of them only shown once, sometimes twice, making it feel super underwhelming. The movie drags on with various plotlines that hold no relevance, and are uninteresting and by the end the last few scenes feel rushed. Not a very good movie in the slightest.

I was familiar with the slenderman character before going to this movie. He is a creepypasta that I especially enjoy but I am also not completely informed of his origins. Going into this movie I didn't know what to expect but I knew it wouldn't be like the videogames.The concept behind the movie was very full of potential. A group of girls go online and they watch a video about slenderman. This causes them to have adverse side effects which they later discover to be slenderman. One friend goes missing and the rest have their lives flipped upside down. Overall, a good start. Nothing particularly unique but it had my attention. However, the movie starts to fall apart about halfway through. There are elements introduced that have absolutely no payoff (ex: the book that Wren finds at the library). They introduce the idea that they can get their friend back from slenderman which presents the idea that they could go on to defeat him but in the end this scene just serves as a way for their friend Chloe to be subdued by slendy. However Chloe's "illness" is barely touched on afterwards. What happens to her? Will essentially she just be a zombie? Then the end of the movie was just disappointing. Hallie goes into the woods to sacrifice herself in order to save her sister. She gives herself up to slendy and is absorbed into the slendertree. So she's a tree now. Is that what happened to Katie? Is Katie a tree now? Just seems a little lackluster to me.Overall, the movie is alright. I enjoyed the first half the most. The end just seems to lose direction. I would've enjoyed to see the girls defeat slenderman and get Katie back somehow or at least have them try to hold their own and have the audience watch and slendy overcomes and eventually takes them. I understand that bringing a creepypasta/video game into the cinematic world can be difficult but there just seemed to be no direction at all at the end which is disappointing considering how much could have been done with the character of slenderman.

reviews.review_title: If you are interested in the slenderman
reviews.content: This was my rating for the movie, mainly because I expected more. For people who don't know what the slenderman is, it may not be as dissapointing, but I always enjoyed the creepypasta story of him online. The mystery behind it is mainly what makes slenderman cool to me, but this movie just added unanswered questions. For instance, they used very stereotypical characters, who had unrealistic reactions to life or death situations at times. I'm not blaming the actors, but the way the film was planned out.I could go on for a while on this topic, but if you are interested in creepypastas like the slenderman I recommend a series called Marble Hornets. Unlike the slenderman movie, this one is a zero budget series found on youtube called an ARG. It may sound cheap, but I think the actors did a great job, and it had a better story than this movie. Essentially, I found it more interesting and there were parts that were more chilling in their own ways. (Again, this is just my opinion, Marble Hornets is not for everyone)I hope this helped :), also I apologize for grammar mistakes, english is not my first language!

But all the "know it all" people just let themselves go with the current, meaning that if they come aware that critics are destroying a movie, they of course go see it with a bad previously conceived idea, and think must hate it so critics do. It happens a lot of times. My advice is to go, see, feel and enjoy any movie you watch and create an opinion and an idea of your own. This movie is very enjoyable, mysterious and spooky. Not to be missed.

This has a lot of features of an average horror movie: the bunch of naive teenagers, the gloomy atmosphere, jump scares, creepy music, and Some Demonic Entity. Like with a lot of horror movies, I wouldn't call this a masterpiece, but it's definitely okay. I'm not a horror pro or an expert on scariness, but I can say there were a lot of moments where I was scared, because of the tension, the music and the darkness (and you didn't know whether or where Slendy was gonna pop up). What did movie did right, in my opinion, was that it showed Slender Man in all of his shapes and also that he in a way uses the internet to get to people. That made it interesting. I also liked the way he distorted the realities of the people he was infecting. A weakness of the film was that the characters didn't really get a personality. The girls would all be interchangeable I guess. I also didn't like how few screen time Slender Man actually had, and that it never becomes clear what happens to the children he takes. But overall I would say this film is worth watching, especially if you're interested in the phenomenon of Slender Man, or if you just want to see a nice and scary horror movie.

reviews.review_title: Effective flick reminiscent of Candyman/The Ring/Nosferatu
reviews.content: While not perfect this is certainly an effective movie and so much better than many other scare-flicks. In fact, it's top notch regarding atmosphere and brave at doing something different, suspense wise. The dark shadow creeping up the stairs and sliding under the door is clear hommage to Nosferatu. In fact, Slenderman is Nosferatu, be it in a new design.As for where the movie fails; there is not enough story to go around and it leaves the main characters (four teenage-girls) rather underdeveloped. Yet at the same time, thank God, not as dumb blonds stalked by a hockey-mask wearing psycho. Instead, this is a somber, surreal piece of work, with no dead bodies or any blood on screen. This isn't a movie where characters fear what they see; They fear what might be coming and it's chillingly effective. In fact, things are shown so ambiguous, suspense wise, one questions if it is happening for real or just in the minds of the characters. If this movie works it's because of the idea that events might just have been a bad dream. A nightmare.And nightmares are the scariest films of all.Verdict; An ambitious attempt at innovative horror but the story slipped somewhat under the radar. Rating; 6.

If you go in with low expectations there are a few gems in here. The phone scare and the library had me with chills but scenes like the guys' house were unintentionally hilarious. 
The actresses do a pretty good job with what they were given.  But the problem is they don't particularly stand out.  Even in the grand scheme of things with the Slender Man himself, their story is not that special.
The writer was very limited on what they could do with Slender as he has no discernible personality.  He just goes after them and screws with them in the process.  His metrology could be compared to Pennywise the Clown from IT, but with much less flare. 
There is also a big theme of hopelessness throughout the film.  They didn't meet with a scientist (which is odd because they found their book) to find a way out.  At no point did they even try to come up with a clever way to get rid of him in the end. 

A few technical great spots but there are also scenes where it's too dark to see.

Watch if you want but don't expect much in terms of substance.

Perfectly scary film!
I will not lie, guys. The jump-scares genuinely got me all of the time! They were really creative on how they delivered them, and also the transitions afterwards were really clever and well made. 
The main details about this film that I enjoyed were the foreshadowing on the main villain. For example, during one of the scenes in the bedroom, you see Slenderman's shadow emerge behind them. How scary!
Furthermore, it is a very progressive film, as I thought all of the main characters were all diversified and well written. In addition to that, the main protagonists were all female, which should be a good standard for films to come. This is a good contrast to the new Ghostbusters film, which was criticised for having an all female cast, as the cost of good writing. This film delivers both; a good diverse cast and good detailed writing. 
Very good film and would recommend to anyone who is wanting to get into the genre! 
Good tidings and viewings!

I will now tell you what I liked and disliked about this film.

What I LIKED:
-Slender Man's design: 
I liked how they made this suit look like it's part of his body.

-The Soundtrack: 
It's one of those moments where the music from the film is better than what it came from.

-Javier Botet's performance: 
a spanish actor known for playing The Crooked Man from the 2016 film "The Conjuring 2" and Leper from the 2017 and 2019 films "IT Chapter 1" and "IT Chapter 2" plays the Slender Man in this film, and like always, Botet puts on a good performance.

What I DISLIKED:

- Screentime: 
Slender Man, The Character who's name is in the title, has three minutes of screentime. Seriously, Imagine if you had your own movie and you only had 5 minutes of Screentime.

-The Characters: 
They were flat like paper, Who would want to watch a horror film where some group of teenagers scream every 5 damn seconds? And due to them summoning Slender Man for some reason, their dumbass actions get themselves disappearing one by one.

-The Ending: 
Okay... What? So Basically this film ends with one of the characters getting teleported to the forest where the Slender Man is located, she encounters and gets chased by Slender Man, The character gets turned into a tree just to save her sister, and then the sister talks about how the slender sickness spreads or something and then the film ends. Like.. what?

-The PG-13 rating: 
This rating really bothers me, I don't remember Slender Man being a PG-13 Character... And this was probably the reason a fuckton of scenes were cut.

-False Advertising:
Lots and lots of scenes from the trailers ended up getting cut. hell, even a character named "Allison" ended up being cut,

At the end of the day, This Movie is pretty "meh" that really could've been better and I wouldn't recommend it.

I'm a big fan of Joey King, but she wasn't really in a positive to save the movie.

The production value is obviously there, the effects are even good, and there are several intense moments that should set the atmosphere, but I just couldn't bring myself to care.

The writing has to be to blame.  It's 4-5 shallow, empty characters with just enough flavor to tell them apart, and I just can't care about them.

The movie focuses on the subtly of it all, the growing madness that Slender Man instills in his victims without properly building the tension or showing the characters slowly losing it, which would have given good actors the ability to save it.  Instead they use a lot of "it happened offscreen" or sudden cuts to show a lose of time, and we get a character suddenly looking confused instead of taking the audience on a journey with the character.

Maybe it's not the writing, and maybe the editor just didn't know what they were doing?  "What are all these long dramatic series in here?  This is so boring!  *cut* Eh, they'll get the point."

The film has some interesting ideas that are only slightly touched upon at the very end. The idea of Slenderman being like a virus who spreads due to more and more stories surfacing about him on the internet, causing more people to seek him out and become entrapped in his twisted mind games until he eventually kills them is a very interesting concept that the film sadly doesn't follow through with. The film instead devolves into a mess of sloppily used horror tropes like jumpscares, bland characters who only have a slight hint of depth, and terribly rendered CGI used to create the main villain. In the end, this all results in a film that you'll find ironically entertaining wrather than genuinely great.

Damn it.  Just, damn it.  You can do a good Slender Man movie, you can do a great Slender Man movie.  Really just take the concepts you see in something like Sinister, and add the creepiness of films like Ouija 2 and you're set.  What Slender Man should have done is been one of those films that plays on technological fears and senses of paranoia, and used it's scares with subtlety.  There's a new brand of horror a lot of films do now where there will just be something in the background, and they won't dwell on it, it'll just be there.  Maybe you'll see it, maybe you won't, and that's what's creepy about it.  That's perfect for Slender Man, that's really what was creepy about him in those original images that made him popular in the first place.  And at times, this movie almost does that.  The weird thing is there are glimpses of what could be a good movie in here, like the director knew what made Slender Man scary but then the studio said "no, more jumps scares, more Sony product placement", and now here we are, just another cheap teen horror movie like every teen horror movie.  Literally this is just another teen horror movie, it's got all the ingredients of one: over the top acting, jumbled editing, big CGI jump scares, Joey King screaming at things, all the ingredients.  It's so frustrating because Slender Man is one of our modern monsters and he is a good one and he can be so scary, but this movie doesn't know what makes him scary.  Watching it I went from hopeful, to bored, to frustrated, to pissed off, to just disappointed.

I'm going to admit: I had very low expectations going into this film and it somehow didn't even reach those. This movie isn't the so-bad-it's-good kind; it's very much the opposite. I wasn't entertained at all. The best thing this movie had was the titular antagonist, the internet phenomenon that is Slender Man. Even years after it stopped being relevant it still posessed a certain creepiness factor. And yet he was heavily underutilised, appearing in the flesh in only a couple of scenes. He mostly infulences the protagonists psychologically through dream sequences or some hallucionatinons but rarely do we see him actually doing something. It's merely implied and that is a big misstep. The movie is also filled with sequences that obviously lead to a jumpscare of some kind and there one can see the lack of creativity behind the scenes. The actors don't do the film any favors as well. They try their best, in particular Joey King, with the script they are given but it doesn't seem to work. The characters just aren't compelling at all. That along with the very incoherent plot make the film almost unwatchable. For the first, say, 15 minutes I was actually thinking that it wasn't that bad but after the first girl that disappears everything just goes downhill. I'd say there are a few solid creepy scenes in the film that showcase what it potentially could have been but it just seems incompetent at what it's trying to do in this final form. It's a 1 for me.

Technically speaking, this might not fully qualify as a movie. It's certainly a recording of actors talking and moving, but Slender Man lacks any pretense of artistic expression. Also, it somehow fails to meet even the criteria of a film genre that has already relegated itself to lower than substandard expectations. Month by month we see shitty jump-scare horrors all as indistinguishable from one to the next, promising some transient thrills with boring, boring, BANG dynamics. Yet it not only fails to tell a compelling story in any regard to its ill-timed and criminally (literally) insensitive boogieman, but it also fails to deliver in the already lazy formula it is reliant upon. It's an utter waste of scream queen Annalise Basso who goes missing within the first 15 minutes despite her being the actress with the most credentials. Joey King of The Kissing Booth takes center stage and does her best (which isn't all that great) with the anachronistic dialogue written by a 50 year old man trying his best to capture the spirit of high school aged girls.

Slender Man has moments that are solid and have the makings of being a terrific and truly scary film. It presents an eerie atmosphere, as the majority of the scenes are shot at night with dark lit rooms, fog slowly creeping in the background, and ventures into the deep unforgiving woods that forces us to constantly scan the background for a shadowy figure. The acting is sufficient, I thought Julia Goldani Telles stood out and played this role quite well. With all of this going for Slender Man, its main downfall is that it lacks a fluid story that captivates its audiences. The pacing is erratic throughout the film, characters are so busy that I was never able to connect with any of them. Despite some nice visuals and tense moments, the main villain Slender Man also fails to be scary, he comes across as a generic boogeyman that we never really learn much about. Overall, I didn't think this was a bad horror film, it definitely has certain qualities about it that passes as watchable, but I feel like a much better movie is somewhere deep in those woods.

I suppose this movie was inevitable.  So this is about a group of four high school girls.  They do a Google search for Slender Man, summon him like fools, and now they have to try to survive.  Now I do actually do like the lore of Slender Man... to an extent.  In a sense, it is the internet's version of a campfire story.  I think it's a fun to look for him in the background of pictures online, and I do enjoy playing the video games, as simple as they may be.  That said, I can sniff out a turkey pretty far in advance, and there was no real reason for this movie to be put into existence.  The mystique is largely what makes this character as effective as he is, so why are they making a narrative focused on learning more about him?  This was about as terrible as I was expecting, and may God help you if you were excited for this.  Right out of the gates, this starts off on the wrong foot with these girls.  They don't talk like natural people, they talk more like how adults think teens talk, and it is awkward.  It is not helped by the fact that these girls aren't the best of actors, which is hindered even further because nobody in this makes logical choices.  Not to get into spoiler territory (I just know there are people out there that don't want Slender Man spoiled for them), but there are way too many points where you will audibly talk to the screen, asking hard-hitting questions like: "why don't you go to the cops?" or, "why don't you talk to an adult?"  This is a folly of many a horror movie but here, it is considerably worse because it is so noticeable.  To further exacerbate things, in the smack dab middle of when these girls are dealing with Slender Man, they take a break to bicker about boys.  Why?  Because this is written by somebody who does not have a clear understanding of how sensible human beings operate.  I don't think that this is the worst thing in the world, it is just a very poorly conceived horror flick.  It is basic, and when this thing is finally wrapping up, there are way too many dream sequences for you to even start being scared.  They make up the rules as they go along, so much so that the rules in this universe aren't clearly defined enough so that you feel threatened.  It gets tedious with the amount of research they do on computers, and there is even bad lighting to boot.  Yeah, this is a big time waste of your time.

Slender Man (2 out of 5 stars). Slender Man had potential in actually being a creepy scary film. A tall, faceless, and long arms mysterious being does sound creepy when it is lurking in the forests, stalking people. The film fails to even being a scary movie. It has everything that fails in its cliché of horror movies. Stupid teens, boring direction that lacks scares and consistent scenes. Lets not forget the plot does feel more like a rip off from The Ring movies. The characters are all bad and lacking in characteristics that you would root for. These teens made the stupid decision to watch a video of a slender man on a website. From there, Slender man is stalking these teens one by one. Luring them into the forest or traumatizing them to the part they go insane. Teens make the stupid decision and it is difficult to even care for them. Also, if it is a plot hole or something. But where are all there parents. They go walking around their homes on a school night, yelling and screaming cause something is coming inside their homes. And no adult supervision is found. Until, one of the kids ends up in a hospital and the parents finally show up out of nowhere. The direction is lacking comprehensive with its storytelling. Characters go missing when one of the girls is trying to reach her boyfriend. You really do not hear back about what happened to him. The acting is dull. Joey King, Julia Goldani Telles, Jaz Sinclair, and Annalise Basso were all tedious with their performance. The script also was lacking in characteristics with their characters. Which made it hard for you to even care for them. The plot was similar to The Ring. Except, they are being stalked by a mysterious tall, skinny, faceless man. It does have some creepy moments. But it fails with its cliché horror storytelling. And the climax and third act gets lazy with its storytelling. That is not even sure how to end the film. With one character going insane in the hospital and decides to face the slender man herself. Overall, Slender Man is a bad film. It lacks scares and suspense. Characters make stupid decisions. Acting is boring. The direction is lazy and the script lacks in fleshing out their characters. Only good thing is Slender Man is kind of creepy.

Despite the other ratings, I watched this movie with anticipation. In the end disappointed. Not because of the somewhat generic storyline or achetype characters, but by the over censorship. Sure, Its DEFINITELY one of those horror movies you can guess what's gonna happen next, but I think concidering the subject matter and general tone of this movie, its more of a charm then a let down, and while the character archetypes are predictable, the actors preformances where amazing enough that you still found yourself attaching to the characters. My problem is the deleted scenes. I watched as the eye stab from the trailer didn't happen, as the girls just suddenly had the laptop, and we were all left qondering what would happen to that boy. It left me with a bittersweet feeling at the end, because while I did enjoy the movie for what it was, there were obvious pieces in it missing that I was left to fill. And all because they said they didn't qant to be offensive. Which I don't think they even achieved. In my eyes there is no way to not make this movie and not have it be offensive, honestly. So, you either make the movie or don't. Unless they decide to ever release a directors' cut ( which I think we all know is very unlikely), then I guess I'll be left with the bittersweet feeling of a good movie that's only partly done...

The crazy thing about the story or urban legend which provided the basis for this film is that both Screenwriter (David Birke) and Director (Sylvain White) pretty much failed with connecting their fictional story in relation to certain real life moments that popularized Slender Man. The movie was way to involved with the four main characters, whom all of them in that group had a very bland personality traits where the movie instantly began to become lackluster with the obvious small town suburban like characteristics, which quite had me disinterested in the story of this film. 

In my opinion, Slender Man should obviously be the main attraction and this film missed a big opportunity in using the poise and feminized strutting catwalk that Slender Man does when chasing it's victims. Pretty much Slender Man is like a haunted or devilish runway model or influenced fashion queen that stutters the runway with purpose chasing after you, showcasing a kind of Mike Myers and Freddy Krueger type way of horror.
